results.description:
In this group, you'll learn new ways of communicating in order to share more vulnerably and openly, bring attention more fully to the present in order to discover the richness of whats happening in relationship with others, and begin to see and co-explore aspects of yourself you may have been unaware of before in service of greater self-understanding, expression and awareness.  

You'll have the opportunity to learn and use new tools to participate in circles by sharing yourself, understanding others, and growing in both enjoyment of and capacity for presence and deep connection.

The more Ive seen people Circle the more genuine, " in the moment" conversations Ive seen become possible for them.

Likewise, the more Ive seen them become comfortable in their own skin, get clear on what their feeling, wanting or needing in any moment, grow in a sense of presence and natural interest in others, and generally embody a deep capacity for presence and authenticity.

If connecting profoundly with others, developing present moment awareness, and learning new communication skills inspires you, come try Circling out! 

The cost is $20
results.name: Tuesday Night Circling; Creating Presence and Connection

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Turn up the heat and own your Summer with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your SUMMER with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call

results.description:
Presenter: James Solomon

From making small websites in high school, to taking some web courses in college I have been a web developer for over 10 years now.  My main language has always been PHP.  From CakePHP, CodeIgniter, Zend and now Symfony, frameworks have been helping and challenging me for a long time now.Presentation: How Spotify.com transitioned to Symfony  


Presentation:


Spotify.com has always been powered by PHP.  However it was difficult to maintain our custom, non-MVC based code. With ongoing business needs to cope with, we needed the ability to migrate gradually.  Symfony gave us the ability to do that. The talk will focus on how we approached this problem, how we solved it using the unique capabilities of Symfony, and where we are going next.

What is meditation and what exactly is one "practicing" in meditation: non-attachment? forms of introspection? contemplations on compassion? mindfulness? Suggested books on meditation include “Waking Up” by Sam Harris and “Breath by Breath” by Larry Rosenberg.

A suggested article on the subject is "How to Meditate” by Sam Harris. 

Scott Stafiej is a middle school science teacher in Brooklyn, NY. His meditation experience has been most highly influenced by various Buddhist meditation practices.

results.description:
I’m one of those hybrid designer/developers. Unicorn? No. I failed FizzBuzz in an interview as a result of a self-taught skill-set and an ambiguous job posting. Does that mean I’m not a “real” developer? To some yes, to others no. Then what do I call myself? Am I a liar, a fake? Whatever the case, I’m not alone here.

This isn’t the impostor syndrome. It’s the result of an industry in its awkward twenties; it’s identity crisis and it’s ego. We aren’t fakes, we just don’t know how to accurately communicate our skills. In this talk, I’ll start by reviewing the heated responses to an article I wrote about the above scenario. Then I’ll propose a four part lexicon for job titles and descriptions in the web industry; a vocabulary that both standardizes our roles, yet allows for the rapidly changing nature of what we do. Whether or not my lexicon is the one that works, let’s start talking about it.

Takeaways:

• A call to be more conscious of terminology in job postings, and suggestions for simple changes to descriptions.

• Evaluating candidates’ qualifications: getting away from the idea of a “checklist”, focusing more on a capacity to learn, passion for the craft, and community participation.

• A system of terms and definitions (lexicon) for job postings where all job titles follow a three part structure:

• Junior, Mid-level, or 

• SeniorSkill-set (e.g. backend, frontend, UX, etc.)

• Generalist or Specialist

• Start a conversation around the standardization of job titles and descriptions.

• Propose a structured way to format job postings.

https://camo.githubusercontent.com/a303695eef33957f054aef873483cbf4ddf96ac1/687474703a2f2f73747566662e6e6f746c617572612e636f6d2f696d616765732f6865616473686f742e706e67

Lara Schenck is an independent web consultant and teacher in New York City. She teaches front-end development to designers at Pratt Institute, facilitates corporate trainings with Decoded, and organizes private classes and workshops. Lara is a dedicated cocktail enthusiast and grew up on a llama farm outside of Pittsburgh (true story).
results.name: Why the Designer Failed FizzBuzz

results.description:
By now, you've probably heard...

...about Tesla's new Powerwall, a home battery that's captured the imagination of the tech world for the past few months.

This is just one of many headlines that are making the news surrounding battery technology. With new concepts such as wireless and ultra-fast charging batteries, quantum batteries, and extended-life applications such as in cars, there's really a world of potential. In this meetup we'll be having a think tank on the future of battery technology, along with new product ideas that can be pursued and brought to reality. The sky is the limit here. Let's go crazy.

New format

Upon request from existing Tankers, we'll be having more intimate events over the next several weeks. These will be focused on having in-depth discussions that get into technical details and lead to action steps for those who want to run with new ideas.

Attendance limit

We'll be capping the attendance limit since the venue is smaller, but if you have directly applicable skills, interest, or experience, email me directly and I'll send you an RSVP confirmation as long as we're not breaking any (major) fire codes. 

You may have noticed the change in venue name (Skunkworks) as well - if you're not familiar with the term, I'd encourage you to Google it! 

Cheers!


-Dan

Booze & Snacks: Kiss Ventures

Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage

results.description:
*** PLEASE NOTE THE VENUE CHANGE *** 

This month we are venturing out of our comfy spot in DUMBO and headed to the city. The folks over at ustwo have graciously offered to host us in their brand new office space in the Financial District. Check in with Security in the lobby (make sure your RSVP includes your real name!) then head to the 16th floor. They will be providing food & drinks as well :)

Ricky Robinett (Developer Evangelist @ Twilio) will be encouraging us to build our first open source project in Swift while reminding us there's no reason to feel nervous because everyone's a n00b. Matt Isaacs (iOS @ ustwo) will follow with a discussion around the intricacies of recursion in Swift.

See you on the 25th!


Ricky Robinett: Hey You! Build An Open Source Swift Project (Even If No One Uses It)
Releasing your code out into the world as an open source project can be intimidating. But remember, every single Swift developer in the world has between 0 and 14 months experience. This is just one of the many reasons why I think you, yes YOU!, should take on the challenge. I'll share a bit about my experience building SwiftRequest and why it's been a rewarding journey... even if no one else uses it :)

Bio: Ricky is a Brooklyn, NY based hacker currently working as a Developer Evangelist at Twilio. He’s focused on creating fun and entertaining apps. His apps have been used by hundreds of thousands of users and covered in multiple media outlets including: CNN, Huffington Post, TechCrunch, Mashable, VentureBeat and the Today Show. You can contact Ricky on twitter or via email.


Matt Isaacs: Better Recursion with Swift
This month we're going back to basics with a deep dive into recursion. "Recursion is purely a syntactical nicety, and carries a lot of overhead." I hear you say. Generally true, but Swift has some special features that we can leverage to get over many of the issues typically associated with recursion. Join us if you'd like to know more!


Bio: Matt is an electrical engineer who made the jump from building hardware to writing software about 7 years ago - starting with device drivers and firmware, and has been climbing up the stack ever since. He now works on a variety of things mostly involving iOS at ustwo.
results.how_to_find_us: Check in with Security then take the elevator to the 16th floor

results.description:
Questions/Scriptures to be discussed include:

1. Why does God permit so much evil in the world?
2. What does mankind's future look like, as per the Bible?
3. Are science and faith mutually exclusive? Could they be reconciled with each other?
4. What happens when a man dies?
5. What has happened over 2000 years of church history and how has that changed Christianity from its original version?
6. Can the Bible be harmonized from Genesis to Revelation? Does it contradict itself anywhere?
7. What is the Kingdom of Heaven?
8. Why did Jesus tell so many parables (more than 90%) about his upcoming Kingdom?
9. What's the purpose of this Kingdom of God?
10. Why is it taking so long to come? Hasn't it been 2000 years since Jesus?
results.name: Tuesday Evening Bible Study (Newport)

results.description:
Check out our website:   www.NYCommunityChoir.com for  more information and to pre-pay for sessions and save money.

LOCATION
520 Eighth Avenue - 16th Floor


Join us weekly on Tuesdays for a soulful and uplifting musical experience that’s designed to include anyone who loves to sing – shower singers and professionals alike. 

Our sessions incorporate vocal technique training, choral singing, music-oriented meditation, community and relationship building activities, creative play, and musical improvisation and games all within a supportive, non-judgmental family environment. 

Music selections are soulful, spirit-driven Gospel, Broadway, Spiritual, World Music, chanting, Pop/Rock with lyrics that are universally accessible to people of any religious belief (no He, Him or Jesus). 

Each session is co-taught by industry seasoned professionals: Artistic Director, Amy Silverman, a wonderful accompanist Emily Imes, and, at most sessions, we also have a guest powerhouse musical director. We’re lucky to have many talented and in-demand musical directors and conductors who feel committed to our success and growth. 

Plan to be musically guided and inspired by the leadership of  Lesley Kernochan, Troy Burton, Chris Dilley and other fantastic surprise guest conductors.


===================================

WHAT TO EXPECT:

Choir Rehearsal + Jam Session + Singing Technique Training + Expressive Creative Activities + Amazing Family-like Supportive Community of People Who Love to Sing + Conscious, Spiritual and Soulful Approach + Professional, Dynamic Leaders


===================================

WHAT PARTICIPANTS HAVE SAID:

"Amy, words can't express (maybe I can sing it???) the amount of love and gratitude I have for you and everyone for participating last night. The experience was powerful, healing and joyful. I felt whole and complete in my voice in a way I've never felt before. I've always wanted to sing but haven't had the opportunity to really pursue. It's great the Universe has brought me this one that feels perfect. What a great combination of community building and sharing our hearts through song. I was very moved and can't wait to come back. Much love to you all!!" - Doug Larson

"It was an amazing experience, thank you very much for putting this all together. Ive been looking for a space like this, to express myself, for a long time and I cant believe I found it!!!! I'm looking forward to our next gathering. Thanks again!!!" - Vicky Vernier

===================================

REGISTRATION AND LOGISTICS

What does it cost?

$10 for first time guests (pay in person)


$25 pay in person
$22 pay in advance online

And discounted packages are available when you pay for 5, 10, 15 or all of the sessions in a group.

 


===================================


QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS

Do I have to commit to coming all the time?
Nope - just come check us out - we hope you'll want to come consistently but there's room for everyone, even drop-ins!

Do I have to be a "singer"?
No - you just have to love to sing!

What do I need to bring?
Voice recorder or Smart Phone
Water Bottle
Open mind and heart
Desire to sing and connect playfully


I can't attend, how do I find out more about future opportunities?

 

Send an email to  [masked]  and say "please add me to your mailing list!"


I'm keeping everyone updated in the NY "I Love To Sing" Community Choir Group 
https://www.facebook.com/groups/529840427030696/?ref=ts&fref=ts

results.description:
Join us for our weekly Boardgaming Meetup at Cobblestone's pub. We're a friendly group of gamers that play everything from Monopoly to Ticket to Ride to Zombicide! Everyone is welcome - all ages (must be over 21) but must be young at heart!

If you don't recognize the games, don't worry, everyone is happy to teach new players the rules.

We usually go for about 3-4 hours but people drop in any time and leave when they need to. If you're looking for a chill, fun way to spend a Tuesday night - come!

To support our awesome, not-too-loud, well-lit venue, please purchase a bite to eat or a few drinks (soda is fine!).  Cobblestones informed us that there is a $15 minimum per person.

If anyone has a specific game they wish to play,  feel free to ask.  I am sure between us all, we should have it.

We also have a Facebook group.  Everyone in the Meetup is welcome.  Just click the link and ask to join.  Someone will add you once they can.

Forest Hills Board Gamers Facebook Group
results.name: Tuesday Night Weekly Game Night at Cobblestones

results.description:
PART V   "Exposing the Enemies of Freedom"

THIS EVENT IS OPEN TO THE PUBLIC

ADMISSION: Menu Purchase

FOR INFO: Kip Webster 973 - 934 - 1775

[masked]


Most Americans are not taught what’s in the Constitution, nor are they aware of its limitations on government that have helped make America great.

The John Birch Society has a new series of DVDs for you to learn how the Constitution was intended to secure our rights, not to enable the federal government to violate our rights.

You’re invited to attend a series of workshops that will provide you with a practical, common sense understanding of how the Constitution was intended to limit the government, not the citizens. This understanding will equip you to work with others to solve many of the problems Americans face every day.

Classes will include a DVD presentation and group discussion.

results.description:
Please join us for a very *special edition* of our Tuesday evening run.

Meet us just inside the park entrance at 52nd Street and 39th Drive (a block north of Skillman Ave.) at 7pm, as we head out for an informal mini-pub run! This week, we will commemorate the waning days of summer and celebrate our neighborhood pubs by hitting three venues over the course of 3ish casual miles.

You are under no obligation to drink if you don't want to (you can certainly watch the rest of us if you'd like). Please bring cash (smaller bills, if possible) to keep things moving smoothly.

Please note:
- You must be on-time, or you won't know where we're headed. We will not be posting a route map (the route is firmly planted in your organizer's brain, which is not internet-accessible or hackable).
- This will NOT be a loop run back to Windmuller Park (although, we won't finish too far away).
- Obviously, you must be 21+ to participate in the drinking part of this adventure. Please bring ID and be prepared to show it, if asked by the bartender.

- - - - - -

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:50 pm, Thu. 11 am – 12 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

 

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles
results.how_to_find_us: CRS is located one block east of Broadway and one and a half blocks south of Union Square, above Think Coffee shop.
results.name: Walk-In Spiritual Healing Clinic

NATURAL SOLUTIONS with ESSENTIAL OILS ~

How and why oils work
Essential Oil Quality  Varied uses of essential oils

How to incorporate oils into your everyday life
How to live a natural lifestyle

Healthcare Professionals Network invites all professionals in healthcare across all functions and roles in the industry to come together to network.

This is the place to get new business contacts, find a new job, identify new customers and vendors, announce your start-up, volunteer for a not-for-profit patient organization, and meet new friends.

results.description:
We will be meeting at Info Commons in room #4.   PLEASE NOTE that we limit attendance to better insure that all get a chance to have their writing critiqued.  If our maximum for the week is reached, you have the option of being notified when someone changes their RSVP to no.  PLEASE DO NOT RSVP YES UNLESS YOU ARE AS SURE AS IS HUMANLY POSSIBLE THAT YOU WILL BE ABLE TO ATTEND AND CHANGE YOUR RSVP TO NO IMMEDIATELY if your situation does change, for the sake of those waiting for a spot.  


Join us for a weekly get together of sometimes frank and hopefully always constructive criticism of your literary work. There is no restriction on the type of genre and only a few rules:

1. Bring up to 6 double spaced typed pages of your work for reading. Additional copies would be helpful in order to allow others in the group to follow along.

2. The author is not allowed to speak while feedback is being provided.

3. The same piece should not be reread at a future workshop.

We will meet every Tuesday at 7 PM on the first floor of the Central Library, unless a meetup is not scheduled for that date due to a holiday or other event. A floor plan link is available at http://www.brooklynpubliclibrary.org/sites/default/files/files/pdf/central/floorplan.pdf.

More information about the Brooklyn Central Library, including available public transportation options, can be found at http://www.brooklynpubliclibrary.org/locations/central.

Hope to see all of you there.

David
results.name: David's Writers Workshop

results.description:
Continuing the EA discussion, we're meeting up in an apartment this time! As usual, this will be a mix of socializing and chatting about EA. This time we will cover a few topics in addition to open discussion:

- Who is the person who did the most good in the 20th century?

- EA has been accused of a lack of diversity. Is this a fair critique and what should be done to address it?

- Moral Trade: Let's make a deal! Are their opportunities for trade for people with different moral priorities to trade off activities? Will you go vegan if I vote for Donald Trump? Our guest from Oxford, Rune Kvist will explain the idea and lead the discussion.

I will have some red wine. We might order some food on Seamless. Otherwise BYO. Please let me know any questions.

Chris Corliss

Job Interview Techniques & Practice Workshop

August 25th 2015

Ticket pre-purchase is required to confirm your seat at this hands-on interview techniques, practice and coaching workshop.

Click Here To Buy Tickets

You may have a great resume, but how are your interviewing skills?

Whether you are a student, new grad, experienced professional or career changer, If you experience any of the following, this event is for you:

*Are you getting interviews, but not getting any job offers?

*Are you unclear on how to communicate your transferable skills effectively?

*Do you have a hard time preparing/organizing your thoughts before answering interview questions?

*Do “Tell me about yourself” or “Why should we hire you?” cause you anxiety?

Click Here To Buy Tickets

At our Job Interview Techniques & Practice Workshop, you will:

*Learn fresh, new strategies, methods and techniques to help prepare for a powerful job interview

*Practice your answers in small groups and receive instant coaching/feedback

*Observe a mini mock interview in person

*Discover the top interview questions you must always be ready for

*Get inside the minds of recruiters and the top traits they’re looking for/assessing you on

*Learn how to structure and answer behavioral/scenario-based questions

*Powerfully transform your interview acumen and confidence

Ready to change the entire perspective you’re going to interviews with and position yourself for a job offer?

Complimentary snacks will be served. 

Click Here To Buy Tickets

Purchase your ticket here now to ensure your seat.

Workshop Leader:

Vicki Aubin, Career Coach

Vicki Aubin (aka 'The Rockin’ Career Coach') is a career consultant, speaker and author based in New York City who helps passion-driven professionals to unleash their inner rockstar, market their juiciest talents, and fast-track their escape to a kick-ass career that makes them come alive. Vicki acts as communications strategist and 'co-pilot' for career transitioners, helping them to amplify and own their strongest, transferable skills and strengths, make a powerful first impression and do the work they were meant to do.

With a career that has spanned over 10 years in Human Resources and Recruiting (including roles at Goldman Sachs, Deloitte & Touche, Morgan Stanley and as an executive headhunter), Vicki is a successful career transitioner, a featured guest on LinkedIn’s Ask An Expert Series, and a mock interviewer at The NYU Stern School of Business.

You can find Vicki dishing out her unique mix of rockin’ career mindfuel and personal marketing know-how on her YouTube channel. @rockincareer https://www.linkedin.com/in/vickiaubin

Like all our events, this event will sell out ahead of time, and is limited to X participants.

Get full event details and register here:

Click Here To Buy Tickets
results.name: Job Interview Techniques & Practice Workshop - HOW TO GET THE JOB!

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

SoccerBeyond.com
[masked]


Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

results.description:
http://photos3.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/5/6/b/b/event_7042203.jpegCome join your peers from Westchester County and the surrounding areas (hello Bronx, Connecticut, Orange and Putnam Counties) in a lively, friendly, facilitated discussion group for men, women, genderqueer, transgender, and not-quite-sure people, as well as people who fall on different places along the monogamous to polyamorous dimension, as long as you inhabit the space between totally straight and totally gay somewhere (i.e., bisexual, bi-curious, questioning, queer, “I don’t label myself,” bi-friendly or some other non-monosexual identity).

People who wish to understand their bisexual loved ones are also welcome.

This group is for people over 18. It is NOT a hook-up group. As the name says, we meet to talk about bisexual issues. People whose behavior makes other group members uncomfortable will be asked to leave.

The group meets at The LOFT, the LGBTQ safe space in White Plains, Westchester County, New York at 7:30 PM on the 2nd and 4th Tuesdays of every month.

Even if you can't always make it to the group meetings in person, please join us on line, ask questions, chat, make some "net-friends" and keep up with what is happening in the Westchester County and surrounding bisexual community.
results.name: 4th Tuesday Westchester Bisexual Discussion & Support Group

results.description:
Now you can take a live Insanity class at Clove Lakes Park by Certified Insanity Fitness Instructors, Marie-Elena Aruta and Michelle McKenzie.  Bring a guest your first visit and your first class is 1/2 off.
This revolutionary cardio-based total-body conditioning program is based on the principles of MAX interval training. INSANITY pushes the participants to new training heights, resulting in more calories burned, faster results and more efficient metabolism. This interval training is the pinnacle of cardio training. You don't have to be in extreme shape - levels of each exercise are provided.
Insanity's not your traditional interval workout. It replaces traditional moderate-intensity exercise with maximum-intensity exercise, and trades short intervals of intensity for short periods of rest. The secret? Long periods of explosive intensity. You’ll do cardio and plyometric drills with intervals of strength, power, resistance, and core training. With Insanity, you can burn up to 1,000 calories in an hour. Participants experience faster increases in cardiovascular fitness and burn carbohydrates and fat more efficiently.

Class Description:
PLYOMETRICS for insane legs and gluts, UPPER BODY RESISTANCE for sculpted arms, shoulders, chest, and back. PURE CARDIO for crazy fat burn and CARDIO ABS with intensive core work so you can get awesome abs. 50 minutes: All Levels Welcome!
☆☆☆$10.00 for a limited time only☆☆☆

results.description:
***Note: This event is for experienced players only (NTRP rating 3.0 and above)***


Join us for Summer Tennis at Lincoln Park under lights from till 11 pm.

Upon arrival, check in at the Clubhouse before proceeding to the courts.

Please follow these GUIDELINES for an enjoyable tennis session:

1. Members shall meet outside the Clubhouse at the scheduled time.

2. First two to arrive shall reserve a court with the Clubhouse staff.

3. Post the details (court #, names of players) on meetup comments, and then start playing.

4. As more members arrive, they may join in on the posted court# if space is available (max. 4 players per court), while continuing to update the player count on the comments.

5. If the posted court is full, wait till at least one other player arrives, and then reserve a new court. Then repeat from step 3. :-)

Important Information Regarding Court Reservations:

• Reservation is free for Hudson County residents. Those outside of Hudson County may play as guests of the residents to avoid a possible $10 fee.

• Minimum two players must be present to reserve a court.

RSVP Etiquette:

• Please keep your RSVP updated because others are looking to find partners to hit with. Remove your name from the list if you are not planning to attend.

• No shows may be bumped from future events.

Inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

Thank you all for this great group!
results.name: Tuesday 8pm Tennis at Lincoln Park - Experienced 3.0+ Players Only

Every month we feature FOUR great nude and semi-nude art models, our amazing DJ who seems to know all your favorite tunes, and some of the city's most unique and exciting performance artists! And if you need more inspiration, our venue, Otto's, is one of the most outstanding tiki bars serving up some really colorful and amazing cocktails and beers!

This month, we offer you music, magic and more!
Music from our own Mike Ogletree!
Story telling from the star of stage and screen, Gregory Levine!
And More to come!

Just bring your favorite drawing materials and your coolest friends, and plan to have a great time!

This is a great event or artists of all levels, from pros to total beginners, and makes a great date, too. You can come and leave at any time, but come early for a good seat.

All this amazement for a mere $20 smackers at the door!

As always:
Over 21 only--I.D. will be checked
Admission price does not include beverages
No outside beverages
No photography
Bring your own art supplies

results.description:
Hecho En Dumbo is a critics’ pick restaurant from Chef Danny Mena, who is widely recognized as one of NYC's top Mexican chefs. After stints at Blue Hill and The Modern, Chef Mena opened the restaurant as an expression of love for his hometown of Mexico City. The menu is comprised of refined rustic Mexican staples as well as contemporary cuisine from his homeland. Breads, tortillas, salsas, and even cheeses are all made fresh in-house. We’ll be taking over their speakeasy-esque private dining space for this feast!

Please note, you MUST rsvp via the link below to grab seats. We won't be able to accommodate guests who haven't rsvp'd via this link. RSVP at: https://tastingcollective.com/events/7

Feel free to pass this dinner along to friends! The price is $45 plus tax and gratuity (covers all of the food).

Looking forward to seeing you guys there!

-Kristine

7 COURSE MEXICAN FEAST
All dishes are served family-style

Guacamole
with house-made yellow corn tortilla chips

Ensalada de Acelgas
with swiss chard, pumpkin seed, bacon, oyster mushrooms and a creamy lemon vinaigrette

Vuelve a la Vida
classic Mexican ceviche with Portuguese octopus, gulf shrimp and fresh fluke in a spicy tomato broth

Queso Fundido de Rajas
melted Oaxacan and asadero cheeses with roasted poblano pepper and onion, served with warm flour tortillas and house salsas

Pescado a la Talla
Grilled black sea bass rubbed in a jalapeño aioli and topped with baby shrimp sautéed with garlic and mint, served with saffron Mexican, and cherry tomato and cucumber salad

Chile Relleno
Roasted chile poblano stuffed with roasted oyster mushrooms, baby leeks and fennel in a creamy chile guajillo salsa

Postre
A variety of Hecho en Dumbo’s signature desserts including Pastel Imposible, Tres Leches, and Pastel Chocolate

results.description:
Do you like getting up early and starting the day with inspiring conversations or even better: pair programming on your pet project? This is your meetup! :) 

Skip the morning run and instead meet us between 6:30 AM and 9:30 AM bi-weekly to chat, code and have the first coffee together to start the day off with developers or other software professionals who care about the quality of the code and passionately looking for ways to improve themselves. 

The venue: There is a Starbucks open from 5:30 am and behind it the lobby of The Lexington NYC hotel, which is a pretty cool space, they have free, fast wi-fi, plenty of seating and a lot of sockets in the wall :) I asked, and we are allowed to gather so don't be shy and have a look around. There are seats downstairs and on the mezzanine as well, upstairs, where the restrooms are too. See you there!

results.description:
I am excited to share that I am participating in a GrassRoots movement with people here in our community and around the world. I help facilitate strictly educational classes which provide exposure to education we otherwise wouldn’t have an option for or, at least, easy access to. 


Topics include:

1.  Altered Food and How the foundation of our food have been modified and the consequences

2. Vitamins & Minerals What’s natural about being synthetic? As it applies to supplementation 

 The Science of Glycobiology.  What is glycosylation and how does it affect the proper function of your immune system? 

      In today's modern world, one out of twenty five people suffer from autoimmune disorder.  Stress, pollutions in the environment, and the lack of nutrition found in our foods are not all but a few causes which contribute to an immune disorder.   


Glycobiology is the study of the structure, function and biology of carbohydrates, also called glycans, which are widely distributed in nature. It is a small but rapidly growing field in biology, GLYCOBIOLOGY AS IMMUNE   

While sugar-nutrients do not treat specific diseases, they do allow for the cells to send proper messages within the body. When our cells communicate clearly, it is amazing what the immune system is capable of doing. Our bodies know how to make corrections and restore proper function, given the raw materials they need. These critical sugars are like the vowels in our alphabet. When the vowels are in place we understand our conversation.  

Glycans are complex carbohydrate structures that cover the surfaces of all mammalian cells, as they are added to proteins- and lipid backbones by the so-called glycosylation machinery enzymes, present in every cell. Glycans are the outer part of glycoproteins and form recognition elements for glycan sensor molecules that, upon recognition, mediate cellular communication. Glycan recognition plays a crucial role in cellular communication between immune cells. Dendritic cells that stimulat or inhibiting immune responses express many glycan sensor molecules. These glycan sensor molecules (called lectins) recognize specific glycans and can thereby instruct tailor made immune responses. Recognition of glycans on pathogens by dendritic cells can initiate immunological defense.  

There are approximately two hundred simple sugars found in nature but only the eight listed below are found in various combinations surrounding every single cell in the body, and are dominant ingredients in mothers’ breast milk.

Many of these sugars are stripped out of our modern, highly processed foods. They are also gravely missing from whole foods due to green harvesting and soil depletion. Our experience has been that the addition of these types of sugar-nutrients can have extremely positive effects on immune function and overall well-being.  

We are a society that is lead to believe that our bodies aren't capable of maintaining health and wellness on it's own, but when the immune system is able to communicate properly the body listens which makes the wellness journey not only exciting but transformational. 

Workshop schedule :  

1. Meet and Greet

2. Altered Food How the foundation of our food has been altered and its consequences

3. Vitamins & Minerals What’s natural about being synthetic? As it applies to supplementation.

4.The Science of Glycobiology What is glycosylation and how does it affect the proper function of your immune system? 


5.  Wellness Support/ Q & A 

For Further inquiries about this workshop please do not hesitate to send Laura Schwalm an email at [masked]

Love and light, 

Laura Schwalm
results.name: Glycobiology workshop

results.description:
Caffeine & Convo’s is a monthly interview series, featuring some of NYC’s most innovative and forward thinking Fashion Tech founders. This is an intimate event, open to only 45 guests.

Our featured founders are Sim Gulati and Brad Feinstein of Dropel Fabrics. Dropel Fabrics is the world's first hydrophobic textile supplier. Using nanotechnology they have created spill and stain repellent fabrics made of premium cotton.

MODERATED BY:

This series is moderated by Pavan Bahl. Pavan is the founder of Open Source Fashion, a community of helpful innovators working at the intersection of fashion, retail, and technology. His team produces offline educational experiences for OS Fashion’s communities in NYC, DC, and Miami. He is a host of the #1 Fashion Tech podcast on iTunes, Fashion Is Your Business. Pavan is listed as “20 Awesome People in NYC Tech You Need to Know About” by AlleyWatch.

results.description:
Get your kayak out and come down to join us on the picturesque Long Island sound for a short tour along the coastline. On this short tour we will mark our way along the rocky coast of the sound and point out some of our favorite geographical features, beautiful homes and majestic wildlife.

ACTIVITY LEVEL: Easy to intermediate

WHERE TO MEET: We will meet near the waterfront at 5 islands Park in New Rochelle.

WHAT TO BRING: PFD (required), kayak (minimum of 12 feet long preferably with dual bulkheads for safety), paddle, weather appropriate clothing (layers; no cotton), hat with visor, closed toe shoes or water shoes, snacks, lunch, water, personal medications. 

OPTIONAL RECOMMENDED ITEMS: Sunglasses, camera, binoculars, paddle float, spray skirt, headlamp, bathing suit, towel, small day pack with extra clothes and change of shoes for after the paddle.

This outing will be in the sound, please come with a sea-worthy kayak.  Minimum of 12 feet long and preferably with a bulkhead in both the front and rear.  If you are unsure about your vessel, you may want to try one of our discovery courses first.  There will also be no kayak rentals available at this location.  If you do not have a kayak please join us on the weekends also on the discovery courses.

Please sign up for this outing on www.llbean.com/adventure so we have an accurate headcount of participants!
results.name: Kayaking on Long Island Sound

venue.name: USTA National Tennis Center

results.description:
FREE 2015 US OPEN QUALIFIERS TOURNAMENT

The US Open itself may be a little expensive and sells out quickly, but the Qualies are FREE, so let's go see some outstanding tennis up close and personal, meet new tennis lovers and make some new friends!

What an incredible FREE event that we are so lucky to be able to have available to watch so close to home.

WHAT YOU WILL SEE:

You will be able to watch the top pros mesmerize you with their tennis strokes as they practice on the side courts with plenty of chances for you to take up close photos, get autographs and possibly even some selfies with them! Who might you see practice? Can you say Sharapova, Federer, Nadal, Djokovic and Serena.

In addition, you will be able to see the people who are ranked between #200 - #600 in the world in Men's, Women's and Juniors battle it out to compete in the main draw the following week. It is pretty remarkable seeing a 14 year hit the ball, fighting for a spot, against a seasoned veteran or another newbie from all parts of the world.

When:

The gates open at 10 am sharp with match play beginning at 11 am, but lines form in advance, so we should try to meet before then. I'll try to get there by 9:30 am myself, and with any luck you'll be able to find me before the madness begins. If you're having trouble, just call[masked]-7141. The Qualies start daily at 11 am on Tuesday August 25 - Friday August 28.

If you can only arrive a little later, that is OK too. Just send a text,[masked], to let you know where the group is at.

Our event will be on Wednesday August 26th, but you can attend any of the other days 8/25 - 8/28 on your own for FREE. If you are interested in meeting up as a group on Thursday and Friday, let me know to work that out as well.

Where:

We will meet at the main front gate.

If you're taking the subway, you'll want to get on the 7, go to the Mets—Willets Point station and then walk down the promenade to the USTA National Tennis Center.

If you're driving or want other directions via mass transit… well, best to consult the USTA's own driving directions:

http://usta.usopen.org/US-Open/transportation__directions/

Other Important Info:

The USTA is also very picky about what you can bring with you into the Tennis Center, but here are the highlights.

Bags must have only a single compartment and cannot be larger than 12"Wx12"Hx16"L

No knapsacks or backpacks period, even if they fit the above requirements

Likewise, hard coolers are not allowed

No alcoholic beverages

And no tennis racquets either (?!?)

Any beverage or other containers have to be plastic, not metal or glass

You can only bring limited quantities of food

And tablets and ereaders (e.g. iPads and Kindles) are allowed, but not laptops

See the full list here: http://usta.usopen.org/US-Open/what_can_you_bring/


I believe you can bring a small soft cooler with non-alcoholic beverages in plastic containers and a reasonable amount of food for a single person, and I think you could even stick that cooler in a sack that meets the bag size requirement and put a few other things in that sack too, like a plastic tube of sunscreen, but if you have any questions, please check the USTA's own page. There is food and beverages available there for purchase as well.

If for some reason you do have to bring something that's not actually allowed on the grounds (like a briefcase because you can only take the morning off and you'll have to go directly to work after a few hours) there is a locker service by the gates, and it's reasonably priced, too. For example, a friend went to some main-draw matches directly from Grand Central Racquet after picking up some freshly strung racquets, and hr stuck his knapsack-o-racquets in a locker and went on to have an awesome time without any trouble at all.

If you have any questions, don't hesitate to call[masked], or send a message, either way, I hope to see you there! It'll be a ton of fun!
results.name: FREE 2015 US Open Qualifying Tournament

results.description:
Nikon is one of the most recognized brands in the photography industry and their commitment to innovative cameras places them as an industry leader. Come by the store to learn more about Nikon's latest camera offerings and how they are right for you.

Come meet Nikon tech rep Alex Podstawski and get all of your Nikon technical questions answered in-store from 10 AM – 3 PM.

Check out the Nikon showcase here. 

Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.

Biography: Alex Podstawski has been working as a Nikon Technical Representative since early 2012.  At age 13 he began shooting on his first camera, a Nikon FE and has been working with light and cameras ever since.  Working in the photo industry since age 16 and shooting weddings only two years later, Alex has gained experience uncommon for someone his age.  His specialties include infrared and ultraviolet photography, portrait, landscape, wedding, event, wireless flash, and auto racing, among others.  With years of experience working in photo labs and specialty stores, as well as a diverse professional career, Alex is eager share his knowledge and enthusiasm for photography at every opportunity. 


http://www.adorama.com/alc/sites/default/files/styles/bio_image/public/AlexPodstawski_HEAD.jpg?itok=SI_wsyo4

results.description:
Dorie Hagler, principal photographer with Shoot The Cake photography, will share her skills, insights and the tricks she keeps up her sleeve and in her camera bag.  She has been photographing weddings for two decades and says, “ Other than being confident behind your camera, the best trait to have as a wedding photographer is a sense of humor.”  Good gear helps, but great people skills is what will make your career take off.  Join her as she shares real stories about wedding assignment challenges and obstacles and real world solutions.  Come prepared with a few questions and stories of your own.

This seminar will be two (2) sessions of ninety (90) minutes each

Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.

Biography:

http://www.adorama.com/alc/sites/default/files/styles/bio_image/public/DorieHagler_HEAD.jpg?itok=vdimVGnk

Dorie Hagler states “At the time that I got married, I was also the chief photographer and photo editor for a New Mexico newspaper.  And I didn’t want stiff, redundant photos churned out by a wedding industry professional, instead I wanted someone like me to photograph my wedding day.

I realized there must be other couples out there looking for wedding photographs that were beautiful and fun, rather than stiff and redundant.  That was back in 1997 and since then my award winning journalism and wedding images have been published worldwide and I have photographed more weddings than I can count; weddings by the sea, in the desert, in the city, on a boat and on a train.  I’ve photographed weddings with 400 guests and weddings where I was the only witness. 

Each of these events has taught me something not just about photography, but also about people, friendships, family, and telling a great story.”

To see more of Dorie’s Work visit.Shoot-The-Cake.com
results.name: SEMINAR: So You Want To Be A Wedding Photographer with Dorie Hagler

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

results.description:
COME JOIN US FOR SOME AWESOME SINGLETRACK MOUNTAIN BIKING AT "909" (Taconic-Hereford Multiple Use Area).

Please arrive by 5:45pm at the Tyrrel Road Parking Area to allow time to prep your bike and gear so that we may depart promptly by 6:00pm.

Taconic Hereford MUA is affectionately known as "909" by the locals for the number of acres in the park. The terrain consists mostly of rolling hills with moderately steep slopes interspersed throughout.

Almost 4 miles of hard-packed dirt roads circle through dense hardwood forests over hilly terrain. Branching off these dirt roads are more challenging single-track loops and connectors that provide a variety of trail experiences from fast and smooth to technical, with roots, grass and loose rocks.

Depending on your mood, you can ride from 3 miles to 20 miles. To minimize riding double track, it's easy to link consecutive single track trails together. Usually the start of the next trail is right across the road from the one you're finishing.

Distance: To be determined

Estimated Bike Time: 2.5 hours

Difficulty: Intermediate - rolling hills with moderately steep slopes interspersed throughout

Current Weather Forecast: Mostly Sunny with a high of 80 degrees


MANDATORY GEAR:

• Mountain Bike

• Bicycle Helmet

RECOMMENDED GEAR:

• Headlamp

Clear eye Protection (safety glasses - for bugs, dirt, etc.)

• Related maps, a compass or GPS, Water, Snacks, First Aid, Bug Spray, etc.

• Bike Pump

• Tire Patch Kit and/or Spare Tube

PLEASE INSPECT YOUR BIKE PRIOR TO ARRIVAL TO INSURE THE FOLLOWING:

• Proper Tire Inflation

• Lubricated chain

• Properly Shifting gears

• Functional Brakes that don't rub rim or tire when released.

WHERE TO MEET?

Parking area on Tyrrel Rd, Pleasant Valley, NY

DIRECTIONS:

From the north: Take the Taconic State Pkwy south to Pleasant Valley. 909 is found at the end of Tyrell Rd., a left off of the Taconic. Parking is at the end of the road.
From the south: Take the Taconic State Pkwy north to Pleasant Valley. Turn right onto Tyrell Rd. Parking is at the end of the road.

RELATED MAPS:

909 Trail Map - flat 

909 Trail Map - topo

MORE INFO:

http://vizettes.com/kt/bikemaps/909/


**HEAVY RAIN WILL CANCEL THIS EVENT**

results.description:
6:00- Pre-Intermediate Level

Intermediate WCS is a continuation for students who have completed the Beginner Level or possess a good understanding of the basic patterns as well as,  the principles of timing and partnering. Emphasis will be on the continuing development of partnering skills, lead and follow, dance floor etiquette, a good understanding of timing, and the ability to execute simple sequences. New steps and turn patterns will be introduced and linked together to develop new combinations.


7:00-Intermediate Level

8:00- Beginner Level

Beginner WCS Level is an introductory course, which gives a foundation of movement for students who have had little or no dance experience. Emphasis will be on the development of partnering skills, lead and follow, the basic principles of timing, as well as basic foot work and basic patterns.

We suggest between 2 and 4 months in Beginner Level  before you move on to the next Level.

9:15- WCS Party

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
For our August meetup, Zach Pickens, founder of Rooftop Ready Seeds and manager of Riverpark Farm, will speak to us about the business and logistics of seeds.


Due to venue constraints, the event will be capped to 20 attendees.


About Rooftop Ready Seeds:


Rooftop Ready Seeds is the first seed company to offer New York City gardeners a line of locally-grown seed tailored to the unique urban climate and container planting conditions. All Rooftop Ready Seeds are open-pollinated (meaning you can save seed from your own plants and regrow next year) and grown using organic methods in several rooftop locations in and around Brooklyn–including a special seed-saving partnership with Brooklyn Grange. Each variety of seed is collected from individual plants that have proven to thrive year after year in the urban garden environment, with some varieties representing sixth-generation seeds.

Because growing space is tight in the city, our seeds are all limited edition.  When they’re gone, they’re gone until next year.

About Zach:


Zach Pickens is an educator, seed saver, Master Composter, and a full-time urban farmer at the Riverpark Farm at Alexandria Center. Zach has worked on an urban farm and managed youth-run farmers’ markets throughout Brooklyn, Queens, and the Bronx. He helped PS20 in Brooklyn design and implement a curriculum for a greenhouse education program and the eventual construction of a rooftop farm. Zach started Rooftop Ready Seeds in 2010 to develop a stock of vegetable seeds that are tailored to the unique growing conditions faced by urban gardeners.

Find out more on their website.
results.name: Rooftop Ready Seeds @ Riverpark Farm (FULL)

results.description:
Hi NYCAppTesters - we're planning Meetup#2 as a hands-on lab session. Participants would need to come prepared with their laptops setup with all required software installed (instructions to be provided). During the session, participants will:

1. Create a Feature file with scenarios
2. Run Cucumber to create step files
3. Load mobile apps and locate identifiers
4. Create Pageobjects for app screens
5. Write Java code to automate the scenarios
6. Schedule a test in Jenkins (If time permits)
7. Run the test on a real device or emulator
8. Review test results in a Cucumber Report

Active participants will be limited to 20. Others are welcome to participate as observers.

- Sridhar

Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].


This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
If you've been wondering how to add some humor to your presentations, whether formal or informal, come to a meeting of Humorous Toastmasters.  This is a "specialty" club - open to anyone interested in joining, but which specializes in encouraging experimentation with humor in every aspect of the meeting, from introductions to prepared speeches.  As our club president used to say, we're not funny people, we're people trying to become funnier.

For more information about Toastmasters program, go to www.Toastmasters.org
results.how_to_find_us: This is on 3rd Avenue at 45th Street
results.name: You're invited to a Humorous Toastmasters meeting

results.description:
Winner stays, guys!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3XviR7esUvo

And just in case anyone needs a refresher, some guidance from Coach Ted Lasso.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6KeG_i8CWE8

No refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before you RSVP.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. Pass the ball to your teammates and have a good time. NO rough playing, slide tackling, or screaming at others will be tolerated. You'll be removed from the game immediately.

No cleats are allowed. Let's do our part to preserve the field. Turf or running shoes are recommended.

Always bring a *dark and white* t-shirt

Be on time.

Teams are broken out ahead of each game based on skill level. Beginner, intermediate, and advanced players are all encouraged to join.

We play THREE, 25-30 minute games with a brief break between each game.

How to get to Queens West Sportsfield.

Queens West Sportsfield is located at:

5th Street between 47th Avenue & 46th Road, Long Island City


From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

From Queensboro it's 3 minutes/3 stops on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

results.description: Join New York Times bestselling author DAVID LEVITHAN for the launch of Another Day, the eagerly anticipated companion to Every Day. While Every Day tells the story of A as A moves through different bodies and eventually ends up falling in love with Rhiannon, Another Day tells Rhiannon's story. Don't miss out on your chance to relive the emotional highs and lows of Every Day from Rhiannon's point of view!
results.name: Launch Party for David Levithan's New Book Another Day

results.description:
To join webinar:

For all members who RSVP yes here:

You'll be sent a unique link to the webinar after you enter your name & email address at the GoToWebinar Registration page here. Please be sure to take this step prior to the start of the webinar, so that you can join on time. It's a 2 minute process. Note, you'll need to launch the Citrix GoToMeeting client once you join meeting, so it's ideal to log in  a minutes before the start of the webinar, if possible.

----------

We'll be joined by Ajit Jaokar, whose current research focus is applying data science to IoT applications. This research underpins his teaching at Oxford University (Data Science for Internet of Things) and the City Sciences program at the Technical University of Madrid (UPM).

Each month, the importance of data in IoT is noted in our discussions and presentations. Join us to learn more about key areas in data science, applied to IoT.

Ajit will touch on topics such as time series data, enterprise IoT edge computing, real-time processing, cognitive computing, image processing, deep learning algorithms, geospatial analysis for IoT, managing massive geographic scale, strategies for integration with hardware, and sensor fusion. 

We could easily have several sessions on the topic, and this will be a great high-level overview. Ajit's engaging in exciting work globally, and he's looking forward to sharing his insights with IoT NY.

Thank you to our Sponsor
results.name: IoT NY #22 - Data Science in IoT

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.

Please bring $4 cash to the game. 

• RSVPs close by 4:00PM on the day of the game. 

PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP by midnight the day before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Brooklyn Soccer Club Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Brooklyn Soccer Club programs or activities.

results.description:
Celebrate the last weeks of summer with us at our first social event!

Join other behavioral enthusiasts on The Delancey's rooftop in the Lower East Side for happy hour and good conversation. 

There won't be a speaker like our traditional events. This is purely to socialize with fellow Action Designers. 

RSVP and see you there!
results.name: Action Design Happy Hour

results.description:
Lets’ Celebrate the Summer nights before they're gone! Come make it a special Wed. night!! 

Enjoy an easy 1  hour hike at the scenic Edith Read nature sanctuary along the LI Sound and hidden at the far end of the parking lot at Rye Playland!  Beautiful sound views, a Bamboo forest, shorewalk and board-walk to a sunset dinner at The Tiki Bar overlooking the LI Sound!   

We will be walking on a paved road, woods trails,  grassy areas, a beach walk w/ some rocky areas and the boardwalk. Good supportive walking or hiking shoes or boots are recommended, with pants tucked into your pants as a tick preventative. WATER,  bugspray and sunscreen are recommended.

PLEASE LE ME KNOW IF U PLAN TO JOIN US around 7:30 AT THE TIKKI BAR on the boardwalk at Rye Playland (1 Playland Pkwy)FOR DINNER OR REFRESHMENTS AND PLEASE BRING CASH TO MAKE CHECKOUT EASIER AND QUICKER FOR EVERYONE. THEY CAN ONLY DO A FEW CHECKS, SEPARATE CHECKS ARE NOT AVAILABLE. 

AVAILABLE FOR THE FIRST 25 to RSVP or POST for dinner!  Thanks for your consideration. 

PLEASE GIVE YOURSELF EXTRA TIME GETTING HERE AS IT IS NEAR COMMUTER TIME. SCROLL DOWN FOR PARKING INFO AND DIRECTIONS. 

from the edith read website:

Located on the shore of the Long Island Sound, along a migratory flyway, this 179-acre sanctuary is home to a great diversity of marine life.

In winter months, the 85-acre lake, a mixture of salt and fresh water, hosts over 5,000 ducks. The sanctuary has been recognized by the national Audubon Society of New York as an Important Bird Area due to its significant habitats and flyway.

There are three miles of trails through forest and field. Along the half-mile of publicly accessible shore, the intertidal habitat harbors a wide diversity of plants and animals.

The building  houses a small number of exhibits on the ecology of the area. Checklists of seasonally distinct bird species are available.

Parking fee at Playland is  $5, westchester seniors only $1, Edith Read sanctuary members, free parking, fees subject to change.

SCROLL DOWN FOR DIRECTIONS

Photos by yours truly

DIRECTIONS:


New York
 Bronx: Take the Bronx River Parkway North to the Cross County Parkway East to the Hutchinson River Parkway North to Mamaroneck Avenue Exit 23 S. Stay on this for one mile and take I-95 North to Playland Parkway, Exit 19.

Brooklyn: Take the Triborough Bridge North to the Cross Bronx Expressway East to I-95 North to Playland Parkway, Exit 19.

Queens: Take the Cross Island Parkway North to the Throgs Neck Bridge to I-95 North to Playland Parkway, Exit 19.

Manhattan: Take the Westside Highway North to the Cross Bronx Expressway East to I-95 North to Playland Parkway, Exit 19.

New Jersey
 Take the George Washington Bridge to the Cross Bronx Expressway East to I-95 North to Playland Parkway, Exit 19 - or - Take the Tappan Zee Bridge East to the Cross Westchester Expressway (287 East) to I-95 South to Playland Parkway, Exit 19.

Connecticut
 Take I-95 South to Playland Parkway, Exit 19. or Take the Merritt Parkway to the Cross Westchester Expressway (287 East) to I-95 South to Playland Parkway, Exit 19.

Visit the website for Playland’s Metro North Package or call (212)[masked] </a>

Visit the Bee-Line Bus Service to Playland or call at (914) 813-7777.


<a href="http://transportation.westchestergov.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=634&Itemid=1268">

results.description:
Join us for our weekly hacknight for Django developers + newcomers to work on their projects and/or connect with other developers. For best results, bring your laptop.

Say hello on IRC! We're #django-nyc on Freenode. 

About our host </a><a href="http://www.pace.edu/seidenberg/">Seidenberg School of Pace University

The Seidenberg School of Pace University combines a passion for technology with a strong sense of community. Alongside our computing programs, we run workshops, events and meet-ups that bring like-minded individuals together to learn something cool and have a good time. Seidenberg also hosts Hackathons and summer programs for high schoolers – giving everyone a chance to learn coding in a university setting.
results.name: Weekly Django Hacknight @ Pace University

If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].


This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: New & Existing Member Social Networking & Welcome Party--Free Event

group.name: And That's Why You're Single Events - NYC - Singles 25-55
