Join us again for food, drinks and Go at Pie By the Pound (like them at https://www.facebook.com/piebythepound) near Union Square. Every Wednesday!

This event is free, as usual, thanks to the management of Pie generously hosting us. The pizza's good and the beer is cheap, so come hungry (and thirsty!) and order some food and drinks to thank Pie for hosting us. It's win-win.


Please bring a board if possible!
results.name: Pizza and Go at Pie By the Pound

results.description:
Crowdfunding is the new fundraising - with over $9 billion in funds raised across various industries, campaigns big and small - however less than 1% of campaigns were about physics, astronomy, or space. Crowdfunding for science can be successful, however, with several notable examples that have met or exceeded their goals. 

What made those campaigns work? And how can yours achieve similar success?

Come learn the key elements of crowdfunding specific to scientific campaigns so you can take advantage of this new source of funding. Whether you're a researcher, educator, communicator, technologist, or astropreneur - all endeavors, both large and small, take resources. But it also takes public support - community, awareness, publicity - to get an idea off the ground. Crowdfunding merges science communication and fundraising to open up new possibilities yet untapped by traditional funding models.

RSVP REQUIRED FOR ENTRY: http://science-crowdfunding-success.eventbrite.com/
results.name: How to Create a Successful Crowdfunding Campaign for Physics, Astronomy & Space

results.description:
WEBSITE : TWITTER : FACEBOOK

Every Wednesday we bring some serious board game madness to Berg'n from 6:00 PM to 11:00 PM. They like board games; we like board games... it's a match made in heaven!

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be either in the private room or the main room. Either way look for the people playing games!
results.name: Victory Pints at Berg'n Beer Hall

group.name: Victory Pints: Board Games and Beer

results.description:
iMakr will be offering free 3D printing training at the iMakr Store in New York.

This training is best suited for people who are looking at purchasing a 3D printer, or are just interested in the technology, and want to learn more about the machines and software.  

The iMakr Store is located at 152 Allen Street, Lower East Side.

The following points will be covered during the training session:

• Intro to 3D Printing - What to look for in a Printer?

• Intro to the printer - Ultimaker 2

• Intro to the Software (slicer)

• Ongoing maintenance 


• Common troubles

• Workflow, tips and tricks

If you have any question, please email us at [masked]

We look forward to meeting you!
results.name: How to 3D print with HyVision Cubicon

results.description:
**It was pouring rain in parts of NJ, so I rescheduled this event to Aug. 26th.  **

If this changes your RSVP, please update accordingly.  Thank you!

LAST ONE FOR SUMMER OF 2015....

We had fun ....so let's do it again.  Can't socialize at the gym? Here's something we can do...meet at the park for a little workout...tennis, badminton, volleyball, toss a frisbee around. Open to whatever we feel like...bring your fun stuff to share. *****Rainy weather will cancel this event.*****

Let's all meet by the tennis courts.  There are only 2 tennis courts there, so you can't miss it.

As you enter the park, you'll enter the first parking lot (in front of tennis courts).  If that lot is full, keep going about another 1,000 feet and you'll enter the 2nd parking lot (pass the children's play area).
results.how_to_find_us: Near the tennis courts
results.name: Socialize at the Park *last one for the summer of 2015!*

results.description:
The New Jersey LGBT Chamber of Commerce, the state's leading networking organization for the LGBT community, welcomes you to the first Passaic County afterwork mixer at Spuntino in Clifton!

We'll be there on August 26th, at 6pm.  So please join us!  Chamber guests and their friends (bring them!) will receive exclusive, extended Happy Hour pricing!

Spuntino's philosophy: "...life is an adventure filled with unlimited opportunities, possibilities and experiences."  The Chamber couldn't agree more.  So come out and meet new people in this beautiful space.  Talk business, make social connections and learn who else in the LGBT business and social community is right in your neighborhood.

New Jersey Monthly magazine has noted that the wine list is extensive and the small-plate options are plentiful -- is there a better way to relax and meet new people on an August night?

There is no entrance fee or cover for this event and RSVPs are non-committal, but for headcount purposes, it allows the restaurant to staff properly -- so please hit the RSVP button!  And you can also RSVP directly to [masked]
results.how_to_find_us: When you arrive just ask the hostess for the Chamber mixer.
results.name: FIRST CLIFTON MIXER!

group.name: New Jersey LGBT Chamber of Commerce

results.description:
This is and instructor-led, collaborative event.  There will be a presentation on SEO, and after that there will be time to work together on improving the SEO ranking of members' websites.

PRESENTATION

HTML Structure in SEO

How to write powerful <title> tags.

How to write <h1> , <h2> , and <h3> tags to optimize your page.

Images in SEO

How to boost page rankings with images.

How give images effective image names and alt text that are SEO effective.

Social Media

Using Facebook to effectively improve your page rankings.

Building a link promotion network.

Anchored Keywords

Powers of Anchored Keywords.

Finding sites that are relevant to yours.

Virtually Outsourcing your SEO

How to train virtual workers to perform repetitive SEO tasks.

How to avoid scammers and spammers and find quality SEO workers.

DISCUSSION

Should your <title> tag be similar to your <h1> tag?


How many times should I post my link to get the most link power from Facebook?


How to find websites that will include anchored tags to your website on their pages?
results.name: SEO Study Group

results.description:
“Long Island African American Chamber of Commerce is a leading advocate of minority business certification, utilization, trade opportunities, diversity initiatives, access to capital, technical assistance, capacity building and economic development in the four counties of Kings, Queens, Nassau and Suffolk.” Phil Andrews, President, Long Island African American Chamber of Commerce, Incorporated


“Long Island African American Chamber of Commerce’s Officers, Directors and Members are excited about bringing the counties of Queens, Kings, Nassau, and Suffolk together to strengthen the social and economic fabric in the region which will help foster substantial business growth in the African American community and build bridges between government, corporate and community affairs.” Phil Andrews, President, Long Island African American Chamber of Commerce, Incorporated


About: Long Island African American Chamber of Commerce, Incorporated- The Mission of the Long Island African American Chamber of Commerce, Incorporated is to advance and promote economic development for business, and to advance responsive government and quality education on the behalf of all small businesses, with emphasis on African Ancestry, while preserving the Long Island community”. Long Island means the New York State counties on Nassau, Suffolk, Queens and Kings. A Chamber of Commerce is one of the most well-known and recognizable organizations in the country chartered to stimulate business in local and regional areas where they are designated to serve. Visit Long Island African American Chamber of Commerce, Incorporated at http://www.liaacc.org.  

The Long Island African American Chamber of Commerce, Incorporated is a member of the U. S. Black Chambers, Incorporated.

About the U. S. Black Chambers, Incorporated


U. S. Black Chambers, Incorporated is an association of over 118 self-sustaining, viable Black Chambers and small business associations nationwide whose collaboration with strategic partners increases our capacity to serve. We serve our members through our 5 pillars of service, Advocacy, Access to Capital, Contracting, Entrepreneurial Training and Chamber Development. Through the creation of resources and initiatives, we support African American Chambers of Commerce and business organizations in their work of developing and growing Black enterprises. For more information about the U. S. Black Chambers, Incorporated please visit their website at http://www.usblackchamber.org.

To be placed on Long Island African American Chamber of Commerce, Incorporated's email list for upcoming Business Card Exchange & Breakfast Series events, inquire about membership or corporate sponsor opportunities, you may log on to our website at http://www.liaacc.org or email us at [masked].


To register for our upcoming General Membership Meeting log on to https://www.eventbrite.com/e/long-island-african-american-chamber-of-commerce-general-membership-meeting-tickets-17762498110 today!
results.name: Long Island African American Chamber of Commerce General Membership Meeting

results.description:
Hi everyone - Always a fun time - come on out and see the Sensational Soul Cruisers.

The Sensational Soul Cruisers are an 11 man horn group fronted by four soulful vocalists who pay homage and tribute to classic performers from Otis Redding and the Drifters to Barry White and the Commodores. With a lifetime of study and hard work, this group captures and emulates the distinctive style, skill and choreography of a classic show band. Former members of famous R & B and smooth soul groups, they now work together as individuals with their own sound and delivery and as a vocal harmony group that is beyond comparison.

 Look for the orange cowgirl hat to find us.
results.how_to_find_us: LOOK FOR ORANGE COWGIRL HAT, BRING BUG SPRAY AND LAWN CHAIR.  ARRIVE ON-TIME TO SIT TOGETHER.
results.name: SENSATIONAL SOUL CRUISERS - LOOK FOR ORANGE COWGIRL HAT

group.name: SOCIAL GROUP 45 AND OVER - LET'S GET OUT AND ENJOY OURSELVES

results.description:
Our last Bowling Meetup sold out! And we probably won't be doing this event again for a little while so don't miss this one!! 

MEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1fAAehN

WOMEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1Ku2k90

Mix & mingle before bowling with ice breakers while we create teams. Women & Men will be paired into teams of two or three. Each team will stay together throughout the event.  

Next the fun begins.  A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Then a member of the male team will bowl a frame. The process continues until all 10 frames are bowled. The group that has the highest score of each game wins a prize!

At end of game, ladies will stay at the same lane. Male team will rotate to next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

results.description:
Meet and network with marketing colleagues, entrepreneurs, and decision-makers from a cross-section of industries, companies, and levels. Marketers from the following companies have attended in the past: Pepsi, L'Oreal, Pernod Ricard, Procter & Gamble, Colgate Palmolive, Rosetta, Young & Rubicam, Ogilvy, Havas, Thomson Reuters, Bloomingdale's, MTV, and American Express. 

Join us on Wednesday, August 26th from 6:30pm - 8:30pm at the brand new WeWork Chelsea (2nd Floor). In addition to our standard happy hour, throughout the event, you'll be able to check out exhibition stations from various New York tech startups. We'll be providing free wine & beer. FoodtoEat will be providing delicious hors d'oeuvres.

Because we're hosting it at WeWork, the building's security requires us to submit a list of the names of all attendees. Unfortunately, that means no walk-ins will be allowed and you must RSVP online by 3:30pm the day of the event. You'll be asked to provide your full name and email address when you RSVP for this event.

Meet the Exhibiting Startups 
- Visify transforms small businesses into thriving brands, using digital advertising to fill your sales funnel, automagically. Being an agency with a “startup” mentality allows us to better understand and act on the specific needs of small business. We serve as your “drop-in marketing team,” handling lead generation and automated nurture campaigns for you. Learn more at visifyllc.com or stop by our booth to get your free copy of The 2015 Ultimate Digital Marketing Toolkit, filled with the exact tools you need to elevate your online marketing and grow your business.

- Cooperatize is the easiest way to get your brand written about and published on thousands of blogs. As the leading story based advertising platform, Cooperatize takes a new approach to story, native advertising, and content distribution.

Raffle Items
We'll also be raffling off a few items:

• WeWork Commons membership


• Month of unlimited coffee via CUPS

Remember to join our email list and follow us on Twitter. 

About FoodtoEat 
FoodtoEat is a marketplace for companies to get catering from the best restaurants, food trucks and caterers. We impact the way people eat in the workplace by collaborating with the local food community to provide mindful food experiences. We strive to help amazing companies feed their talented employees because we believe that investing in your team is the best investment a company can make. Learn more: www.foodtoeat.com/p/catering

About CUPS
</a><a href="http://cupsapp.com/">CUPS offers prepaid plans and monthly subscriptions at over 170 of NYC’s best cafes. Save money while supporting local businesses. Use your phone to find your next favorite coffee shop and leave your wallet at home when you pay for your drinks through the app!

About WeWork  
WeWork is the platform for creators. We provide the space, community and services you need to create your life’s work. We have locations around the world. To learn more about WeWork, send an email to [masked] and let them know you were referred by the NYC Marketing Mixer.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be on the second floor
results.name: August Networking Happy Hour + Startup Exhibitors

results.description:
The next Pints 'n' Purls Meetup will be at The Bar at Whole Foods in Columbus Circle from 6:30-9:30 p.m., so drop in anytime you like. Bring your knitting, crocheting, cross-stitching, or whatever else you're working on and prepare for a blast!

I am not sure if this is up to date, but here is the beer <a>menu: http://www.beermenus.com/places/1868-whole-foods-market-columbus-circle</a>;

The bar is on the right past the registers.  Lots of food options!

Feel free to call Deborah ( 914/[masked] )  or Amy ( 347/[masked] ) with any questions. Hope to see you there!

Feel free to come earlier and grab a table.  With our schedules, we can't guarantee an organizer can make it there earlier than 6:30.

We hope that you will consider becoming or renewing your status as a "Pints 'n' Purls Contributor."  These voluntary dues help cover the costs of running the group, which include dues to Meetup.com, prizes for events, thank yous for hosts, etc.   ALL the money goes back into the group.  We are just hoping that you will share in some of the expenses that come out of organizing these fun and friendly events.  You can pay online or in person ($24/year We organize over 70 meetups a year.)
results.how_to_find_us: We are generally at a large table in the back of the restaurant section. Ask the staff if you don't see us- they know where to find us.
results.name: On Tap (the Bar) at Whole Foods Columbus Circle

This meetup is being sponsored by Wellthy. Come drink, eat, and network with other passionate and empathetic experts.
results.name: Geriatric Care Expert Cocktail Hour

results.description:
I'm a playwright with a show coming up late this month about a pirate with a checkered past who embarks on her most dangerous adventure yet...winning the heart of a terrifying sorceress with a bad attitude. What's interesting about this play, aside from magic and pirates, is that the romantic leads are both women who fall in love with each other. And all the characters--every single one--is LGBT. If you're looking for something to do later this month, may I suggest coming to see "Encanta"?

WHERE: Manhattan Repertory Theatre (303 W. 42nd Street. Right across from Port Authority.)
HOW MUCH: $20.
TO RESERVE TICKETS: Send an e-mail to [masked]. You pay for the tickets when you arrive.
WEBSITE: http://encantatheplay.weebly.com/
FB EVENTS: https://www.facebook.com/CrossroadsTheatreProject/events
results.name: See ENCANTA, a play about magic, true love, and ladies loving ladies!

results.description:
WHAT WE DO

Open space for artists & technologists to get hands-on with new technology. We supply a bunch of hardware and a chill environment so you can hack away.

Tweet: @hardwarehacklab at #ThoughtWorksNYC

Visit: hardwarehacklab.io

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0kxNCYpxcXM

We use creative coding environments like openFrameworks or Max/MSP to play with everything from webcams to Oculus Rift. People of all experience levels, from beginners to veterans are welcome here.

WARNING

This meetup has no particular structure. We don't have 'hack lab' projects. We work on whatever we, and you, bring in each week - which could be anything.

The schedule is loose, the feeling is social and non-judgemental. We are just curious and want to see your projects. So bring what you have and share!

ROSTER

Oculus, Kinect 1/2, Arduino, Leap, Glass, Depth video, Brain-Computer Interface, openFrameworks, SuperCollider, Max/MSP, vvvv, Processing.

DO YOU HAVE SPECIFIC NEEDS?

Some of these items are only available on request or particular occasions. Use the comments below and direct messages to find out if particular hardware or people with particular skills will be around that week.

If you can't confirm, still drop by and meet us. The lab is a great place to come and learn and meet people.

results.description:
Are you tired of just working your day to day grind and jusgetting by? Why not find out how you can get out of the rat race?

The game of Cashflow simulates real-life financial management and features realistic Real Estate investing scenarios designed to show you how these types of transactions work in real life and both helps you learn how to effectively utilize them in their investing strategies. It also helps to find out your investing style, whether you are aggressive in your strategies or conservative so we can see in which of these you are most comfortable. All without the pressures of using your own money.

We will be meeting at a cafe/restaurant in Astoria

Our last Bowling Meetup sold out! And we probably won't be doing this event again for a little while so don't miss this one!! 

MEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1fAAehN

WOMEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1Ku2k90

Mix & mingle before bowling with ice breakers while we create teams. Women & Men will be paired into teams of two or three. Each team will stay together throughout the event.  

Next the fun begins.  A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Then a member of the male team will bowl a frame. The process continues until all 10 frames are bowled. The group that has the highest score of each game wins a prize!

At end of game, ladies will stay at the same lane. Male team will rotate to next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address. 

What's included:

• Free Bowling Games, Shoe Rental & Scorecard Matching 

• Ice Breakers

• Singles in their 20s, 30s, 40s

• Prizes for winning team

Tickets are $30-$35 depending upon how early you purchase:

MEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1fAAehN

WOMEN get tickets here - http://bit.ly/1Ku2k90

Prepay Only Event - No tickets sold at door 

Can I still attend even If I don't want to bowl?  Yes, you can still be a member of the team and mingle.  Food & Drink will also be available for purchase. 

Can I come alone?  Yes, 80% attending come on their own. 

Why does your RSVP say +30?  This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  About 40 singles will be attending ages 20s-40s.

How do I attend?  RSVP w/ group and purchase ticket here - http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5880
results.how_to_find_us: Private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided

results.name: Bowling Singles Night (Prepay Only) - SOLD OUT FOR WOMEN!

results.description:
Meeting at the Marriot Marquis, 8th floor bar.  Ride to the 8th floor, walk towards the back of the building, NOT the first bar nearest the lobby check in but the Second BAR in the far back of the 8th floor.   Once you get near the window wall overlooking times sq you are in the right spot. 

Broadway lounge does not have a "Happy Hour" so save your drink pennies. 

See you there. 

MENU

http://www.marriott.com/hotelwebsites/us/n/nycmq/0-Modules/restaurants/broadway_lounge/broadway_lounge_pdfs/BroadwayLoungeFullMenu.pdf

Venue site -

http://www.marriott.com/hotel-restaurants/nycmq-new-york-marriott-marquis/broadway-lounge/5272396/home-page.mi
results.name: Write Drunk Wednesday -

results.description:
PREPAYMENT @ http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5880 REQUIRED-

------------------------------------------------
WHAT: Speed BOWLING for Singles

WHERE: Bowlmor Times Square
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works
Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have three people to sign up. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle with ice breakers and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each bowling lane. This male and female team (known as a group) will combine to bowl one 10 frame game. Remember, you are not bowling an entire game yourself. This is a group effort. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Next, a member of the male team will bowl a frame. Then female number two bowls a frame followed by male number two. The process continues until all ten frames are bowled. During this time all of the members of the group will be getting to know each other. Which ever group has the highest score at the end of each game will win a prize.

At the end of the game, the ladies will stay at the same lane. The male team will rotate to the next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Note: You can still attend and be a member of a team even if you do not want to bowl.


Includes: Bowling, Shoes and scorecard matching.


**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night and take notes during the event. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address..

-------------------------------------------------------------------------


PREPAYMENT is required at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5880
$30-$35 depending on how early you register.
results.name: Speed BOWLING- AGES 20's, 30's, 40's (prepay required)

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each bowling lane. This male and female team (known as a group) will combine to bowl one 10 frame game. Remember, you are not bowling an entire game yourself. This is a group effort. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Next, a member of the male team will bowl a frame. Then female number two bowls a frame followed by male number two. The process continues until all ten frames are bowled. During this time all of the members of the group will be getting to know each other. Which ever group has the highest score at the end of each game will win a prize.

At the end of the game, the ladies will stay at the same lane. The male team will rotate to the next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

guys & girls are welcome!

Would you like to feel confident on the dance floor?

These classes will prepare you for dancing in public!

How it works:

I, unlike other teachers, don't spend entire class on teaching you choreography - you don't need it unless you want to be a professional dancer. My focus is on teaching you how to move comfortably in a club, at a party, wedding, etc. (Unless of course you request choreography).

I teach basics: finding and keeping rhythm, easy steps you can use anytime making sure you know how to transition smoothly between them.

During the first class I assess what it is we need to work on; whether it's musicality, rhythm, coordination, attenuation, groove etc. From that point on, I adjust the class to students' needs.

results.description:
We're born into our families, grew up around our friends, and settled in our communities as we slowly developed into the personality and habits we have today. At a certain point though, we become professionals and discover our ambitions, wanting more for ourselves and those around us. Each of us eventually meet that challenge though - we have to develop new habits and become a new "us" in order to hit those goals, but we all know this isn't easy. So how do we assess who we are today and  start etching that line of who we want to become? How do we portray to the world who we are and align it with those ambitions so we can reach those goals? 

During this meetup we’ll be united around a passion and ambition for improving and changing our habits to develop our personal brand for success. 

Speakers:

Steve Dean, founder of JobSuitors, will speak on his extensive experience in the internet matchmaking and dating landscape, and how he assessed and enhanced his personality and habits to align more strongly with the things he wanted to achieve. His amazing and creative experiences in travel, romance, and founding JobSuitors tell the story of how an ambitious wanderer was able to travel extensively, become an expert superconnector, and actively learn and adapt to the personality and social brand needed to build his company and live life more fully. 

Raven Chiara, creative marketer and the new face of job search content at RealMatch, will speak from her experience in staying engaged as an active presence in many diverse communities ranging from sneaker culture and sports to quantified marketing, and how she's leveraged her knowledge of personal branding for job search to craft her own social brand showcasing her creative design talent. 

If you’re interested in discussion on how to change your habits, enhance your personal brand, or learn more in finding the right match job wise or relationship wise, come hang with us over beer and good times.
results.name: Romantic Antics, Creative Habit Forming, and Your Personal Brand

results.description:
Last month we saw the doors close on Tinker Tailor, one of a number of startups trying to make customizable designer fashion for women. So how does their story impact this space? Is customization a worthy opportunity and if so, how can businesses succeed?

This month, we take a moment to look at those ruling customization, disruptive models and what opportunities there are for fashion and tech to create a customized experience that's scalable and profitable.

Industry chat with: 

Fashion Journalist, Lauren Sherman
Shoes of Prey, Co-Founder, Jodie Fox
Jodie is the Co-founder and Chief Evangelist at Shoes of Prey - where women can design their own shoes. Started just 4 years ago, Shoes of Prey broke even at 2 months, hit multimillion dollar revenue in under 2 years and today is a global multimillion dollar enterprise.  
Bow & Drape, Co-founder & CEO, Aubrie Pagano
The brand that lets women customize fun, easy fashion, heralding a new generation of "me-commerce" where personalization and self expression are king (or queen). 


Demos from startups disrupting the space include:

1 Atelier 
A transformational luxury brand that delivers exquisitely handcrafted bespoke accessories, made in NYC, at a price that reflects only what went into making your product, and delivered in less than 21 days. 

Body Labs 
The world's most advanced technology for digitizing a person's 3D body shape. This technology enables businesses to streamline their workflow and create truly custom or mass-customized products via our digital body models and the complex analytics they provide.

 Heisel X Queen of Raw
A collection of custom 3D printed buttons for the fashion industry. Each button comes in unique sizes, colors, shapes, and designs, as well as a variety of materials. Buttons feature low minimums, and everything is printed on demand at a location near you. 

As always, we'll end the evening with networking.
results.name: NY Meetup: The Power of Customization

results.description: Come hang out and watch puppies play - what could be better? Socialization is THE most important thing you can do for your puppy. It will help him or her learn valuable social skills and to not be afraid of novel or potentially scary things he or she will have to encounter on a daily basis. Often, people think their puppies are fine because they seem to love everything already, and when problems occur later down the line, it's a much bigger issue than it would have been if addressed in puppyhood. Take a professional's advice... make sure you socialize your puppy! Zen Dog Training Owner and Behavior Consultant Alexis Toriello supervises all play dates, answers training and behavior questions, and discusses topics like proper socialization and appropriate play.
results.name: Puppy Playdate

results.description:
Blake Matheny

-on-

Open Source at Facebook

Note: WE ARE MEETING AT CIVIC Hall!! We'll need names, and you will need IDs. RSVP will open Wednesday August 12th, 2015, 4:30pm.

The infrastructure team at Facebook supports 1.4+ billion monthly active users making millions of requests per second globally across 5 data centers and more than 30 edge POP locations. Achieving this level of scale has only been made possible by leveraging and contributing to open source. In this talk Blake will discuss how Facebook infrastructure has successfully leveraged open source, from hardware to software. Blake will primarily focus on the load balancing infrastructure, the open compute project, and the Linux kernel. Blake will also briefly touch on some of our other open source initiatives such as HHVM, RocksDB, and Presto. This talk should be interesting to those who are passionate about open source, large scale systems, or the Linux kernel.


Afterwards:
Join us afterwards at a nearby tavern where we'll continue the discussion over drinks and/or food. 

Links:

Speaker Bio:

Blake Matheny is an Engineering Director at Facebook where he is responsible for systems including the Linux Kernel as well as the Load Balancing infrastructure serving over a billion users and many millions of requests per second. Blake has been working on large scale distributed systems for more than ten years, and is currently enamored with C++11, approaches to asynchronous computation, and scheduling algorithms. Although formerly from NYC, Blake currently lives in California with a cat that hates him, his wife, and their collection of books. You can follow Blake at http://fb.me/blake.r.matheny or @bmatheny.

Every month Film Co-Op members get together for a pitch meeting. Pitches for films or web series are made, crews are formed and the filmmaking process starts.

This meetup will allow you to practice your pitch and see how the process works.


It is a simple process. Any member can pitch a film or web series idea that they need help on. In three minutes they express the idea, describe the crew positions they need and get people interested in their project. 

Once all the pitches are heard you will have time to mingle with others and talk to the owner about working about their project. We use a Tinder like process and if you like a project and the project owner likes you there is a match.

results.description:
Hey, HCx3DP Synergist!

Summer time...and the livin' is easy...

I think it's appropriate that we meld with Deep August sensibilities---many of you have already done so by "being away!!" ---and make this end-of-Summer Event more congenial get-together than constructed  go-get-'em. 

(Our HCx3DP Meetup has a great reputation for delivering knowledge, connections, concepts and exciting programs to compel your participation.) 

Well, on Wednesday (26 August), I invite you to our loft in DUMBO for lots of conviviality, conversation and (maybe?!) a little catch-up on where we are on our "Health Maker Lab" Program... 

Renée and I will be delighted to share our view of downtown Manhattan, the Statue of Liberty and the sunset going down behind Wall Street skyscrapers from our 12th Floor windows. (The skies DO promise to be clear?!) Depending on how many Synergists show up, we may also decamp to our very commodious and comfortable Roof Garden. (The Waxing Gibbous Moon might also make an appearance...)

So, for those of you looking for deep August "easy livin'"---and  some topic leaders in HCx3DP, DigiFab, HML and more---RSVP and support our Meetup via payment above or [here] and come join us. 


Best!

LAND, Organizer 
HCx3DP Meetup NY

PS. I've invited our HML "informal advisory team"---see our list of worthies below---but I can't promise who will actually show-up during Wednesday's "easy going" moment...it IS late August before Labor Day, after all...

PPS. If you'd like to view our latest HML-Program's Slide Deck---with our most recent advances---click this link to access the PDF version.

PPPS. Here is the link to our "movie" Trailer (for the a-building full-coverage video of our 29 July Eventthat we're working on now). I think you'll find this informative---introducing our attending experts, interested participants and our Manifesto Debut---and a "teaser" to further interaction.

+++ 



[The following will buttress your understanding of what and who is involved in our HCx3DP/HML initiatives.]

...as I’ve suggested to you before: Come get involved---personally---in our HCx3DP Meetup Community’s common-good, grassroots disruption and make-over of our dysfunctional Healthcare system. YES, we can. AND---with YOUR help---we WILL…


This will be our next Health Maker Lab (HML) planning and implementation event within our “HCx3DP Meetup NY” framework. We’re continuing to accelerate the momentum we’ve built behind our Big Tent, inclusive HML initiative.

As before, we’re inviting our ad hoc team of established topic experts (see our list below) back again. With their help, we will continue to build on our prior Meetup discussions about Health Maker Lab in our Workshop-style exchanges.

RSVP NOW to save your seat! BE PART OF SOMETHING IMPORTANT…FROM THE START…!!


Best!

LAND

Organizer

+++

Here’s the list of our ad hoc HML team of established topic experts. 

David Solomonoff, President, New York Chapter, Internet Society (Invited);


Kelly Reilly, Director of Nursing Research & Evidence-Based Practice, Maimonides Medical Center; Impresario, World's First Mini Maker Faire at a Hospital (Invited);

Jon Luongo, MS, CCLS, Child Life Specialist, Maimonides Infants & Children's Hospital (Unable to attend);

Matt Lipshultz, Meetup Co-Organizer, Hack Manhattan (Invited);

Victor Ty, Radiation Oncology RN at a comprehensive cancer center in Brooklyn; Health Maker in LEGO Medical & LEGO 3D Medical Designs (Confirmed); 


Oliver Medvedik, PhD.,Co-Founder; Director, Scientific Programs, Genspace (Invited);

Jonathan Askin, Technology Law Professor, Founder/Director, Brooklyn Law Incubator & Policy (BLIP) Clinic, Brooklyn Law School. Innovation Catalyst for the Brooklyn Law Center (CUBE) for Urban Business Entrepreneurship (Unable to attend).

Andrew O'Shaughnessy, Project Manager, Health Tech, Center for Economic Transformation, New York City Economic Development Corporation (Invited).

Aaron Roy, Head of Operations & Strategy, 3DPrinterOS, innovators in 3DP education & enterprise via the most powerful, open source, 3D Printing management platform in the world (Invited).

[Please come back for on-going updates to this important Event.]

+++

NeuroTechNYC is the NYC chapter of NeuroTechX, an international organization of designers, engineers, neuroscientists, hackers, and more. 

Next Wednesday, join us for our very first official night of neurohacking! Since this is the first meeting, we'll be discussing potential projects to pursue on an ongoing basis, and get down and dirty with some hardware, code, and bio-signals. 

We have a number of EEG and human-computer interface devices, including a bunch of OpenBCI boards, an Emotiv Insight, a few NeuroSky headsets, and a lots of other biosensors.

If you have your own neurotech devices, please bring them! Otherwise just bring your brain and the desire to create and collaborate!

There is an attendance fee of $10/person for food and drinks!
results.name: NeuroTechNYC Hack Night #2!

results.description:
Join us for a book review of the AMORC book Mental Poisoning by H. Spencer Lewis.

The topic for this week's discussion is Chapter 2 Is Black Magic Possible?

You can download the chapter free here!

About the Book

Tortured souls. Human beings, whose self-confidence and peace of mind have been torn to shreds by invisible darts—the evil thoughts of others. Can envy, hate, and jealousy be projected through space from the mind of another? Do poisoned thoughts like mysterious rays reach through the ethereal realm to claim innocent victims? Will wishes and commands born in hate gather momentum and like an avalanche descend upon a helpless man or woman in a series of calamities? Must humanity remain at the mercy of evil influences created in the minds of the vicious? Millions each year are mentally poisoned—are you safe from this scourge? Mental Poisoning is the title of a book written by Dr. H. Spencer Lewis, which fearlessly discloses this psychological problem.

All are Welcome!
results.name: Circle of Spiritual Inquiry - Mental Poisoning: Is Black Magic Possible?

results.description:
PREPAYMENT @ http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5880 REQUIRED-

------------------------------------------------
WHAT: Speed BOWLING for Singles

WHERE: Bowlmor Times Square
WHO: Single men and women ages 20's, 30's, & 40's

How it works
Women will be paired up into teams of two or three and Men will be paired up into teams of three. Don't worry if you are coming alone or do not have three people to sign up. People will arrive early so you will have time to mingle with ice breakers and we will help create the teams. Each team will stay together throughout the event.

Next the fun begins. We will have one male team and one female team stationed at each bowling lane. This male and female team (known as a group) will combine to bowl one 10 frame game. Remember, you are not bowling an entire game yourself. This is a group effort. A person from the female team will bowl a frame. Next, a member of the male team will bowl a frame. Then female number two bowls a frame followed by male number two. The process continues until all ten frames are bowled. During this time all of the members of the group will be getting to know each other. Which ever group has the highest score at the end of each game will win a prize.

At the end of the game, the ladies will stay at the same lane. The male team will rotate to the next lane and the process begins again. We will continue for either two hours or until you have met everyone.

Note: You can still attend and be a member of a team even if you do not want to bowl.


Includes: Bowling, Shoes and scorecard matching.


**************Food and Drinks are available for purchase********


Question: I was interested in someone but am still uncomfortable asking them for contact information.


You will have the option to complete a scorecard at the end of the night and take notes during the event. You can write down the names of anyone you were interested in from the event. We will send them an email letting them know that you were interested and provide your email address..

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

PREPAYMENT @ http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5880 REQUIRED-

------------------------------------------------
results.name: Speed BOWLING- AGES 20's, 30's, 40's (prepay required)

results.description:
We spend a lot of time developing our personal online brands, whether completely authentic, meticulously crafted, or a concoction of the two. But for those who came of age at the same time that the internet did, our early online identities were just as nascent, nebulous and juvenile as the platforms that hosted them. And, despite our embarrassment, many of these adolescent, coming-of-age expressions are still searchable online and relevant to who we are today.


Hosted by Willa Köerner and Alex Teplitzky about the Internet, Delete Your Account! Live is an event dedicated to the weird and regrettable ways we expressed ourselves online as adolescents. The program will feature a series of readings, performances, images and media submitted via an open call for all the things you should probably delete from the internet, but just can’t.


Presented at Hunter East Harlem Gallery alongside the gallery summer project: POWRPLNT, a pop-up digital art collaboratory offering free classes taught by digital artists for teens. 


Our Meetup

We will meet in the Gallery at Hunter College School of Social Work on 2180 Third Avenue (119th Street) in East Harlem at 6:30pm for a brief meet-and-greet before attending the event. The group should be easy to spot, but feel free to ask for me (Daniel) or Arden and as always, call or text me at[masked] if you have any questions.

Directions to Hunter College School of Social Work

Take the #6 train to 116th Street, then walk to 119th & Third Avenue. The M100, M101, M102, & M116 bus stops are also nearby.

About Hunter College East Harlem Gallery

Hunter East Harlem is a multi-disciplinary space for art exhibitions and socially engaged projects. Located on the ground floor of Hunter College’s Silberman School of Social Work at 119th Street and 3rd Avenue, the gallery presents exhibitions and public events that aim to foster academic collaborations at Hunter College while addressing subjects relevant to the East Harlem community and greater New York City. The gallery specifically seeks to initiate partnerships with publicly oriented organizations and focuses on showcasing artists who are engaging in social practice, public interventions, community projects, and alternative forms of public art. All exhibitions and programs are free and open to the public.
results.how_to_find_us: Inside the Gallery Area
results.name: "Delete Your Account! Live" @ Hunter College East Harlem

results.description:
CONEY ISLAND BEACH YOGA by donation (suggested donation $10)

WEDNESDAYS IN AUGUST, weather permitting
7:00-8:00 pm 

Come join me as we practice yoga to the sound of the waves! We will practice on the beach in Coney Island off West 19th Street.  This is an open-level yoga class, designed to accommodate beginners to advanced practitioners.

Please plan on meeting at 6:45 pm at Lola Star Shop in the Stillwell Av subway station.  (When you're exiting from the turnstiles, take the Surf Av exit. Walk through the corridor lined with shops.  Lola Star is the last shop on your left before you get to the street called Surf Av. The shop is across from the Dunkin Donuts. **We do NOT meet at the Lola Star Shop on the boardwalk.) They have a limited amount of yoga mats that you can use for free. It is strongly suggested, however, that you bring your own mat. At 6:50, we will walk together to the beach.  If you are later than 6:50, come find us right on the beach by walking along the boardwalk to West 19th St. (When you get on the boardwalk, turn right towards the baseball stadium and Parachute jump, in the opposite direction of the Aquarium. We will be somewhere on the sand close to the water, off the boardwalk, across from the Abe Stark Sports Center.)  ** If you cannot find us, call me up to 7 pm [masked])

SUBWAYS: D, Q, F, N trains to Coney Island

For more info, contact the instructor, Chia-Ti, by phone:[masked] email: [masked] or Lola Surf Shop (www.lolastar.com).

About Donation-based classes: Donation classes are an affordable option to practice yoga. They are not free classes.  If you would like to take a free class, I teach a Thursday night free class in Manhattan.  (For more information about those classes, visit my meetup group: http://www.meetup.com/Free-and-Affordable-Yoga-Meditation-African-Dance-Classes/)  The suggested donation for this Coney Island class is $10.  Of course, pay what you can.  Your generosity is appreciated to help sustain community classes.  

About Chia-Ti: I am a yoga teacher and Thai bodyworker. I have been teaching yoga for over 13 years. This is my third year teaching this donation-based yoga class in Coney Island. I love that we get to watch the sunset after class, and to teach on the beach in my borough! I teach yoga to adults, elders, and incarcerated teens. I believe yoga is a privilege that should be accessible and affordable to all who wish to practice. For more information about the services I offer, please visit my website: www.onelovewellness.com
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at Lola Star Surf Shop or on the beach itself!

results.description:
OUR NEXT GUEST SPEAKER Kevin Clark recently joined Asset Based Lending, LLC.  Kevin has been described as a marketing genius, his specialty being hard money lending. He is a respected industry leader with more than 25 years of experience, and has originated billions of dollars in non-conforming real estate (Hard-Money) loans. Kevin was Marketing Director for one of the nation’s largest private commercial hard money mortgage lending firms from November 1988 until July 2003. In his role as Marketing Director he was a major force in helping the private lending firm gain national recognition as one of the country’s leading private lending source.

Non-conforming “hard-money” financing expertise, marketing savvy and powerful speaking and communication skills have won Kevin many speaking invitations from well-known industry associations nationwide. In 1995 & 2000, The National Association of Mortgage Brokers recognized Kevin S Clark for his part in developing their commercial mortgage symposium, which was created to educate members of NAMB who are interested in commercial mortgage lending. Kevin S Clark is also called upon regularly by commercial real estate and mortgage trade publications for his views on various commercial mortgage topics. 

Asset Based Lending, LLC (ABL) is a private commercial lender founded in 2010. Our mission is to help real estate investors, quickly and efficiently, finance their business activities. We provide twelve-month bridge financing to purchase and rehabilitate distressed residential and mixed-use commercial properties. We specialize in:

• REOs
• Short sales
• Multi-family buildings
• New residential construction
• Mixed use commercial properties

We are private (hard money) lenders that either work with brokers or lend directly to investors. We do not finance owner occupied properties. ABL is actively lending in New York, New Jersey, Connecticut, Massachusetts, Rhode Island, Pennsylvania, Maryland, Virginia, and Washington D.C.* either directly or in partnership with local lenders. We also selectively purchase loans from licensed brokers.  Contact Us Today:
[masked]

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6-7 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
7:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
Past Life Regression allows you to experience direct access to your own Higher Intelligence, and connect with Universal Wisdom and Loving Guides. It can help you to heal and release experiences that hold you back, to both re-connect with, and strengthen, gifts and talents, and to feel rejuvenated by your own soul’s knowing. Most importantly, past life regression provides the opportunity to be bathed in the unconditional love of Spirit. We will experience a group past life regression session so that you may get a feel for the deep and powerful journey that is possible.

Past Life Regression makes use of a very relaxed and aware state of mind. While remaining the witness, images, messages, experiences, and guidance may emerge. Allowing these various phenomena to occur while remaining an objective observer is key to the regression experience. What is fascinating is that you don't even have to have a firm belief in past lives to benefit! With an open heart and mind, the various phenomena that emerge can be deeply transformative without having to determine with absolute certainty if they are coming from a past life. With or without a belief in past lives, past life regression is a fascinating journey!

Come join with us to get to know each other and learn about a fascinating process!
results.name: Understanding Past Life Regression

results.description:
COME CHECK IT OUT FOR ONLY $5 BUCKS!

Meditative Writing with Jessica Hinds

“It took me four years to paint like Raphael, but a lifetime to paint like a child.” – Pablo Picasso

There was a time when creativity was easy—when you were a child, driven by an endless desire to create, and no fear, no judgment, and no internal censor whatsoever.

The goal of meditative writing is to return you to that time, when finding your voice as a writer was as easy as being yourself, and raw creativity flowed as effortlessly as inspiration.

You’ll learn to banish writer’s block forever, find inspiration in an instant, and discover the heart of your story and your characters, by tapping into your own voice as a writer, and your deepest creative instincts.

How Does It Work?

Each session begins with a short guided meditation, followed by a series of carefully crafted meditative writing exercises, designed to transport you out of your everyday life, and connect you to the emotional truth of your story and of your characters.

Over 5 weeks, you’ll build a writing practice that allows you to get your pages flowing at will, recover the joy you’ve always felt with writing, and write from your most connected place every time you sit down with your characters.

Meetup Members can check out the first session for only $5 bucks with no obligation, to decide if the class is right for you!

Who Should Take Meditative Writing?


Whether you are brand new to writing, or a seasoned writer looking to inject energy back into your writing, meditative writing will change your writing life forever.

Designed for writers of all types, including screenwriters, playwrights, poets, novelists, and writers of any other genre, here are just a few of the many benefits of this approach:

Uncovering the Real Emotional Underbelly That Drives Great Films

Discovering Your True Voice

Creating More Provocative Dialogue, Images and Action

Developing an “Inspiration on Command” Writing Schedule

Injecting Joy Into Your Writing Process

Getting in Touch With Your Characters

Finding the Heart of Your Story

Discovering Theme

Natural Subtext

Opening Up Your Creative Side

Learning How To Write Even When You Can’t Find a “Quiet Place”

Connecting Yourself To Your Characters and Story Even If You Are Working On Assignment

Writing Cooler, Bigger, More Intense and Compelling Scenes

Learning To Love Your Weirdness and Understand Its Value

Relaxation

Confidence

Focus

Banishing Writers Block Forever

Fun!

Learn more.

----

NORMAL COST: $350

MEETUP MEMBERS:  Check out the first day of this  5-week workshop for only $5 bucks with no obligation!

Class Size is Strictly Limited To Allow All Students The Opportunity to Workshop And Receive Feedback On Their Writing. You MUST RSVP to attend this event.

PLEASE PLAN TO ARRIVE 5 MINUTES EARLY TO ASSURE THAT YOU DO NOT DISTURB THE MEDITATION.

You'll LOVE this workshop or your money back!

results.description:
Haskell Gems -- Monad Transformer Stacks
by Brian Hurt

The first of what a projected series of talks on libraries (and other language aspects) which are very useful, but don't get the publicity they deserve.  This talk focuses on libraries to manage monad transformer stacks.  Monad transformer stacks show up quite a lot in real world Haskell programs, and this talk will introduce several libraries that make working with them easier.

Lightning Talks
by Everyone (including You?)

We would like to open the floor for a round of short 5-10 minute talks on whatever strikes your fancy -- projects you have been working on, obstacles you have encountered, neat tools you have discovered. If you would like to present slides, please have them either online or in a standard format (pdf, html) on a usb. There will be a signup sheet onsite, but people are encouraged to contact the event organizers via meetup to reserve a slot beforehand (click the "contact" link at http://www.meetup.com/NY-Haskell/). All vaguely Haskell topics and all levels of expertise welcome. If you don't have much speaking experience, this is a great way to just dip your toe in the water.
results.name: Brian Hurt on Monad Transformer Stacks *and* Lightning Talks

A scavenger hunt and party rolled into one! Join us for this fun evening where you will get to meet awesome people, explore one of NYC's iconic landmarks and enjoy a great party with the friends you have already made on the Scavenger Hunt!   It is a fun and different way to spend a Wednesday.

How it works:  Join us for check in from 6:30-7pm at Lexington's Lounge in the Cort Hotel on 39th and Lexington.  Have a drink, socialize and unwind from the days work.  Upon check-in we’ll group people together into teams of 4 or 5.  One person in your group will need to have a camera or camera phone.  After we have everyone checked in you will have 75 minutes to find all the clues we have sent you out to find!

At the end of 75 minutes your team will come back to Lexington's for food, drink and fun conversations about what you just experienced. We will tally up the scores and announce the winners.

The teams with the most points will win prizes.

Cost: $10  Please bring exact change

Level: No prior knowledge needed of anything… just have fun.

Can I come alone?  Yes most attending will have signed up on their own.

What to wear: Anything (but you may find yourself running)

What to bring: A charged phone or Android device (don’t worry if you don’t have one, we’ll group you into a team that does)

What’s included?
- A fun and crazy time playing
- Meeting new people
- Prizes

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?

  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
Who are we?

We are Muslims of varying degrees of religiousness:
Some of us are practicing Muslims who simply want to take a more objective look at out teachings.
Some of us want to discuss certain tenets of our faith that don’t sit well with us.
Some of us have come to the realization that organized religion isn’t for us and want to discuss why.

What do we want?

We want to find the truth, no matter what it is, and fight for our right to follow it.
We want to create a safe place for people to exchange thoughts and ideas that we were taught not to talk about.We want to support each other and help each other deal with family questions and formulate answers.
We want to give others the chance to choose what they want for themselves, without fear of death, imprisonment, or persecution.

Is it safe to attend?

We will invite people to our meetings publicly but the meeting location will only be known to people who have attended a meeting in the past. So there are only two ways for a new member, or observer, to attend the meeting.
1- By coming with an existing member.
2- By replying to one of the ads and the volunteer group leader, Ibrahim, will personally talk to them to make sure they are either Muslim-ish or moderate enough Muslims that they would not harm members or reveal their identity. Please send inquiries to [masked]


And as this group is still in its infancy, we would like to keep it limited to people from Muslim backgrounds, as this will help us talk freely and comfortably knowing that we all come from the same place.


We will be meeting every two weeks, on Wednesdays, at 7PM, somewhere in Manhattan.
results.how_to_find_us: Please email muslimishnyc@gmail.com for our meeting location.
results.name: Muslim-ish: searching for truth, rejecting false idols, and fighting for freedom

This month NYC Apps is excited to feature two great presenters from Cooper, who will be visiting us from SF. "Defining Brand Experience" is the theme for the evening. We can't wait for our members to hear and learn from these special guests!


Rise is our event sponsor for August:

Overview:

7:00 pm – Good eats and conversations

7:15 pm – Discussion on the latest in the mobile landscape

7:30 pm – Presentation: Defining Brand Experience

8:30 pm – NYC Apps after-party

Presenters:

Nikki Knox, Design Education Strategist, Cooper

Teresa Brazen, Design Education Strategist, Cooper

Defining Brand Experience: Develop a strategy that defines what the brand experience needs to be for a product or service.

Cooper, a design and strategy firm in SF, works with a range of companies to help define their Brand Experience Strategy. By conducting a fun and collaborative workshop with key stakeholders we uncover the core brand values and what really makes a brand experience unique.

We’ve helped over 30 clients define their Experience Strategy and launch new products and services. Whether we’re working with a start-up or a well-known brand this workshop aims to get everyone aligned with the same vision. In this upcoming NYC Apps event, we’ll introduce you to a Brand Experience workshop and show you case studies for how it has informed product development and design.

Cooper is bringing 6 courses to NYC from August 24-29! 


NYC Apps members can get 20% off any Cooper NYC Course using the promo code: CooperNYCAPPS


Twitter accounts to follow:

@cooper / @ThinkRiseNY

NYC Apps social accounts:

@nycapps / #nycapps

Facebook page: NYC Apps

We look forward to seeing you there.

- NYC Apps

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, August 5th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The August session of Cuban Salsa:

Wednesdays (August 5th - 26th):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino  - Level 1

This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner <a>safety in</a> an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 Classes: ONLY $60
that's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

LOCATION
Adelante Studios
25 West 31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor - Grand Ballroom (3,000 sq ft!)

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.
*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 15-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video link of our group doing Rueda de Casino
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class immediately following Level 1 on Wednesdays at 8:30pm.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (August 5th - 26th):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (August 4th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:

Adelante Studios
25 W 31st Street between Broadway and 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.

*Can't find our room? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED (for both real grass and artificial grass)! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: WE HAVE A PERMIT.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- David T.)

(Co-Leader- Eric C.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 7-9pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 12 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.
results.name: Improv NOW! - Wednesday Improv Scenework Class 7-9pm ($10)

Please note that the time and location of this event has changed due to a film that was added to the events schedule at Socrates Sculpture Park. 


Let's say thank you and farewell to summer with a community potluck! Please bring snacks to share.

We will practice gratitude and lovingkindness meditation together, and eat and chat. All are welcome to attend whether you're brand new to the Mindful Astoria community or you have been with us since the start. 

Meditation instruction will be given--beginners are welcome. 

Thanks for a great summer, everyone!

After this, our next meeting will be September 9th (we will skip September 2.)

Teacher for this night's gathering: Emily Herzlin 

Emily (also the MeetUp group organizer) is a writer, editor, and teacher. She has taught creative writing and mindfulness meditation at Columbia University, The Interdependence Project, Adelphi University, GreenspaceNYC, and Mission to (dit)Mars. Emily has been practicing mindfulness meditation for ten years, and trained in Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) through the Center for Mindfulness at UMass Medical School. She is also a graduate of the Yearlong Immersion and Teacher Training program at the Interdependence Project, where she currently teaches MBSR and a monthly contemplative writing workshop. 

Mindful Astoria

Every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.

All classes are drop-in, but RSVP. $5-$10 at the door to support the teachers and the Astoria Presbyterian Church. *Note that no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Email any questions to Emily Herzlin at [masked].

Looking forward to deepening practice and strengthening mindful community with you all!
results.how_to_find_us: The church is located at 23-35 Broadway, between Crescent St. and 23rd St. It is on the north side of Broadway, just past Trade Fair and Synergy Fitness. There is an awning over the front door. The church shares the space with Art House Astoria.
results.name: Mindful Astoria Wednesday Meditation Gathering + End-of-Summer Potluck

results.description:
** Not many improv classes are this affordable in the city. Beginners and experienced improvisors are all welcome! **


Ever wondered what it might feel like to go with your GUT and create a situation from NOTHING right on the spot? The feeling is extraordinary. From beginning to end, building a moment either that tells a story and engages the audience is a powerful achievement, indeed. And honing this skill will make you a better public speaker as well!

Work with professional comedian and improvisor, Dewey Chaffee, on the basic tools required to start improvising like a pro!

Dewey has more than 20 years of improvisation experience. He spent 23 years perfecting his skills as an improv performer for the Walt Disney Company. He's also appeared on Nickelodeon Television and worked as their audience warm up guy for several seasons of TV production. 

Currently, he and his husband perform a live improvised comedy drag show, while at the same time, Dewey is taping his weekly MNN cable talk show, "The Midnight Kiki."

** Please RSVP online so that we can get an accurate headcount and not cancel by mistake. **

Rameet has spoken at various institutions and conferences such as the London Business School, Catalyst Week, and Northside Festival about psychology and technology, business models, futurism, mobile evolutions, and entrepreneurship. results.description:
What is a civic hacknight?

This is a weekly project night is for technologists, designers, developers, data scientists, map makers, and activists who are working on "civic technology" projects. Consider this to be a study hall or office hours to improve you and the city.

This night is for those who want to: 

* work on projects
* start a new project, or find one to join
* get feedback from experts
* learn about tools for local empowerment, open data, and open government

Bring snacks, your laptop, power supply, ideas, projects, maps, data, and questions. Collectively, we will try to answer them.

-=-=-

Hacknight resources:

For first timers trying to get the most out of the night, you should bring your laptop, watch Civic Hacking 101, Civic Hacking 102, and review our projects page.

* Working Groups - Developers' Corner, CityGram.NYC, City Record Online, & MTA Service Alerts
* Data tools: Data.Beta.NYC, data resources, maps, & tools
* Community projects in process - projects.beta.nyc

-=-=-


Projects & presentations:

We keep the “formal” part of the evening down to a minimum: announcements, meet your neighbor, etc. After, we will have a number of people present, specific projects, and have some skills share / education. 

Community Projects:

* What are YOU working on? Plug it into this event's comments section!

-=-=-

Event Partners:

The Code for America Brigade program is an international network of people committed to using their voices and hands, in collaboration with local governments, to make their cities better.

Microsoft Civic aims to collaboratively address the most pressing community challenges through the hyper-local creation, deployment, and evangelism of civic technology.

Accela provides civic engagement solutions for government. Accela’s solutions uniquely address the diverse needs of their constituents by making publicly available information more accessible. The Accela Civic Platform includes solutions for land management, asset management, licensing and case management, legislative management, right of way management, citizen relationship management, recreation and resource management, environmental health and safety.

-=-=-

Note about the venue:

This hacknight's venue has a special map. Please see this page on how to find NYU GovLab's Building.

You should RSVP with the name that appears on a photo ID. In order to give building security an RSVP list, RSVPs will close at 4:00 PM the day of the event. If you miss this deadline, most of the time security is nice and will let you in.

BetaNYC is committed to hosting safe and open events for all. By attending this event you are committing yourself to BetaNYC's Code of Conduct and Anti-Harassment Policy.
results.how_to_find_us: We're on the 9th floor.

results.description:
You're invited to join us for this weekly opportunity to sharpen your drawing skills!  This session is open to sketchers of all levels. 

What makes our sessions different? 

• We start on time in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break. 

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp! 

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• This is a two hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 


• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist. 

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon
