This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

Join us for Summer Tennis.

Check in at Clubhouse for court assignment upon arrival, then play under the lights 'til 10:00pm at this beautiful wooded park*.

Please remember to check in with the clubhouse to reserve a court. Players need to reserve a court with at least one other player present and should be a Hudson County resident with ID.

Mention to the court staff that you are with the Meetup group and ask that they keep us together if possible (3 courts).

Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game. And remember to bring plenty of water!

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending. I will provide my cell # for RSVP's so we can find each other. Please also bear in mind that we are usually on more than one court - they are available on a first-come, first-serve basis. You should locate other players and grab a court when you arrive.

Although we won't enforce attendance, please keep your rsvp updated because others are looking to find partners to hit with. Remove your name from the list if you are not planning to attend.

Inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

Thank you all for this great group!

*Free for Hudson County residents. Those outside of Hudson County may play as a guest of the resident players to avoid a possible $10 fee to play.

results.description:
The format of course stays the same: 5 minutes to show off your hack, and 5 minutes for the audience to applaud, cry, laugh, inquiry, snore, chew, stand, sit, dance, grow, interact, etc. But, of course, we hope that the audience provides lots of great feedback and asks interesting questions (probably while sitting, though dancing audience members are certainly free to participate as well)!


Show us what you've got! But, remember, no startup pitches, no work related projects[0], and no deckware! See you at Meetup! RSVPs open Friday at 12 PM, Noon.

If you're interested in presenting, this is the url to use:

•  http://j.mp/PresentAtRound34


NOTE: We're continuing to experiment with a $5 RSVP fee, which will of course be donated to an organization in need. (Last time we donated it to the Software Freedom Conservancy! https://sfconservancy.org/) See below for more information as to why this is coming about.

[0]: Let me clarify the "no job projects" rule. We want to promote the projects that people do in their spare time, for fun, or utility, and not the kinds of projects that are only applicable to people who work in your company, or your direct clients. On the other hand, there may be a project that you've built primarily at work, that solves a *general* problem that your company has allowed you to release with a libre license-- this is usually fine.


Questions We Expect To Be Asked

Why are you charging for this meetup?

* We've unfortunately noticed a growing trend. RSVPs are extremely competitive to get, and people take them and cancel, or even worse, just don't show up, which means we waste 30-40 seats, but still have a waiting list of 50+.

Do I have to pay if I sign up to present?

* No! Anyone who even so much as submits a presentation proposal, whether or not you're actually selected, will *not* be charged. If you want to present, you already have "skin in the game." We're trying to make everyone who wants to attend invested enough to *actually* show up.

I have a fixed income / am a student / just simply don't have $5 to spare, can I still come?

* Please contact [masked], let us know, and we'll take care of you! We definitely want to be as inclusive as possible, and if money is your only problem we won't let it get in the way of you joining us!

If you are healthy, you can see better, you can eat better, you can speak better, you can hear better and you can run better. All this depends on just one thing. Similarly that which enriches your spirit is so essential to enrich all other aspects of life.” -Sri Sri Ravi Shankar, Founder, Art of Living Foundation

Whatever we do in life, it is all directed towards being happy. Why do we even do some service to somebody? It is because it gives some happiness to us. So anything we do in our life is directed towards achieving happiness, greater happiness, and even greater happiness. That’s how the mind goes. Yet, are we happy? Yes, some times. But often not!

results.description:
Night Hike.. Come and join me and experience a walk through the Lost Brook Preserve. The hike/walk is approximately 3 1/2 miles and participants will stop for a quiet rest at the crossroads of the Purple and Allison Trail. This tranquil, meditative hike encourages reflection and connection with nature while experiencing the trails in a new way.

Please bring head lamp or flash lights. Dress according to the weather sneakers is ideal.

Those hoping to join via Skype should also send a message as soon as possible -- we expect more Skype viewers than usual this time. We hope you can join us to hear and talk to Dean!

group.name: The Staten Island Book Club Meetup

results.description:
Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 10 pgs (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

*A listing of contests and magazines to submit to can be found on our Discussions page

See you there,
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description: Through meditation, we learn to reduce stress and improve our mindfulness and concentration. This in turn makes us more relaxed, flexible and effective. results.description:
The first African novel published in English outside of Africa, this quest tale based on  Yoruba folktales is written in a modified Yoruba English. In it, a man follows his brewer into the land of the dead, encountering many spirits and adventures.

This one is fairly short (less than 200 pages) - so if you're not usually able to commit to a long one, give it a try.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Palm-Wine_Drinkard

Like Uncle Ted said, boardgames night Wednesdays! Enough said! Come join us  @ the uncommons for a quick game or two. New to boardgames? Don't worry! We won't be playing highly competitive strategic board games. But games that are highly interactive and social such as Saboteur, Love Letter, Machi Koro, The Resistance (if we have enough people) or Zombicide!

results.description:
Class focus is on restorative postures with a gentle sequence. Good for anyone, especially those looking to practice yoga from a gentle perspective.
Yoga can be taught from a chair seated and standing with the aid of the back of the chair to modify postures and create a individualized experience.
Vinyasa and Core Strength Yoga are taught in fusion. Breathing techniques are taught in sequence with posture names, positioning, parts of the body that benefit (adverse muscle groups, organs and nervous system) and the Chakras that will be balanced in association.
Extra 15 minute meditation practice given after class during Savasana (final relaxation) for those interested in a deeper practice. Bringing greater spirituality, grounding and peace of mind. 

Discount for those 65 years or over or on Medicare. 

This is a wheel chair excessible facility.

Free Parking. 

$12 a lesson.

$10 for seniors.
results.name: Chair Yoga Class

results.description:
Our typical agenda: - We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives. - Then we meditate together by chanting mantra followed by the beautiful sounds of the gong - And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:30 to 9 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we begin our meeting at 5 pm followed by an informal potluck social. If you are planning on staying for the potluck, be sure to visit www.perfectpotluck.com to enter your food selection. The website will help you decide what food to contribute to the potluck to make sure we have a healthy, balanced meal.

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.   We never have only a few members at a meeting. A dozen or more usually attend each meeting. The special potluck meetings we hold the first Saturday of each month has an average attendance of two dozen people.

Call Merrill or Mataji anytime you have questions:[masked]-5334.
results.name: American Meditation Society - Weekly Wednesday Meetup in White Plains

results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $9. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly: [url][masked][/url]

Time:
The closer to 7pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!

results.description:
We cordially invite you to the latest installment of Polyglot Bar NYC!  :D 

Modeled after Paris' famed weekly Polyglot events, this meet-up will allow people studying all languages at all levels to practice and find others who share their interest from all over the city.

Now that the weather has warmed up, we will be heading back to BOAT BASIN CAFE in Riverside Park! There will be a full bar, and no age limit for entry. :) They don't do reservations so just come in and find us! We will most likely be under or near the tented area in the central courtyard. (More details will be posted here when things get started.)

You don't need to be a "polyglot" to stop by -- if you have any interest in languages, we'd love to have you!


"LIKE" OUR PAGE TO STAY UPDATED ON NEW EVENTS!

https://www.facebook.com/polyglotbarnyc


CONNECT WITH US ON MEETUP!

http://www.meetup.com/polyglotbarnyc/


AND CHECK OUT OUR NEW WEBSITE + BLOG:

https://polyglotbarnyc.squarespace.com/
results.how_to_find_us: Look for nametags :). We'll try to be in or near the tent in the central courtyard.

results.description:
You are welcome to attend this hour-long workshop to learn techniques to reduce social anxiety! I will be discussing: 

-The definition of social anxiety

-How it develops 

-Why anxiety often sticks around

-Strategies to manage anxiety in your daily life

Feel free to visit my website www.drjuliegroveman.com to learn more about my clinical background, and check out the discussion board for my latest post titled "Normalizing Anxiety" or the Anxiety Fact Sheet on the Pages section. 

I also offer free brief phone consultations to answer any questions you may have about the group. 

If you can attend, please send me a private message or RSVP on the group page.

I hope to see you there!

Dr. Julie Groveman
results.how_to_find_us: Between Park & Lexington (Suite 1a)
results.name: Learn how to conquer Social Anxiety

results.description:
ONE SEAT LEFT! FIRST COME, FIRST SERVE. 

And by first come, I mean that you have to pay to reserve your spot. :) 



$59 orchestra seats to see the Tony Award winning "Best New Musical" 

FUN HOME introduces us to Alison at three different ages, revealing memories of her uniquely dysfunctional family—her mother, brothers and volatile, brilliant, enigmatic father—that connect with her in surprising new ways. This intimate and emotional theatrical experience is performed entirely in the round, bringing audiences closer to Alison’s story than ever before. Hailed as "the best musical of the season" by both The New York Times  and New York Magazine, FUN HOME "demonstrates how much our world has changed and reflects just how far we’ve come" (The Wall Street Journal ).

This is PRE-PAY ONLY. And maybe we should get icecream truck treats after? Yum!

Let me know if you have any questions!

H
results.name: FUN HOME for $64

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked]

Can't make this one?  visit us at www.turnonny.us
results.name: TurnON New York City

results.description:
Starting in October we'll be hosting D&D Encounters in our store. Until then, we'll be running adventures on Wednesdays. Whether you're a seasoned veteran or are just learning D&D for the first time, this is a great way to play.

We'll be using the new system (known as D&D Next or 5.0) for our adventures.


At the moment we only have 1 Dungeon Master (DM), so space is limited to 6 players. Be sure to RSVP if you plan to show up!

We're always looking for more DM's, so if you're interested feel free in becoming a DM, please contact us.

venue.name: Current place: Introductory Citizens' Climate Lobby Conference

results.description:
Be part of the team! You CAN make a difference in the world.

Our strategy is simple, the outcome is huge.
Empower individuals so that they experience significant growth of their own political and personal power, as well as discover and celebrate their own capacity to make a significant difference in this world. Our volunteers break down partisan and ideological barriers by reaching out to key stakeholders to build positive, effective working relationships.

Learn how you can generate the political will for a stable climate.
View this short film: bit.ly/cclfilm

What Others Are Saying

"With all the negative news on climate and Congress it's understandable to feel discouraged.  But hopelessness is not a strategy for making a difference and neither is acting alone.  Citizens' Climate Lobby is the antidote, the missing link, the Harvard of citizen activism." ---

Sam Daley-Harris Founder, RESULTS, Microcredit Summit Campaign, and the Center for Citizen Empowerment and Transformation
"Most impressive is the work of Citizens' Climate Lobby...If you want to join the fight to save the planet, to save creation for your grandchildren, there is no more effective step you could take than becoming an active member of this group." ---

Dr. James Hansen Climate scientist and former head of the NASA Goddard Institute
"The Citizens' Climate Lobby has identified the issue of pricing carbon as a vitally important lever in promoting dialog and action on climate protection. If you've been looking for that one group to join, you can stop looking now." ---

Dr. Daniel Kammen Professor - University of California, Berkeley To learn more about Citizens' Climate Lobby visit
www.citizensclimatelobby.org and register for a one hour introductory conference call:
https://citizensclimatelobby.org/join-weekly-intro-call/
This conference call is held almost every Wednesday night. 
For those who can’t attend our weekly intro call live, we provide a pre-recorded version, available after you register for the call.

VERY IMPORTANT NOTE: Don't let a very-low RSVP sign up number on the Meet-Up site discourage you from attending. The call is advertised in other places nation-wide. People who are already members attend local meetings and may not RSVP to the meetings listed on meetup.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

We start on time so please arrive fifteen minutes early. Doors close at 8:10p.

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact Aubrey at [masked]

If you can't make this one, visit www.turnonnyc.us for more
results.name: TurnON New York City

results.description:
It'll be the last Wednesday of the month, so that makes it the "official" monthly meeting.

We need to nominate ourselves a treasurer, count heads to see how many of us are willing to pay dues for 24-hour access to a physical maker space and take the next step towards becoming an incorporated entity.

Bonus:

1) Let us know about better, cheaper spaces available in western Suffolk. (which is where we'd like to be located)

2) Post pictures from LI-Con.org on the meetup site

3) Discuss balancing robots.

4) See how far the latest quad-copter build has gotten.

5) Contemplate the inner working of electric motors

6) Arduino!

7) Random off-topic conversation.
results.name: Discuss incorporation, getting a physical space, etc.

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street


East Coast Swing/Jitterbug with  Spencer Weisbond

This six week, progressive session:
Jul 29, 2015-Sep 02, 2015
Wed
8:30PM - 9:30PM

  101: Beginner   Learn cool moves to classic tunes! This progressive, basic swing dance class will teach the absolute beginner how to Jitterbug or what is now known as East Coast Swing. For young adults and above, this partner dance class will teach beginner moves in swing and the technique to execute them properly. The class will learn a routine over a six week period. No partner, experience, or TALENT required.

    

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3300 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. www.SwingRemix.com </a>

results.description:
Nitehawk’s annual screening of the cult classic horror-comedy STREET TRASH with writer/producer Roy Frumkes and actors Tony Darrow and James Lorinz in person!

When the owner of a liquor store starts selling 60 year old bad/cheap wine to the local hobos, they literally start melting to death. An overzealous cop tries to get to the bottom of all these strange deaths while also dealing with a deranged Vietnam vet. Street Trash is the kind of ridiculous, gross-out midnight fair you can enjoy regardless of where you live, but the film holds a special place in our hearts here at Nitehawk because much of it was filmed right up the road in Greenpoint in mid-1980’s, capturing the neighborhood before the wave of cultural and economic changes swept through the neighborhood, taking much of Street Trash’s trash with it.

Brooklyn Based: Street Trash was filmed throughout Greenpoint. For exact locations, check out this map we made on our blog, Hatched.

- See more at: http://www.nitehawkcinema.com/movie/street-trash/#sthash.5Dmr7IuL.dpuf
This will sell out, by your tix in advance:  http://www.nitehawkcinema.com/movie/street-trash/

results.description:
PLEASE TEXT rsvp[masked] - Cathy

MID PARK BEHIND REC CENTER @ HANDBALL COURTS (MAP ON THIS LINK) https://www.facebook.com/CatGarloFitness/photos/gm.383293988527791/596413443794335/?type=1&theater


NO ONE UPTOWN OFFERS POUND - this is a great opportunity to try a "NEW" FUN and different Calorie torching work out!!!


645am-715am - Pound Rock Out Work out - total body

you will need to bring, 

Yourself, Sneakers, comfortable clothes.

At least one water bottle (trust me, you’ll need it!) and a towel for all that sweat. If you have one, a heart rate monitor is an awesome fitness tool that instructors and students alike typically use to measure exercise intensity during classes. 

You may want gloves, & a Mat as we are going to get down and dirty, pullups, push ups, planks, knee tucks, Dragon push ups, hand walks, etc... so dress accordingly and get excited to have some fun while shaping up!!!.

WHY POUND? in shape magazine April 21 http://www.shape.com/fitness/workouts/15-next-big-fitness-trends

POUND is a full-body cardio jam session, combining light resistance with constant simulated drumming. The workout fuses cardio, Pilates, isometric movements, plyometrics and Isometric poses into a 45-minute series. Burn between 400 and 900+ calories per hour, strengthen and sculpt infrequently used muscles, and drum your way to a leaner, slimmer physique – all while rocking out to your favorite music!

Through continual upper body motion using our lightly weighted drumsticks, called Ripstix™, you'll turn into a calorie-torching drummer, POUNDing off pounds as each song flies by. Rock, rap, dubstep, pop and old school music fuse to create the POUNDtrack series, which is hand-selected by music enthusiasts, drummers and POUND founders Kirsten Potenza and Cristina Peerenboom.

GET RIPPED WITH RIPSTIX™

What would a drumming workout be without drumsticks? We’ve invented unique, lightly weighted exercise drumsticks that have been specially designed to get you ripped — hence the name: Ripstix™

Twice the weight of a standard drumstick (¼ lb each) and slightly shorter in length, Ripstix are designed to maximize your workout by alter the physics of your arm movement to burn more calories

IT WORKS.

POUND combines easy to follow (and not complex or embarrassing) cardio moves with strength training and drumming. This combo works the entire body, raises the heart rate to a fat-burning zone, and forces each move to be as precise as a basic beat.

Each 2-4 minute song is carefully calibrated with interval peaks and extended fat burning sequences, providing you with the best workout in the shortest span of time. After you’re done rocking out to the 45-minute POUNDtrack, you’ll have done 15,000 reps, performed over 30 extended interval peaks, and zipped through over 70 techniques without even realizing it

I am offering 1 week free, then a 15.00 contribution to workout material is appreciated per week. 

please watch my video to get an idea of how much fun we can have getting that beach body!  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SEfy9XKiqQc

please visit my website: catgarlo.com 

 facebook: CatGarloFitness and see some reviews. Photos and invites on here as well.

https://www.facebook.com/CatGarloFitness

results.description:
Positive Connections for Success is a more relaxed and personal networking group for business professionals looking to build relationships and grow their business through referrals.

We focus on:

• Networking: Building relationships and earning each others trust to become referral partners

• Education: Understanding your business and helping you articulate your business

• Leadership: Leaders of the round table philosophy, every member is a leader of this group


We follow a structured meeting agenda starting with networking to develop relationships, giving us time to talk and get to know each other while having a warm breakfast, followed by:

• One Minute Elevator Pitch

• Business Presentations with Q&A and feedback (we have a large screen & clicker/pointer available for powerpoint presentations)

• Brainstorming Session, Successes & Referrals to Help Each Others Businesses grow

• Lots of Fun in the Process

"We Refer Business Partners, Not Business Cards!"

This is a group with category/specialty specific members (only one member per category/speciality).
Please view our sponsors page or contact us to verify your industry, category and specialty, before attending a meeting so as to not be in conflict with a group member.

We meet every Thursday morning from 7:00 AM to 8:30 AM and welcome guests to come and experience the group and then apply to join.

Non-members/guests pay a $10 fee to attend, which includes a warm served breakfast of their choosing and we ask to please be prepared with a one minute elevator pitch presenting:

• who you are

• type of business

• who would be a good referral for you


Current positions that we are interviewing, to build relationships with and pass referrals to include:

• Auto Mechanic

• Cleaning Service

• Florist

• Handyman or women

• Landscaper

• Limo or car service

• Painter

• Plumber

• And more...

Please contact us for information or if you have any questions.

We look forward to seeing you at our next meetup!
results.how_to_find_us: It's 7am, you'll see us!
results.name: Weekly Business Networking Group

results.description:
BNI Chapter 17 – Referrals in Motion

We invite you to visit our weekly networking meeting, and let us help you grow your business. Every Thursday, we meet to develop our business relationships; and every day we work together to bring quality referrals and new business to our colleagues in Chapter 17.

Chapter 17 meets every Thursday morning from 7:00am to 8:30am at Hunt & Fish Club, 125 W 44th St, New York, NY. This week our featured presenter is our President, Jason Rulnick. Jason is a fine art dealer and advisor with a focus on historic post-war and contemporary masters.


Breakfast is FREE for visitors.

Please bring 50+ business cards to pass to everyone in the room and be prepared to tell the room who you are, what you do and who a perfect referral for you would be. Be specific!

BNI is unique in that membership is limited to one professional per profession - meaning that each one of our members locks out the competition by representing a specific category of business.  Email with questions or for more information.

You will meet quality professionals in these industries: CPA, business coach, voice/data/security, mortgage banker/broker, office machines, photographer, acupuncture, executive recruiting, payroll services, architect, residential real estate, health/life/disability insurance, computer consulting, title insurance, chiropractor, trust & estate attorney, real estate attorney, background screening, foreign currency exchange, financial advisor, property & casualty insurance, bookkeeping, graphic design, business/career strategic advisor, art dealer/advisor, office furniture, commercial real estate, business attorney, personal injury attorney and catering/Asian restaurant.

Desired Member Categories


• Event Planner

Personal Trainer

• Travel Agent

• Florist

• Massage Therapist

• Printing Services

• Dentist

• Matrimonial Attorney

• Immigration Attorney

• and many more!

results.description:
Women helping women train to find their inner warrior ! Walking can do so much more for you then get you from point A to B. It's a great way to tone up and increase your fitness and health.

My passion is CrossFit and Spartan Obstacle course racing and helping people improve their health and wellness. With the support and comraderie of other women of all fitness levels , we come together to walk and add in moderate intervals of body movement workouts as we power through the beautiful scenery of Tibbets Brook Park.

Women of all fitness levels, shapes and sizes can see in a few short weeks the amazing changes in their bodies ! Let's get in a powerful walk and chat about nutrition and relieve alittle stress and make our bodies stronger !! Who knows you may want to sign up for a local mud run with me!!!

results.description:
There has been some enthusiasm for a visit to Coney Island's Luna Park. I have not been since 1965 ! Time to revisit the legendary Cyclone (wood) roller coaster.

If you visit the Luna Park website you will also see an array of new coaster rides rated from "Extreme Thrill" to "High Thrill" to "Moderate Thrill". There is also the "Sling Shot" and "Coney Drop" tower and "Mermaid Parade" ride (lol)". And more.

Plus; Food, candy, beach. 

If this sounds like fun to you - sign up.

***DIRECTIONS AND SPECIFIC MEETUP LOCATION TO FOLLOW.

 For those traveling from Manhattan we will pick a subway meetup location. Trains to Coney Island: Q, D, F, N 

For those already in Brooklyn, we can meet at the park. 

A little complicated but we will figure it out.

Hope to see you there.


Frank

results.description:
This is a walking tour in Central Harlem. Join us and explore the word-class visual vocabulary in the largest neighborhood of Manhattan. We will explore it's storied past, interesting present and visualize the promising future of this dynamic community.

Itinerary:

• The Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture 
• Harlem Hospital Mural 
• Abyssinian Baptist Church 
• Strivers Row (architectural gem of the community) 
• Harlem's Walk of Fame 
• The Apollo Theater 
• And Much More 

We will explore these and more sights using the visual links immediate to the location.

Reservations:
Please RSVP. If you later realize you will not be able to attend please change your reservation.

Where:
Participants meet with the guide (Juan J.) in front of the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture by 10:50am. Map here. Walk concludes at the Apollo Theater; map here.

Cost:
This tour has a market value of $20 per person. You are not charged. At the end of the tour you can put a value to the information presented in the form of a gratuity. Other great ways you can contribute are by reviewing the walk and referring it to other people.

Some of the Sights we will experience:

I look forward to meeting you and showing you a great time in a great section of New York!
results.how_to_find_us: Participants meet with the guide in front by the entrance of the meeting location.
results.name: The Art & Culture of Central Harlem

results.description:
IMPORTANT:  DUE TO A HOUSE HOLD EMERGENCY,  THE ORGANIZER, LINDA, CAN NO LONGER ATTEND THIS EVENT.

Let's take advantage of the free Thursday admission at the Museum of the Chinese in America by seeing this promising show: 

"In celebration of the Museum’s 35th anniversary this spring, MOCA is proud to present Water to Paper, Paint to Sky: The Art of Tyrus Wong. Celebrated painter, muralist, kite-maker, lithographer and calligrapher, Tyrus Wong is one of the greatest Chinese American artists of the 20th century. This highly anticipated exhibition showcases his extraordinary body of work including Disney’s iconic American children’s classic, Bambi."

Admission and How to meet us:   We're meeting in the lobby at 11:30 am. Look for my hand-lettered MEETUP sign in the lobby.  If you're late, ask the security guards where the Tyrus Wong exhibit is. We do also have our own $1 fee to help defray the costs of maintaining this meetup group, payable to the organizer.
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be holding a handwritten sign reading MEETUP
results.name: The Art of Tyrus Wong at the MUSEUM of the  CHINESE in AMERICA

results.description:
Creating natural looking light in the studio allows complete control while creating images that are beautiful in their simplicity. Knowing how to control color and depth of field to create mood will give you food photos life.

Learn Techniques for Clean, Modern Food Photography

Learn: How to create morning window light.

Learn: How to create dappled outdoor looking light and convincing scenes.

Learn: How to stage your products to create interesting compositions.

While simple and clean food shots work for certain dishes, higher end clients want to see advanced techniques like splashes and full platings.

Learn: How to match the style and color of your light to scene you are photographing.

Learn: When and how to use advanced techniques such as splashes.

Demos Start at 12, 2 and 4pm

Come for one, come for all!

Daniel Norton is the Creative Director for Adorama with over 15 years experience as a Photographer, Director and DP in the advertising and editorial markets. Daniel also produces and hosts FREE weekly in-store trainings for Adorama every Thursday as well as the Adorama TV series On Set with Daniel Norton.
results.name: FREE Demo! Food Photography: From Simple to Advanced Techniques

results.description:
Join FAUN in Union Square on a Thursday evening as we enlighten the public and expose the horrors of a day to day existence of our fellow earthlings. Animals are brutally raised, handled and killed. They are living, caring, feeling, sentients who are used as commodities. Our fellow EARTHLINGS are killed for their skin, fur, flesh, secretions, imprisoned and abused for entertainment, poked and probed for unreliable and useless experiments, and hunted and tricked for sport. It is time for us to wake up, to educate ourselves and educate others. Animals are not here for us, they are here with us. 

---------------------------------------------------------------

WHAT: FAUN VEGAN EDUCATION IN UNION SQUARE

WHEN: Thursday, August 27, 2015 

WHERE: Union Square Park South, across from Whole Foods

TIME: 5 ~ 7:30 pm


Public transportation- take the N, Q, R, 4, 5, 6 to the L train to Union Sq.

We’ll have video, posters, leaflets, and a banner. You only need to bring yourself.

----------------------------------------------------------------

Humane meat is an oxymoron, humane slaughter is right there with pleasant rape and child molestation; vegetarianism is not enough, not eating them but supporting an industry that kills and/or grinds up their babies is not restraining from murder, it’s paying for it. Welfare campaigns advocate for lessening the suffering, and while we do agree that animals have an interest in not suffering, they have an even more fundamental interest in not being part of the institutionalized exploitation that causes suffering in the first instance and deprives them of their fundamental right to not be treated exclusively as means to human ends. Our goal is to abolish the institutionalized exploitation, not merely to pursue a measure that may or may not some time in the distant future reduce suffering.


Join us in educating the public about VEGANISM. Most people already believe that causing unnecessary pain and suffering is cruel… so let's show them that there is a way in which their morality and their actions can coexist with compassion. It is called VEGANISM.


“We patronize the animals for their incompleteness, for their tragic fate of having taken form so far below ourselves. And therein we err, and greatly err. For the animal shall not be measured by man. In a world older and more complete than ours, they are more finished and complete, gifted with extensions of the senses we have lost or never attained, living by voices we shall never hear. They are not brethren, they are not underlings; they are other Nations, caught with ourselves in the net of life and time.” ― Henry Beston

These animals have no voices; OURS are the human voices who must speak up for them and fight for the rights which our species should have granted them millennia ago.

There is No Justice, there is JUST US, let us NEVER be found guilty of doing less than our utmost for the millions of innocents abused, made to suffer and tortured to death for human sickness, vanity and greed!


Some talking points when speaking with non-vegans

http://www.abolitionistapproach.com/commentary-19-talking-with-non-vegans-about-veganism-five-principles/#.UxqRKaWBR_0


http://www.abolitionistapproach.com/

www.faunnj.org
results.name: VEGAN EDUCATION IN UNION SQUARE

results.description:
We'll set up a table, put up signs, pass out flyers and recruit more folks to support Bernie Sanders! We'll also be registering voters and identifying future socialist activists. No experience necessary!

We are talking about both why we love Bernie, and why we love socialism and want to build the long term, organized, grassroots and politically conscious movement that he talks about. We are registering voters and will be asking people to sign a petition supporting Sanders so we can remind them when it is time to petition to get his name on the NYS ballot, and so we can get them to volunteer to spread the word about him before then.

Look for a DSA/Bernie Sign or someone wearing a DSA tee shirt!
results.how_to_find_us: Large Bernie Sign, DSA tee shirt/table

results.description:
Skate the Brooklyn Pump track with Ghostskate!

Thursday, August 27th from 5pm - 7pm @ the Brooklyn Bike Park - 329 Kent Ave, Brooklyn, NY

Come join the Ghostskate meetup for an evening skate at the Brooklyn Bike Park!!  We'll be shredding this incredibly unique pump track, which is nestled in one of the most scenic spots in Williesberg, facing Manhattan along the East River.   Join Ghostskate for our first (of many) group skates at the brand new Pump Track!   (If we're lucky they'll let us skate till the sun goes down!)

Afterwords we will skate over to Jack Bar and play some pinball at a great local bar! (It is a bar so 21+ for the after party) 


The Pump track has a $10 per person fee for a 2 hour session, and trust me it's definitely worth it!

This is a intermediate skilled skate, and will REQUIRE you to be 18 years of age and to bring a helmet (they do have loaner helmets if you forget).  Please RSVP and I will send my contact information to the group the day of the event.
results.name: Sunset Skate at the Brooklyn Pump Track!

Join Sounds Off and YOGASMOGA for a silent disco and yoga class at the South Street Seaport Thursday, August 27 at 5:30 p.m.

Sound Off produces a wide variety of events with wireless headphone technology. Their wireless headsets let each attendee control their own volume and tune in to up to three channels of audio from DJs, emcees and video presentations. They help event organizers and event production companies create captivating events that can only be heard through their noise-isolating LED headphones.

YOGASMOGA in partnership with South Street Seaport and Pop Up Mob is hosting its first ever pop up shop in New York City. As a New York based company we are very excited to have the opportunity to host three events a week on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays while our pop up is open from August 1st - September 10th.

Please RSVP at [masked]!


**Mats provided**

results.description:
We've had a few weeks off due to Pride/ July 4th holidays, but now we're back on track with a double feature of our next installment of BIKING WITH GUYS: 

Brooklyn Bridge Park featuring public art by JEPPE HEIN: 'PLEASE TOUCH THE ART', and outdoor movie screening of CLUE!

ITINERARY: We'll meet on the SW corner of UNION SQUARE PARK at 5:30pm sharp, then bike downtown and over the BROOKLYN BRIDGE, until we get to the Brooklyn Bridge park on the waterfront.


We'll then explore the public art by JEPPE HEIN, bike along the waterfront, before setting up camp on the lawn on waterfront for the FREE moving screening of 80's classic film DIE HARD. There will be beverages and snacks available for purchase, or you may bring your own.

FEE: a $5.00 minimum donation, with proceeds from this and future rides going to CYCLING FOR THE CAUSE, the annual AIDS RIDE that benefits our very own LGBT CENTER. (You may pay your tour guide Joey in cash at the event, or via FREE Venmo app before/day of ride)


What you need to bring:

*YOUR BIKE (if you don't have your own, you may rent one for the day at one of the numerous bike shops around the city. You will need to rent your bike before the group meets at 6:00pm, we cannot wait for you to rent your bike after start time. we may decide to change meeting point to a bike rental shop, depending on demand.)

(You should NOT get a Citibike, they require to be checked in every 30-45 minutes, and to be courteous to all the other riders we won't be stopping to swap them out all day!)

*BACKPACK/NAPSACK- to carry all of your supplies

*HELMET- Safety is very important, protect yourself!

*WATER- we all need to keep hydrated

*SNACKS/FOOD- to eat at the picnic, or pick up something along the way

*SHEET OR BLANKET- not required, but it'll be more comfortable to lie on the grass with!

*CASH and ID- if you want to pick up treats and/or drink, some places only take cash

*BIKE LOCK- If you have one, you may wish to bring it, just in case we decide to stop somewhere at end of trip and want to lock it up

***DISCLAIMER: We strongly recommend wearing a helmet for every BIKING WITH GUYS trip. If you rent a bike, helmets are usually included with the rental. Guy Social is not responsible for any possible injuries that may occur during this or any bike trip we host. This is a recreational but not beginners biking event, and you must have some solid basic bicycling skills to partake in this event. We advocate bike safety and biking rules of the road. Any injury is solely the individual's responsibility, and Guy Social or any representative of Guy Social is not liable, financially or in any other manner. By reading these terms,  submitting your RSVP, and attending the event, you understand and agree to these terms.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet in front of Subway entrance at SW corner of Union Square Park
results.name: BIKING WITH GUYS: BROOKLYN BRIDGE PARK + OUTDOOR MOVIE: 'DIE HARD"

Curious about 3D printing? We will have a variety of 3D printers from Makerbot, 3D Systems and Tinkerine in action and a short presentation on the possibilities for classroom use. PicoTurbine will also be demoing its energy, robotics, and sharing information about its new STEM modules.

As we believe in learning by doing, all guests will be encouraged to interact with the various educational kits and 3D printers around the office and to ask as many questions as they like to our expert staff.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul
results.name: Soccer Thursday- 5:45pm@W102nd Street Field

results.description:
New campaign on Thursdays. Let's get to it.

The World:

The campaign takes place in the world of Solnarn, a magitek world similar to Eberron or World of Warcraft. The place you’ll be starting off in is the city of Idris in the empire of Amtaris. Amtaris is a xenophobic human nation run by a magocratic military dictatorship. Idris is the southernmost major city of the empire and is probably the most cosmopolitan and accepting of nonhumans. It also has a high concentration of “skips,” people who get sucked in from other realities and are prone to popping in and out of this reality seemingly at random.

To the south is the ruins of the goblin empire, which got annihilated in the last war with Amtaris. The goblins, hobgoblins, orcs, etc are now trying to rebuild some sort of life in the wreckage.

To the east are a range of high mountains, beyond which is a vast desert which belongs to the Eternal Republic, a nation of elves who worship death and necromancy.

Far to the north Amtaris is fighting a war against The Alliance, a group of small nations of all races desperately trying to prevent Amtaris from expanding into their lands.

And to the west is the ocean and the Endless Isles, a countless number of small islands with various peoples on them.

Character Creation/Homerules

This is a 5th edition campaign starting at level one. We’ll probably spend the beginning of the first session on character creation. Everything in the PHB is fine except the Human Variant rule. If you want to do something outside that, let me know and we'll figure something out. Also, if you want to be from another world (like Faerun, Grayhawk, Ravenloft, etc) who got sucked into this world, that works.

Also, we’re going to be doing something a little different, in that I’m going to incorporate a little of the FATE system into this with everybody choosing aspects. It’s pretty much like the ideal/personality trait/flaw/etc thing currently in 5e, but with some added gameplay mechanics to it. Your aspects are a bit about who your character is and what’s important to them. They can be relationships, catchphrases, descriptors, items, or whatever that paints a picture of what you’re going for with the character. When one of your aspects applies to a situation, you can invoke your aspect to gain advantage on a roll and/or do something cool. If you’re in a situation where one of your aspects could make something worse, you can compel an aspect to get disadvantage on a roll/make something terrible happen and gain an Inspiration point.

Everybody gets seven aspects, laid out as follows. The goal is for them to be interesting and capable of being both good and bad things.

1. Core concept/ideal: What your character is all about.
2. Early life trait: Something that shaped your character early in their lives.
3. Background: A more interesting way of describing the background you’ve chosen
4. First adventure: Something based on whatever event inspired you to start adventuring
5. PC Bond: Something that creates a relationship between you to one of the other members of the party
6. NPC Bond: Something that creates a relationship between you to an NPC in the world.
7. Secret: An important secret that you’re keeping from at least one of the other PCs.

Update:  A little more about where you guys will be starting.  Idris and southern Amtaris experience four seasons: Earth, Wind, Fire, and Water.  The campaign begins at the start of the Fire season, when huge waves of magical flames sweep the countryside.  Refugees flood into the city seeking the protection of it's large walls from the flames.
results.name: The As Yet Unnamed Campaign of Increasingly Poor Decisions

results.description:
Choosing in the Microsoft Data Landscape.

Choosing where to store your data is far more difficult than it ever has been. We can be paralyzed with choice! This session seeks to ease that anxiety and provide direction for application developers. You'll learn the differences between DocumentDB, Azure Table Storage, Blob Storage, Azure SQL Database, SQL in a VM, and more. See demos and review case studies so that you'll have a complete view of how data is stored in Azure and how to choose great tools, leading your project down the path to success.  Ike Ellis, a SQL Server MVP and a friend of Red Gate will be giving the presentation, and Red Gate will be sponsoring the presentation and providing refreshments and  giveaways.

Note: Please Provide your first and last name at least in the questions provided when you register for this meeting. It's needed so I can provide a list to security.  A number of you keep skipping them every time you register.

Redgate will also be conducting a full day workshop on source control at the same location during the day. To find out more and register, go to : http://www.red-gate.com/training/workshops/source-control/source-control-workshop-27-august-2015

Ike Ellis is a SQL Server MVP, author, speaker, and business owner.  He's a partner in a San Diego software studio in San Diego, California called Crafting Bytes.  He's a Friend of RedGate and speaks and trains on RedGate's DLM products.  He's the founder of the popular San Diego User Group, the San Diego Tech Immersion Group.  He'll be speaking at SQL PASS Summit 2015 in October and at RedGate's SQL in the City 2015 in Seattle.  He loves writing code and always has an IDE open.  Follow him at @ike_ellis.
results.name: Choosing in the Microsoft Data Landscape

results.description:
An Unlikely Union: The Love-Hate Story of New York's Irish and Italians

with


Paul Moses
Professor of Journalism at Brooklyn College/CUNY
Former city editor of "Newsday."

Mid-Manhattan Library

(diagonally-across 40th St from the main NYPL)


 This illustrated lecture unfolds the dramatic story of how two of America’s largest ethnic groups learned to love and laugh with each other in the wake of decades of animosity.


Meet at 6pm to socialize; presentation begins ~6:30pm.

http://www.nypl.org/events/programs/2015/05/14/unlikely-union-love-hate-story-new-yorks-irish-and-italians
results.name: An Unlikely Union: The Love-Hate Story of New York's Irish and Italians

group.name: VSL: Offbeat & Eclectic Events for Irreverent Eccentrics

results.description:
Meeting point -  The Bear Mountain Inn main parking lot:

https://www.google.com/maps/dir/41.3120292,-73.9888497/41.3116986,-73.9885759/@41.3118982,-73.9887665,385m/data=!3m1!1e3

We will do the usual loop, going up Major Welsh and down the Appalachian trail.

This is a fast paced hike,  with some steep spots and rock scramble.  It is not recommended for absolute beginners.  


Please bring appropriate clothing and footwear, lots of water,  map if you are not familiar with the area etc .

++

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

venue.name: Innovation Fitness at Twinboro Physical Therapy

results.description:
45 minutes of Flexibility, Stabilization and Core Training

15 minutes of Body weight and DB Strength Training.

* This class is appropriate for all skill levels.

Who is this for?

Stretch and Strength is a great class for people seeking a lower intensity class as a part of their fitness strategy.

A great addition/ supplemental class for high intensity "Achievers".

Great for beginning exercisers to build a strong base of core, balance and support to enable them to live with less pain and improve functions of daily living.

A great class for GOLFERS. Golf Fitness will improve your felxibility and balance and power to increase clubhead speed and reduce post round pain.

A fantastic class for high intensity exercisers (Cross Fitness, Rev, Runners) to insure they maintain proper muscle balance.

Stretch and Strength combines Yoga and Pilates moves, Balance Training and Dyanamic Flexibility exercises to insure your body maintains the proper muscle balance to help prevent injuries and increase core strength.
results.name: LINCOLN PARK - BODY ALIVE

results.description:
Speech contests are a great way to put your public speaking skills to the test. 

Speech contests are a Toastmasters tradition. Each year, more than 10,000 Toastmasters around the World compete in one or more of the following contests:


Humorous – Contestants present a humorous speech that must be thematic in nature (opening, body, and close), not a monologue (series of one-liners).Table Topics – An impromptu speech, all contestants are assigned the same topic, told to them when they are introduced by the contest chair.


Come and join us for our annual Club Humorous Speech Contest and Table Topics Contest on Thursday, August 27.  Watch our Club members put their public speaking skills to the test. Learn more about Toastmasters, and get inspired to overcome your fear of public speaking.

Doors will open at 6:00pm, the contest will begin at 6:30pm.
Light refreshments will be served.


Please RSVP and we will see you there!
results.name: Humorous Speech and Table Topics Contest

group.name: New York Area ASL Practice Group

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening 5K walk or run or C25K. Because we are meeting after most are getting out of work the pace will be more conversational.

There will be no bag check. If you need to check a bag please go to the Running Company Store located on the second floor of the Time Warner Center located in Columbus Circle, if you are meeting at the Central Park Entrance at Columbus Circle. If you are meeting at the 72nd Street Transverse (72nd Street inside the park, go to Jack Rabbit located at 140 W 72nd St. Bring a lock for your locker.

As with all of our workouts we will include ab and other workouts as well as stretches to enhance your performance.

Walkers and Runners will start out together. We will establish a point to meet up for workouts mid-way. The course we trek will depend on the interest and experience levels of all who join.

Please bring water with you to stay hydrated. We will provide RAP protein gummies for all who participate and Gevalia Kaffe Iced Coffee with Almond Milk after the work out courtesy of our sponsors.

If you are running late or need to cancel please contact an organizer as soon as possible. 3 no shows will lead to members being pulled out of the group.

If you have any questions please let us know.

We look forward to seeing you all!

Cheers to happy walks and runs!

Your sole sisters,
@JKORunning
results.name: Thursday Night Power Walk or Run

results.description:
Meet me at Central Park for a guided meditation. That means you don't have to do anything except for show up and be ready to leave feeling happy and peaceful! Bring something to sit on if you mind sitting directly on the grass.

I will lead you through a meditation which will bring awareness to your body, mind and soul. We will release any limiting beliefs and practice diaphragmatic breathing. We will work through the 7 chakras and raise your energy, releasing any blockages in your energy field. 


Once you get to Sheep Meadow, look for a big, round rock. You can't miss it. We will be sitting near it. If you need help finding us, please call/text me at <a>[masked]</a>. Please leave a donation after the meditation. It helps me keep the group going. Average donations are $10-$20.

***classes start at 6:15-6:30 the latest and last about 45 minutes. We do some stretching after the meditation to get the blood flowing and our bodies moving. Wear something stretchy and comfortable. If you are coming straight from work, don't worry about it, just come in and join us. After the meditation we usually chit chat and share our experiences. Classes are small, usually around 5 people or less. 

Love,

Rina
results.name: Meditation at Central Park

venue.name: Ramapo Mountain State Forest Lower Parking Lot

results.description:
Better than the gym Thursdays!

[masked], [masked] are the exact GPS Coordinates for the trail head.  The lower lot is technically right across the street from 64 Skyline Drive address.

Fast night hike.  6 ish miles (been known to reach 7.33 ;-), with about a 900 ft elevation gain

We will meet at the LOWER lot of skyline drive in Oakland at 6:15pm on Thursday evening. This will be approximately a 2 - 3 hour hike.

We will take the blue trail to Ramapo Lake then decide if we take the white trail that leads us to some great views of the sunset and NYC.  We can walk through the Van Slyke Castle. http://theoaklandjournal.com/oaklandnj/hike-into-history/">http://theoaklandjournal.com/oaklandnj/hike-into-history/</a> and decide our descent and length of the hike from here.  Most likely we'll take the white to yellow and back to blue and out. This route will change from week to week depending on group so please have a map or gps.

http://www.state.nj.us/dep/parksandforests/parks/maps/NYNJTC_NJParkMaps-RamapoMtn_2015-85x11.pdf"></a>" class="linkified">http://www.state.nj.us/dep/parksandforests/parks/maps/NYNJTC_NJParkMaps-RamapoMtn_2015-85x11.pdf;

Bring headlamps, maps and water. Have fun!

FYI...Very good information about ticks available from the website link below. Helps to take away some of the mystery and scare tactics.

http://www.tickencounter.org

results.description:
Arduino Essentials  is designed to take you beyond  the basics and get you ready to start working on your own  Arduino project.   This six week course will equip tech-friendly beginners with the confidence and skills to use the Arduino platform in multiple future projects.

This is a hands-on course which is designed around a sample project that you build and take home with you at the end of the six weeks.  Each session will focus on a different essential a skill and help you overcome several ‘hurdles’  that have been observed to discourage  those who attempt to solve problems using Arduino. 

Cost: $225 for the full six week course

***Prepayment is required for this course.  One you respond yes on meetup we will reach out to you with payment options.



Digital I/O

• Switches and pull-up resistors

• Driving LED’s

• Power considerations

• Experiment: combination lock

Analog I/O

• What is an ADC

• PWM

• Experiment: Thermometer with color output

Program Flow Control

• FOR

• IF

• SWITCH CASE

• DELAY

• Experiment: Illumination level and/or Mood Lamp

Serial Communication

• Using the Serial Monitor

• Experiment: Bidirectional Communication

Interface and Drivers

• Bipolar Transistors and MOSFETs

• Driver chips (ULN2003, ULN2804, LB1205)

• Stepper shields

• H Bridge shields

• Experiment: Small Motor control.
results.name: Arduino Essentials - It's time to move beyond blink (6 of 6 Sessions)

results.description:
Updated March 8th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside as a backup.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

results.description:
COME BREAK UP THE WORK WEEK AND JOIN US FOR A SUNSET MOUNTAIN BIKE RIDE AT MOHONK PRESERVE.

Please arrive by 6:00pm at the West Trapps Parking Lot to allow time to prep your bike and gear so that we may depart promptly by 6:15pm.

Starting from the West Trapps Lot we will Follow Undercliff Road to the Rhododendron Bridge.  We will cross over and take a right onto Oakwood Drive.  Next we take a sharp left onto Kleine Kill Road, then a left on Forest Drive, another left on Lake Shore Road and a right onto Long Woodland Drive which will take us to Humpty Dumpty Lane.

At Humpty Dumpty Lane we will stop at one of the Gazebos and take in the breathtaking views before our descent down Laurel Ledge Road and head back to West Trapps via Overcliff Road.

Please note: Our route may change slightly depending on the groups abilities, remaining daylight and enthusiasm levels. The addition of Duck Pond is an option that will cover more elevation if the group is up to it.

Distance: Approximately 12-13 miles

Estimated Bike Time: 2 hours

Difficulty: Advanced Beginner / Intermediate - Gravel Carriage Roads with some Steep Hills

Current Weather Forecast: Partly Sunny with a high of 73 degrees

MANDATORY GEAR:

• Mountain Bike or Hybrid

• Bicycle Helmet

• Headlamp with spare batteries

RECOMMENDED GEAR:

• Clear eye Protection (safety glasses - for bugs, dirt, etc.)

• Related maps, a compass or GPS, Water, Snacks, First Aid, etc.

• Bike Pump

• Tire Patch Kit and/or Spare Tube

PLEASE INSPECT YOUR BIKE PRIOR TO ARRIVAL TO INSURE THE FOLLOWING:

• Proper Tire Inflation

• Lubricated chain

• Properly Shifting gears

• Functional Brakes that don't rub rim or tire when released.

In Fairness to the group, anyone having trouble once we reach the Rhododendron Bridge will be asked to go back on the Overcliff Trail which is still a fun and scenic but shorter loop.

WHERE TO MEET?

West Trapps Parking Area - Mohonk Preserve

[masked],[masked]

RELATED MAPS:

New York - New Jersey Trail Conference - Shawangunk Trails Map Set

(Specifically Trail Maps 105 & 106)

Also check this link for a .pdf of Mohonk's own Bicycle Routes map

(Please Note: More routes have been opened up to biking since the publication of this .pdf)

Afterwards feel free to join us at Bacchus Restaurant, Bar & Billiards for some great food/drinks & maybe even a game of Pool! (Venue subject to change based on group preference) 

Contact Information:

Bacchus Restaurant

4 South Chestnut Street

New Paltz, NY 12561

Phone: (845)[masked]

Website: http://www.bacchusnewpaltz.com/index

Hours:

Lunch: 11am – 4:30pm

Dinner: 4:30pm – 10pm

Brunch: 10am – 3pm (Sat & Sun only)

Late Night Appetizer Menu Closes:

Sun – Wed @ 11pm | Thurs – Sat @ 1am

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

The Financial District is where it all  started for NYC.  This simple Dutch Colony has certainly changed over the years!  Join us for another fun and informative scavenger hunt as we set out to uncover clues, secrets and really cool things in Manhattans oldest neighborhood!  The group will meet for cocktails at The Battery Gardens Cafe Beer Garden where we will set you up on teams and send you out on your journey!

Here is how it works:

-Arrive at the beer Garden of the Battery Gardens cafe between 6pm- 6:15.  Enjoy a cocktail and a snack and we will start putting together teams (unless you already have one)

-Once you have a team you will be sent out into the area from Battery Park to City Hall to find historical facts and clues.

-Each team will have 75 minute to gather as much info as possible and return to Battery gardens Cafe where we will tally up the points and announce the winners as we enjoy more food and drink!

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will likely come on their own.

What should I wear: Most come from work so business casual./ Dress for the weather and be comfortable.

What am I looking for? You will be looking for historical & current information, taking photo's and bringing some things back.

How long does it last?  The actual hunt is 75 minutes from the time you leave the beer garden.  Most people hang out for drinks following the hunt.

Do I need experience?  NO

How do I pay?  Please bring exact change $10 There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: Financial District Scavenger Hunt & Beer Garden Party

• Become a more confident public speaker?

•Feel more at-ease during business meetings and social occasions?

•Make new friends, in a supportive and encouraging environment?

The friendly people at Pride Toastmasters would love to help you improve your public speaking skills, as you boost your leadership and self confidence skills! We focus on making our guests very welcome. We meet every Thursday from 6:15 p.m. until 7:25 at the LGBT Center, 208 W 13th St, New York, NY 10011. If you arrive early, expect to be warmly greeted and given an overview of what to expect during the fun, informative and engaging meeting! 

By the way, there’s nothing for you to prepare in advance of our meeting, no fee to pay as our guest and no pressure to join.  Please do visit and sample this exciting option for personal and professional growth!

An average of 20 members and guests attend each Pride Toastmasters meeting. Since most aren't members of Meetup, the attendance figures shown here are always much lower.

Please visit our web site at http://www.PrideToastmasters.com
