results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

The Financial District is where it all  started for NYC.  This simple Dutch Colony has certainly changed over the years!  Join us for another fun and informative scavenger hunt as we set out to uncover clues, secrets and really cool things in Manhattans oldest neighborhood!  The group will meet for cocktails at The Battery Gardens Cafe Beer Garden where we will set you up on teams and send you out on your journey!

Here is how it works:

-Arrive at the beer Garden of the Battery Gardens cafe between 6pm- 6:15.  Enjoy a cocktail and a snack and we will start putting together teams (unless you already have one)

-Once you have a team you will be sent out into the area from Battery Park to City Hall to find historical facts and clues.

-Each team will have 75 minute to gather as much info as possible and return to Battery gardens Cafe where we will tally up the points and announce the winners as we enjoy more food and drink!

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending will likely come on their own.

What should I wear: Most come from work so business casual./ Dress for the weather and be comfortable.

What am I looking for? You will be looking for historical & current information, taking photo's and bringing some things back.

How long does it last?  The actual hunt is 75 minutes from the time you leave the beer garden.  Most people hang out for drinks following the hunt.

Do I need experience?  NO

How do I pay?  Please bring exact change $10 There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
For any newcomers, a Work synopsis. Put your stressful thinking up against inquiry by asking 4 questions and then turning it around:

1) Is it true? (Yes or No)
2) Can you absolutely know that it's true? (If your answer to the first question is Yes, sit with this question for a while.)
3) How do you react, what happens, when you believe that thought? (Explore the consequences of believing the thought.)
4) Who would you be without the thought? (In that same situation, who or what would you be if you couldn't believe that thought?)

Now turn it around. Say your thought is, "Jane doesn't listen to me." You can turn this thought around to its opposite, to the self or to the other.  The opposite: "Jane does listen to me." Now find at least 3 concrete examples of how this is true, or even truer, for you.
To the self: "I don't listen to me."
To the other: "I don't listen to Jane."

Find your examples in each case. They are your prescription for living.  Welcome to the Work.
results.name: Come answer your questions and bring your stressful thoughts.

results.description:
The Bi Book Club meets once a month to discuss bi-themed books and the issues they raise. Dinner after nearby.

The Summer of Sex: Our book for August is Memoirs of a Gigolo by Livia Ellis, Omnibus Vol. 1-4  on sale at BGSQD. In this collected omnibus edition of the first four e-books in the series, you'll learn why Oliver turns to a life as a male escort when he is a titled English Lord (and a tabloid favorite). Follow him as he travels the globe (Tokyo, Bangkok, etc.) bedding a Latin pop star, two princesses, and a beautiful Russian fellow escort as charming and duplicitous as himself. This book has a very humorous tone. You won't want to stop reading. 

Pick out some phrases, paragraphs or scenes that you'd like to discuss, or just join in on our read-a-long. Last month we had a blast reading bisexual scenes from our erotic romance book out loud with everyone taking different roles. Give us your critique of the book. What worked, what didnt, how was bisexuality represented? If you havent had time to finish the readings, come anyway because we read passages from the book aloud for discussion. As usual, we'll also be using the text as a jumping off point to further discussion of bisexual issues and personal experiences.

Deciding Books: We will be voting on what book we want to read next, so check the list of Bisexual Book Award finalists for some ideas.

Venue: Bureau of General Services Queer Division Bookstore at the LGBT Center, 2nd fl. Rm. 210, phone (646) 457-0859.

Getting Books: We urge you to purchase your print copy at BGSQD and support the only LGBT bookstore in New York City. Especially since they are hosting us in their space! Recognize is now in stock! 

Bi Book Club meets 4th Thursdays 6:30-8pm. Dinner after nearby.

Questions? Email fuscialadybug (at) netzero (dot) com or call[masked]
results.how_to_find_us: Rm. 210-Bureau of General Services: Queer Division Bookstore

results.description:
Have you seen articles mentioning a documentary currently in the works called Sweetening the Pill? Directed by Ricki Lake and Abby Epstein (who directed The Business of Being Born) investigate the negative ramifications of longterm hormonal contraceptive use. Such side effects are almost never disclosed by doctors, but all it takes is a glance into any infertility group to see that a number of women struggle to regain their fertility after long term pill use. Other side effects include compromised gut flora and nutrient deficiencies.

On the other side, women with healthy natural cycles can use their monthly cycles as a barometer for their overall health and are able to assess their fertility on a monthly basis. Natural hormone fluctuations also naturally suppress a woman's appetite during the first half of her cycle and increase her metabolism during the second. There is so much about our monthly cycles that most women simply don't know about.

The purpose of this first meetup will be to discuss some of the issues with long term pill use and will then look at a natural cycle and what we should expect from a healthy, natural menstrual cycle. There are certain things we can do throughout the month to maximize our energy, health and well being.
results.name: Birth Control Pills vs. Natural Cycle {FREE}

results.description:
Let's have a music picnic in Central Park! Both musicians and non-musicians are invited, but we especially encourage musicians and singers to come on out. Pretty much what we'll do is sit in a circle, and one by one each of the musicians will play and/or sing something. We'll also have a group singalong, and a very improvised jam session with all the musicians (that want to) joining in. Most of the time, though, we'll have one by one performances by each of the musicians who attend.

What to Bring: (Food, Water, and Musical Instruments)

This is both a music event and a vegan picnic. Bring food and water for yourself to eat and drink. If you'd like to bring food to share with others, you may, but there is no need to. Any food you bring must be vegan, even if you yourself are not 100% vegan. (This is an event of the NYC Vegans Meetup, and that is part of what we do -- eat vegan food together.) Also, any sharing of food is at your own discretion.


Where to Meet:

At 6:30pm, we'll meet right on the southern border of the park, at the corner of 7th Ave. & Central Park South (59th St.), directly across the street from the New York Athletic Club at 180 Central Park South. I will be holding a "VEG MEETUP" sign. We will meet on the park block itself. We will wait just 10 minutes, and then at 6:40pm we will walk into the park. Plan to be early in case of delays, and don't be late (or you'll miss us)!

Train Directions: Take the A, B, C, D or 1 Trains to 59th St.-Columbus Circle, or the N, Q or R Trains to 5th Ave./59th St., or the F Train to 57th St.


If you would be so kind: after you RSVP for this event, can you add a comment below saying what instrument you play (or if you are a singer)? (If you are not a musician, you can write "not a musician.")


We are so looking forward to a relaxing and beautiful evening in Central Park, as we get to hear the talented musicians in our group, while enjoying a vegan picnic!

David and Dzina
results.how_to_find_us: How to find us: We'll meet right at the southern border of the park, 7th Ave. & Central Park South (59th St.), directly across the street from the New York Athletic Club. I will be holding a "VEG MEETUP" sign. We will meet on the park block itself.
results.name: Vegan Music Picnic in Central Park

group.name: NYC Vegans: Brooklyn + Manhattan Dinners + Outings

results.description:
Let's MeetUp and talk about  how data scientists go from the data to actually gaining insights and making predictions.

Find us on LinkedIn to continue our conversation virtually!

Educational Data Mining/Learning Analytics

Agenda:

6:30P - 7:00P - Arrive and Networking

7:00P - 8:00P - Presentation, Henri Dwyer, data scientist and engineer at Dataiku, a big data company that makes software to help teams of data scientists process and make sense of big data.

8:00P - 8:30P - Q&A, Networking and Closing.

Abstract: 

In this talk, Henri Dwyer will guide the audience through analyzing real educational data, taken from Ryan Baker's MOOC: Big Data in Education. Ryan Baker was our previous speaker and if you want to have some hands on experience about the data he talked about, this meetUp is for you. 

The goal of this talk is to show how data scientists go from the data to actually gaining insights and making predictions, and to teach how to do it. First, Henri Dwyer will lay down the foundations and data science concepts necessary to understand the analysis. Next, he will construct data science workflows using Python and Data Science Studio to analyze data ranging from detecting students that are gaming the system, to identifying sequences of student events and how they affect behavior.

Speaker Bio: 

Henri Dwyer is a data scientist and engineer working on building the best platform for data scientists at Dataiku. Before, he did physics research on air pollution and solar cells. He received an MSc in Engineering from Columbia University and a BS and an Ms in Engineering from Ecole Polytechnique in Paris. Henri now lives in New York City and is always keen on discovering new data science problems to solve.

Sponsors: 

GROVO

Grovo is reinventing training for the 21st century workforce, combining a user-friendly, cloud-based platform with a powerful library of microlearning lessons. These expertly designed 60-second videos teach everything from Salesforce and Slack to leadership and innovation. Grovo is used by the world's best companies to educate, align, and inspire their people.

Founded in 2010, the learning technology company is based in New York City and has raised venture financing from Accel Partners, Greg Waldorf, Costanoa Venture Capital, SoftTech VC, Lerer Ventures and Red Swan Ventures. 

GENERAL ASSEMBLY

Established in early 2011 as an innovative community in New York City for entrepreneurs and startup companies, General Assembly is an educational institution that transforms thinkers into creators through education in technology, business and design at fourteen campuses across four continents.
results.name: Going from Raw Data to Impactful Predictions!

group.name: Educational Data Mining/ Learning Analytics in NYC

• Meet-up members will receive 50% off (enter promo code HALF-PRICE-CARD) on the Climbing 101 class on the day of their meet-up. Classes must be booked in advance.

The Cliffs at LIC features:

Expertly-set routes for all levels of climbing experience + ability

results.description:
Join the members of The NYC Political Forum for an evening of engaging discussions on foreign policy, history, and diplomacy over dinner.


A national debate has reignited once again in Japan to change its Constitution. A proposed security bill — currently working its way through the Japanese Parliament — is a drastic departure from its current status as a "pacifist" nation. The bill would effectively repeal Japan's constitutional mandate to renounce war to resolve an international conflict — moreover, this measure would permit the Japanese military to serve overseas for the first time since the WWII.

This debate is taking place amid the 70th Anniversary of the A-bombings in Hiroshima and Nagasaki.  Furthermore, Japan's relations with its neighbors in the recent years have become increasing rocky — including the rising tensions brought on by the territorial disputes in the East China Sea.


Our discussions will include the following:

• As a general matter, should any nation be barred from assertively exercising its military power — notwithstanding a Constitutional mandate that prohibits it from doing so?

• Was the "Unconditional Surrender" of Japan, as set forth in the Potsdam Agreement fair and just?

• Should the burdens to enforce the Constitutional mandate rest with the U.S. or other allies?  In other words, should the U.S. and its allies assert aggressive diplomatic tactics to ensure Japan's compliance?

• Is the time ripe to revisit the validity and efficacy of the Treaty of Mutual Cooperation?  In other words, should the U.S. draw down its military presence in Okinawa?

• What will the future of Japan look like: 1) under a "modern" military era vis-à-vis the relations its Asian neighbors; and 2) can it maintain its economic superpower status on the global market?

--------------------------------------------------

LIMITED RSVP

The RSVP window will open on Thursday, August 20th at noon -- the RSVPs are managed this way to make it fair for everyone, especially given that there are very limited spots.

--------------------------------------------------

VENUE INFORMATION

Click here to view the menu.  Each attendee is responsible for his or her portion of the bill, to be paid separately.  To access the venue, take the elevator to the Fourth Floor -- upon exiting, turn right and go towards the outdoor terrace.  We will be gathering at a large table at the outdoor terrace, similar to the photo shown below.
results.name: Dinner & Politics: Japan's Military Ambitions (Post WWII)

results.description:
The Beginner Buddhist Book Circle is for anyone interested in or new to Buddhism. In this biweekly series, we’ll explore classic introductory Buddhist books. Although we have “reading assignments”, the meetings focus more on basic Buddhist teachings rather than strict discussions of the books. Our meetings are casual and informal; all levels of interest and experience are welcome. When possible, we’ll have copies of the current book available at no cost. Meetings occur on the second Wednesday and fourth Thursday of the month unless otherwise noted. Please see the Meetup page and calendar for the full schedule.

*** Right Now We’re Reading: “The Dhammapada” translated by Gil Fronsdal***

The Dhammpada (Teachings of the Dharma) is one of the most popular, widely read, and most accessible of all Buddhist texts. The clear and direct teachings on key topics like meditation, mindfulness, ethics, and compassion are especially well-suited for anyone exploring basic Buddhist teachings.

While there are many translations of the Dhammapada, we’ve chosen to read the version by Gil Fronsdal, frequently cited as the best English version to date. The book is readily available in bookstores and libraries. Furthermore, there are audio versions of all chapters freely available from the Insight Meditation Center.

For the Aug. 27th meeting, please read chapters 22 through 24 (~12 pages).

Discussion points include:

-What is "heaven" and "hell" according to Buddhism?


-How can we stay focused in troubled circumstances?


-Why do (negative) cravings and desires cause us problems?


***

Happy reading and we hope to see you soon!
results.name: Beginner Buddhist Book Circle

results.description:
We're all shooting a lot of video with our aircraft - what to do with all that beautiful footage? For many the flying and capture is the easy part, but sitting down with software like Final Cut Pro X or Adobe Premiere can be daunting. This 3 hour event is meant to remove the veil of mystery about video editing. How to structure, time, and edit your footage is really where the magic happens.

Just because we have the tools, doesn't make us filmmakers. Our guests (to be announced) will give us real world examples of compelling aerial footage and why it works and how to incorporate filmic thought into your work.

Our guest this evening is Jeff Brink, co founder of Aerocine, now Aerobo. For those not familiar, Aerobo was one of the first companies exempted and approved by the FAA to fly UAS commercially in the US. They are also the first production company to be permitted to fly in NYC.

Jeff is going to deconstruct some of the videos he has cut for Aerobo and describe his process. How he sorts clips, naming conventions, storage and retrieval practices, and how he begins previsualizing a timeline.

He will then demonstrate different techniques and effects providing the terminology and jargon used in editing practice culminating in the reconstructed edit of the Aerobo show reel.

Jeff has also offered to take a member's raw footage and edit a short piece as we watch. If you are interested in having your raw footage transformed into an edited short piece at the event please submit a dropbox file, vimeo, or you tube link with the raw footage. Note: we aren't promising a final product. Your footage will be used to demonstrate how raw footage is winnowed down into a stellar edit.

Jeff requests that the links be provided before hand so he can preview the footage and begin the previsualization process.

This is not a platform specific talk, no need to bring your laptop loaded with any particular application, but an overview of the editor's process and how his methods can apply to your work. Editing is hugely time-consuming and starts with good footage. The edit, music, and titles bring the whole package together to evoke emotion.

There will be ample time to socialize before and after Jeff's talk as well as Q&A.

This event is free and thanks in large part to the generosity of ENJOY, our hosts for the evening goenjoy.com
results.name: Video Editing Crash Course

results.description:
This run starts at the "Wild Duck Pond" area of the Saddle River County Park in Ridgewood. We will start at the beginning of the mile markers which is near the exit, not near the entrance. There's parking close to the beginning of the path. If you cannot park in the lot nearest the beginning of the path, you'll need to reenter the park and park in the next closest lot. The driving area of the park is U-shaped so to get to the parking lot closest to the start of the run, you essentially drive around the "U" and approach the exit to the last lot on the right (by the dog park).


We will start at the "Wild Duck Pond Area" and will turn around at some point. If you'd like to run additional miles, you are certainly more than welcome to do so as the mile markers make it simple to track your distance. Depending on the turnout we sometimes break off into little groups of two or three people, each of which may go at slightly different paces and/or distances. Regardless, if you wish to run at a slower pace, I am more than happy to run with you at your preferred pace. Nobody gets left in the dust. This is a fun run, not a competition.

For those who wish to stick around after the run, we may get together at (insert favorite Ridgewood hot spot here) to relax, catch up, and share some laughs. When we do this, we usually get to the restaurant between 7:30 and 7:45. If anyone cares to join us that didn't come to the run, you are certainly welcome.

We will run rain or shine, hot or cold. If you RSVP "Yes", please do your best to be on time as we'll only wait a couple of minutes past 6:30 PM to get rolling. If you have questions, comments, or doubts, feel free to email me. Looking forward to seeing you on Thursday.

100 Lawyers Strong, a professional and lifestyle legal network, is celebrating its second anniversary on August 27th at Hotel Chantelle in Manhattan’s Lower East Side. Please join the Network’s Attorney Members, Affiliates and friends for a very special evening of networking, music and fun. Bring your busy cards, we’ll get the cupcakes.

New Web Members may get admitted FREE at www.100lawyers.com today. To join the Network as a Full Member, contact Founding Member Jack Vilella, Esq. for more information about benefits of membership.

Vendors who are interested in sponsoring this event should contact [masked].

EVENT DETAILS

ADMISSION: 

• FREE for 100 Lawyers Strong members & Eventsy Premium Members (please email [masked] for your discount promo code)

• $10 for attorneys

• $50.00 for VENDORS

SCHEDULE OF EVENTS

6:30pm – 7:30pm: Check in, drinks, networking and photo ops
7:30pm – 8:30pm: Welcome, Introduction to 100 Lawyers & Legal Forum Q&A
8:30pm – 10:00pm: More drinks, networking, and prize draw

Bring your business cards for a chance to win several fabulous prizes.

ABOUT 100 LAWYERS STRONG

100 Lawyers Strong is a professional and lifestyle network comprised of elite solo and boutique law firm owners based in NYC and growing nationally . The 100 Lawyers Strong Network is comprised of attorneys who focus their practices in a particular area and refer cases outside of that primary focus to other attorneys within the Network. Our motto is STRENGTH IN NUMBERS!

MISSION 

Our Mission is to improve the careers and lives of our attorney Members by offering professional and personal services unlike any other legal network or bar association.

Our Members are highly qualified and stringently qualified. They strive to provide individuals with legal issues in NYC and beyond access to service-oriented attorneys ready and able to handle any legal matter regardless of how routine or complex it may be.

results.description:
"IQ and technical skills are important, but emotional intelligence is the sine qua non of leadership." - Daniel Goleman, Harvard Business Review article "What Makes A Leader?"

Click Here To Register For Emotional Intelligence At Work


If you are a manager, business owner/leader, social/non-profit leader or entrepreneur, and you care about: 

• Creating significant change in your organization or the world

• Fully embodying your deepest values, visions, and aspirations

• Inspiring and leading others towards evolutionary goals

• Enabling genuine collaboration and creativity in your workplace

Then this evening is for you.

Come and learn about the ways in which you may be unconsciously holding yourself or those you work with back from the very changes and impacts you are most wanting to create. Discover how unconscious patterns can be playing out in toxic or other negative ways in your workplace and undermining attempts at collaboration and creativity.

During our 2.5 hours together we will open up the often taboo territory of how our own personal inner challenges and unconscious conditioning is affecting our performance at work and the health and effectiveness of our workplaces. If you have ever wondered why you struggle with certain aspects of your career, why your team won’t gel even though individually they are exceptional, why, even though you have a deep personal commitment to change, you still are challenged to fully embody it, this evening will provide you with an introduction to the breakthrough understandings you need.

Click Here To Register For Emotional Intelligence At Work


Bring your curiosity, your challenges, and your courage.

For those of you who are committed to creating evolutionary change, here is an opportunity to open up in a supportive container to explore areas of pain and stuck-ness and to leave with new understandings and an introduction to some tools that can begin to make a profound impact on your personal and professional effectiveness.

For those who choose to take the risk, there will be an opportunity to share your challenges and receive insight and guidance. You will also have an opportunity to network and share with other courageous and conscious leaders.

Click Here To Register For Emotional Intelligence At Work


Iyeshka Farmer worked as a senior manager, fundraiser, facilitator, and change consultant to leaders for 15 years when she realized that many of these amazing, visionary and brilliant people were getting stuck in their own personal limitations. She embarked over the past 10 years, studying with world leaders in many fields (including Dr. Robert Augustus Masters, Harrison Owen, Peggy Holman, Don Beck, Marilyn Hamilton, Birgitt Williams) to find the answers and tools to assist others in understanding and healing the deep unconscious patterns holding them back from achieving their greatest potential. She is currently Senior Teacher-Trainer with the Masters Center for Transformation and is a Registered Psychotherapist in private practice.
results.name: Emotional Intelligence at Work: Deepening Your Capacity for Conscious Leadership

results.description:
Join us for a book review of the AMORC book The Mystic Path by Raymund Andrea.

The topic for this week's discussion is Chapter 4: Mystic Inspiration.

You can download the chapter free here!

About the Book

Former Rosicrucian Grand Master Andrea discusses subjects of particular importance to all people traveling on the mystical path.This informative and inspirational work will guide you across the threshold of mystical initiation. The author provides insights into the states of consciousness and experiences you may have as you travel the mystic path. It is filled with the fire and paths of the initiate’s quest. His spiritual, mental, and physical crises are fully described and pondered. Andrea’s deep understanding of the essence of Western mystical and transcendental thought makes this a book you will treasure and refer to often as you advance in your mystical studies. Among the many topics addressed are: Meditation, Contemplation, Awakening Consciousness, the Dark Night of the Soul, Mystical Participation, and Mystical Union.

All are Welcome!
results.name: Circle of Spiritual Inquiry - The Mystic Path: Mystic Inspiration

results.description:
I'm loving the momentum of this group and witnessing how folks are improving their language skills and making friends. To me, it makes all of this worth doing!

So let's get ready for another great meetup! 

As always, first introduce yourself in the language you are studying. Then introduce yourself in your native language. 

Following that, we will dedicate 30 minutes towards helping those learning English, then 30 minutes of Chinese. 

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

Thanks again for your support thus far and let's have many more great meetups! 非常感谢大家的支持！

results.description: Find out what business schools want to know about you. I've written a lot of recommendations for business school and I've proofread a lot of application essays. Most students wait until the end of the process to seek help with their applications and by then it's too late. What this seminar will attempt to do is to get you thinking about what qualities you have and business shools want to see. results.description:
Trance Night – An Evening of Music, Trance and Dance for Evolutionary Change

August’s Trance Night will be held on Thursday, August 27th at the TRS Professional Suite in Lower Manhattan.

Expect hypnotic stories, Milton Model language patterns and a whole lot of serious fun.

You will learn about the power of Neo-Ericksonian Hypnosis because you'll experience it first hand.

Thursday evening, August 27th

TRS Professional Suite, 40 Exchange Place, New York City, NY

7:00pm – 9:00pm

* NOTE – Please arrive EARLY. Consider this a sacred space. Arriving late will disturb the process.

CLICK HERE - ONLY $22 (via PayPal)

Trance Night – As in previous trance nights, the trance induction while lying on the floor will be recorded so attendees can download it later on.


Doug O'Brien
Certified Master Practitioner and Trainer of Neuro-Linguistic Programming; Ericksonian Hypnotherapist
­http://www.dougobrienhypnosis.com
http://www.ericksonian.com

As a Hypnotherapist, Doug helped found the Department of Complementary Medicine at Columbia Presbyterian Hospital in the mid-nineties, under Dr. Mehmet Oz. Doug worked directly with pre-operative and post-operative patients on stress management and pain reduction as well as long term behavioral change to generate healthy living.

Doug O'Brien, is an NLP Master Trainer - originally given that designation by Anthony Robbins over 20 years ago - and is called a modern Shaman by some. He is also a musician and composer and a Trance Master Guide.

He is the guy who gave Tony Robbins an insight that completely changed Tony's approach to his second book (it was going to be called "The Niagara Syndrome" and became, instead, "Awaken the Giant Within")

Doug is the guy who has been the success coach to two of the top internet marketers in the country as well as corporate executives, top musical artists, fashion designers and professional athletes.

He has helped literally tens of thousands of people quit smoking in one session.
He has helped similar numbers lose weight and keep it off through the power of Hypnosis.

He can help YOU, too.

Endorsements/Testimonials
“I have attended all three of Doug’s Trance Night sessions. Each experience has been extremely powerful with noticeable results and the impact has lasted. I am definitely looking forward to attending the future Trance Nights.”
  – Jackie

"Best Meet-up ever.”
  – Kate

“Your Trance Night was a wonderful respite from the world. It was like a vacation from all of the stresses of every day life, a vacation for my soul. It continues to ripple though me today. So glad I came.”

  – Marshall

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

New York Tarot Tarotology is a class devoted to the study of the pictorial language of the Tarot. Have you ever wondered "What do the cards mean?" Or, "Why does every book you've looked at say the cards mean something else?" This class will answer both those questions. 

The on-going classes, will feature Tarot Symbolism, the Esoteric Titles assigned to each card in the Tarot as well as what each title means, Astrology and the Tarot, Qabalah and the Tarot, which includes a study of the Tree of Life,  Alchemy and the Tarot, as well as the History of the Tarot. 

All levels are welcome, even if this is your very first class.

There will be a Meet-Up sign on the table.

Please try to be here by 7:00 PM. Panera Bread closes at 9:30 PM and we have quite a bit to cover.

Payment can be made in class.

results.description:
Turn up the heat and own your Summer with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your SUMMER with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call 

<a>[masked]</a>

-nine-zero-eight-three-zero-three-five-zero-three-one-


Looking forward to training with you!

results.description:
Sorry again for my delay in closing the poll and posting this month's book!

We're going to be reading The Left Hand of Darkness by Ursula K. Le Guin - a real classic, and an amazing book. 

Goodreads says: "A groundbreaking work of science fiction, The Left Hand of Darkness tells the story of a lone human emissary to Winter, an alien world whose inhabitants can choose -and change - their gender. His goal is to facilitate Winter's inclusion in a growing intergalactic civilization. But to do so he must bridge the gulf between his own views and those of the completely dissimilar culture that he encounters. 

Embracing the aspects of psychology, society, and human emotion on an alien world, The Left Hand of Darkness stands as a landmark achievement in the annals of intellectual science fiction."

See you on August 27th!

results.name: August Book Club - The Left Hand of Darkness by Ursula K. Le Guin

results.description:
The NYC Atheists Advanced Writers Group Is Accepting New Members

The NYC Atheists’ Advanced Writers Group, now going for two years, is open to talented writers who want the support and camaraderie of other secular writers in polishing their work and getting happily published.  Our group meets once a month; we gently critique each other’s work, but our main focus is on helping each other get published. There is no charge for this workshop; we ask only that you commit to meeting once a month, reading the work of the other members and offering your suggestions for improvement in an upbeat, encouraging manner.

What do we mean by “advanced writers?”

We mean those writers who are close to being published or have already been published in some form. We also mean writers who, we can see by reading samples of their writing, have great potential but until now have not been mentored or encouraged to treat their work seriously or to aim for publication.

How do you know if you fit our criteria for a writer with promise?

You don’t.  Writers are often poor judges of the level of their talent. We suggest that you give us the opportunity to judge that, because we can often sense that spark of talent even if you yourself do not.  Additionally, we have recently instituted a new member category, dubbed “Apprentice author”--individuals who demonstrate potential but who have not yet been published anywhere or achieved commercial capability.

Submit a Sample

If you are interested in joining this kind of a close and involved group of writers, submit a sample of your writing (15 pages or less) to the group,plus a personal letter telling us a little about your background, what you are aiming for and what you think we can do for you. Your sample submission may be a play, fiction or non-fiction. If fiction, it can be a short story or a chapter of a book.  If non-fiction, the sample can be an article or a chapter of a non-fiction book. If a play, send only Act One.

If you are accepted into the group, we ask only that you encourage and support each group member by reading his or her material, critiquing it in a kindly, professional manner and attend our monthly meeting to discuss it in a group setting. There is no charge whatsoever for membership in the Advanced Writers Group.  Our goal is to encourage more good secular writers to enter the literary marketplace.

Bear in mind that once you are accepted, everyone in the group accepts that you are headed for publication; this is not a “learn to write” group. This is a group whose members have shown themselves to have solid skills and need only minimum critiquing or, more importantly, encouragement in tackling the publishing industry, which, when done alone, can be discouraging. We are there as friends, as your cheerleaders, your mentors, your colleagues. 

Jane Everhart, Facilitator  NYCA Advanced Writers Group

Let's get together to play capoeira, learn about Brazilian culture and history, and grow as individuals! Capoeira is an Afro-Brazilian martial art form created by slaves in the 16th Century. Disguised as a dance, it combines elements of martial arts, music, and acrobatic movements. This beautiful art form helps improve: self-esteem, fitness, coordination, agility, flexibility, balance, rhythm and happiness! Bring your positive energy! All skills levels are welcome.

$25 per class

http://abadacapoeira.com/

results.description:
TICKETS ON EVENTBRITE

---------------------------------------

Please note that you must have a ticket from Eventbrite to attend.

RSVP'ing on Meetup alone will not get you in.

Technodelics: Mind Revealing Technologies

Presented by Vincent Horn, Founder of Buddhist Geeks


Price: $15 for early birds, $20 for regular


Today there is a convergence of trends on the horizon that could have a dramatic impact on how we understand and explore consciousness.  Thousands of years of contemplative wisdom and an emerging science of both meditation and psychedelic compounds is coming together with next generation hardware--things like augmented & virtual reality headsets, wearable computers and sensors, and neurotech devices that can directly read and stimulate the brain.  In this talk we will explore the nascent edge of this emerging class of technodelic devices and look at how they could very well usher in a new era of interest in consciousness.

Vincent Horn is part of a new generation of teachers translating age-old wisdom into 21st century code. A computer engineering dropout turned modern monk, Vincent spent his 20s co-founding and running Buddhist Geeks while doing a full year of silent meditation practice. Having come back to the world with open hands he continues to podcast and teach through Buddhist Geeks, helps hack minds at mindtraining.io, and works with CEOs and technology companies through reboot.io. Vincent has been called a “power player of the mindfulness movement” by Wired magazine and was honored to be featured in Wired UK’s “Smart List 2012: 50 people who will change the world.” He is married to the super-fly Emily Horn and is father to a little boy named Zander.


Connect

We post discounts & freebies here:

Our Newsletter • Designers + Geeks Facebook • @DesignersGeeks

Satisfaction Guarantee

We organize this group to promote innovation, creativity, and the benefits of new technology. If you purchase a ticket and aren't happy with the experience, can't make it, or decide that you don't want to support the community for any reason, we're happy to refund your money.

Please note that if you do need to cancel your reservation, we request that you do so at least 24 hours before the event so that the tickets can be shared with others who may be waiting.
results.name: Technodelics: Mind Revealing Technologies

results.description:
Greetings Dear Friends,

In the 7 yrs that I've been doing these sessions, they've become my most popular event, averaging 20 - 35 people. You can come in person to these sessions or sign up for the distant healing list. You can also put your pets on the distant healing list for free. There's some testimonials below, and many more on my website. If you are coming in person please arrive at Madison Wellness by 7pm (THE DOOR WILL BE LOCKED AT 7:30PM) and pay when you arrive in cash or credit / debit card (don't use Paypal if you're coming in person - they take out a fee). If you are on the distant list, the energy will run from 7:45pm - 8:45pm EST. There is no conference call or video feed for the distant session, simple lie or sit down in a quiet place where you won't be disturbed from 7:45pm - 8:45pm. PLEASE READ THE INSTRUCTIONS BELOW VERY CAREFULLY IF YOU ARE REGISTERING FOR THIS EVENT! In this session we will help the group resolve self esteem issues related to self doubt. Many of us are limited by unhealthy self doubt imprints that block self self confidence and accomplishment, contentment and self acceptance. We'll spend a portion of the session targeting those imprints and release as much as we can. As usual, we'll also do a general tune up and clearing for the mind / body / emotional / spiritual aspects.


Registration Instructions

In order to register, you must email me at [masked] stating that you are coming in person or that you want to be put on the distant list. For distant participation, give me your full name as you want it written on the distant list. Then you can Paypal me your $20 by going to the contact page of my website and clicking on the "Make Payment Now" button. This will take you to my PayPal page. If you don't have a PayPal account, click on "Don't have a PayPal account?" on the lower right and fill in the fields with your credit or debit card info. Participants are encouraged to make a written or mental list of their intentions for the session. What do you want to heal, let go of, bring in or enhance in your life (your intentions don't have to be directly related to the theme). We don't have to know what your intentions are, we simply channel with the intent to address whatever you want and need. If you don't have specific goals for the session, just ask for "whatever is best for me". It's best to lie or sit down in a quiet place where you won't be disturbed for the session. Here's some testimonials -


"That was and still is the most amazing healing ever. My ears filled with a ringing sound so loud and my heart was pounding seemingly out of my chest. I wanted the fear to stop. Then a waterfall of pure light fell over and through me and I calmed to a beautiful inner light. My ears are still ringing and I know that to be the angels singing!"
Beautiful! L.Z. (distant participant in California)


"Wow! I just wanted to thank you so much for last night's distant vortex session. It was one of the most powerful sessions I've had from you and Carol before and as you know I'm a regular, ha! The last 30 min I felt as if my heart was opening up to pure loving energy and it was indescribable."
Thank you so much,
S. B. (distant participant in Toronto)


"Amazing!! I felt so exhilarated, excited yet deeply @ peace. I'm still feeling the peace and tranquility." - M.B.

"wow. you guys...just wow. such a delivery of clarity to me in this one. great calmness to my heart and clarity to my mind. was able to let so much go that the energy leaving my field was palpable. no problem because it was followed by a great wave of love and i am still floating awash in an emotional sea of realizing/manifesting the next leg of the voyage. blessings my beautiful friends." C.S.J. (distant participant in Texas)

"I must say that last nights session was very profound. It feels like everything has come together. I wasn't feeling great for a couple of weeks and I was losing faith and courage in all things. I was ready to ditch all spiritual pursuits. After last nights integration / harmonization session I feel invigorated and motivated again. Thanks to both of you for providing these sessions!" KC - (distant participant in Toronto)

"I have gotten 3 distant group VortexHealing® sessions and I just wanted to say it is incredible how powerful it feels each time. Even the times I wasn't able to to fully concentrate and enjoy the experience, I felt such a sense of joy and upliftment wash over me when I was doing tasks and I knew this was real what I was experiencing. I suffer from depression and each session makes me feel like a child at my healthiest and happiest state, or as if I am on a very high dose of anti - depressants without the terrible side effects. It means so much to me and I just want to thank you so much - you truly have a gift!" SB (distant participant in Toronto)

"The session was fabulous, afterward I felt light as a feather. It's hard to put the experience into words ... felt like my soul was being caressed" Jane (distant participant in Montreal)

"Geordie - Thanks for getting back to me. I put through a "tip" for the session Thursday. It was very peaceful and deeply healing for me. I woke up yesterday and the virus I've been living with for the last 5 weeks had begun to clear. I'm also looking forward to the benefits I've noticed from other sessions that go on for months after! Thanks so much!" Susan (distant participant in NYC)


Love & Gratitude,
Geordie Numata
Usui Reiki & Karuna Reiki® Master/Teacher
VortexHealing® Practitioner
Counseling Astrologer
N.A.D.A Certified Acupuncture Detox Specialist

China Hands NYC is proud to announce another meetup! We know there hasn't been one in awhile, and we've missed everyone!


China Hands are invited to meetup at WeWork Charging Bull on the 9th floor, in New York City's financial district, at 7pm on Thursday August 27th. 

Carl Minzner, currently a Professor of Law at Fordham University, will be speaking about "China: The End of the Reform Era." Mr. Minzner is known as an expert in Chinese law and governance, with op-eds having appeared in The New York Times, The Los Angeles Times, and the Christian Science Monitor. This meetup is one you cannot miss! You can read his paper on this topic here.

We'll be providing good beers, drinks, and snacks, and we're thankful for your $10 meetup contribution towards the costs of staging New York's best China Hand networking community. Due to strict building security, PLEASE RSVP before the event to have your name placed on the guest list. Security will not grant access to names not listed on the guest list. China Hands NYC is grateful for the support of our foundation sponsors...

Allegravita
Strategic Communications and Public Relations
Allegravita is an award-winning, multi-disciplinary public relations and strategic communications agency focused on the China region.


China Luxury Advisors
China Luxury Advisors counsels luxury brands and retailers on their China consumer strategy, ranging from market entry to digital to attracting, converting, and retaining affluent Chinese customers worldwide. Thanks also to our generous venue sponsor...

WeWork
WeWork is the platform for creators. We provide the space, community and services you need to create your life’s work. To learn more about WeWork's 12 locations in New York City, send an email to [masked] and let them know you were referred by China Hands NYC. 

Please RSVP today and join an amazing community of fellow China experts in New York City!

Mathew will talk about "How to Pivot from One Job or Industry to Another" based on his own career journey from a startup in the sports and entertainment industry, to investment banking at UBS, to founding his own healthcare accelerator.

In addition to hearing from successful young professionals, the new Leadership Engagement Series encourages members to explore taking a more active role in TIES as a future President or leader of one of our four teams: Charity Management, Events, Communications or Member Relations. results.description:
The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for three years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

If you feel uncomfortable leaving your personal belongings at the track, you can drop them off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team.  They will store our belongings for us.  ***Please note that they will not let you in without your ID so please bring that with you to the track.   http://www.acebar.com/about.html

See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!

Contact Event Host if you need a ride or further information.

---------------------------------------------------------------------

This event is free and open to the public.  It's also a great time to stop in and see what the MakerBar is all about. Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.  MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization, consider donating today... All donations are tax deductible.....

Doors open at 7PM-till ?????

results.description:
This event is being sponsored by The New York Social Network and their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of RSVP's below reflect only a portion of those attending.

Satisfy your appetite to meet fun new people with our famous Rotating Group Dinners.  First enjoy casual conversations then you will be randomly seated at the table for our group dinner.  After each course of the meal you will be randomly directed to a new seat!  It is a fun way to meet others in the group as you wind up sitting with different combinations of people throughout the dinner.  It is fun, goofy and very effective at creating great connections.  The restaurant itself is nothing to look at but the food makes up for the lack of atmosphere!  We have hosted dozens of great dinners there.  

The meal will include: Soup, Choice of appetizer, choice of entree, Nan bread, basmati rice, dessert and free flowing wine!

Appetizer:  Samosa (meat, veg or coconut)

Entree's Include:

Chicken, Lamb, Veg or Beef:  (Curry, Korma, Malai, Sag, Dhansak, Madras, Shree Mangol, Dilder, Bhuna, Doplaza Okra Masala ).

Chicken Tandori,

Chicken Tikka Masala, Butter Chicken, Chicken Makhni

Sag Paneer, Malai Kofta, Mutter Paneer, Aldo Chana Masala, Kashmiri Eggplant, Okra Sag, Mushroom Sag, Aloo Palak, Chana Palak,

Biryani-Chicken/Lamb/Beef Veg

Salmon or Shrimp (Curry, Korma, Malai, Madras, Vindaloo)


$30 includes: full meal, tax, tip and free flowing wine! (Please bring exact change)

What to wear: business casual/comfortable

What to expect: 12-16 fun and friendly people

Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending. (We have a 3 flakes and you’re out rule).

results.description:
Its open board game night! Grab some friends and your favorite board game and head on over to the Highlander location in Boonton to have some fun.  Don't have a game, or interested in playing a new one?  We've got an extensive demo library open to everyone so feel free to pick whichever game strikes your fancy, grab a group, and play. 


Additionally there will be a featured demo of a different game each week, I'll be updating this meetup each week so you guys know what we've got. 


Other than that feel free to use this meetup as a way to organize your own games for Thursday nights, we've got space for everyone and plenty of people already show up so picking up a group should be no problem at all.  Hope to see you there!
results.name: Open Board Game Night

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

SoccerBeyond.com
[masked]


Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

results.description: This group will meet every Thursday night at 7:00 pm at The Immaculate Conception Church. We celebrate a healing Mass followed by adoration of The Blessed Sacrament. We pray for each other and as a group we pray for our spiritual growth and holiness. We forgive, we love, we embrace, we pray and we don't judge. Our goal is keeping the fire of our Lord blazing in our souls and make sure we are helping each other on the road to Heaven. Spiritual talks will be held from time to time. Come, let us pray together We need each other. Heaven is the house of God's family, be one. Love you all.

group.name: Tarrytown Spirituality Meetup/ praying, mediation & healing

results.description:
In this walk & talk we practice & build our flow of resilience and we do it together. It's a mini workshop of 'the I Philosophy'. We like exploring how we can learn from ourselves by challenging our beliefs. And! We think it should be fun and easy a long the way. We meet at Central park at 7pm!

So join us if you'd like to escape your apartment, grow personally and meet some cool people!

Donation-based (suggestion $5)
results.name: Let's meet up and do a 'walk & talk'

results.description: Kirtan is a form of devotional chanting whose roots go back over 500 years to India. It is a form of Bhakti Yoga (yoga of devotion) and has the power to open the heart. Musical instruments and rhythmic drumming accompany the singing and the attendees are encouraged to participate by chanting, clapping and dancing. You will not be able to resist the urge to join in! In its heartfelt expression, kirtan can induce profound states of meditation, bliss and ecstasy. There is a sweet sound vibration that permeates through all layers of coverings and makes God dance. That sound vibration is Kirtan. It is a mysterious connection that draws people to each other.
results.name: Kirtan! Mantra Meditation

group.name: Meditation & Kirtan: For New and Experienced - LES/E.Village

results.description:
Trance Night – An Evening of Music, Trance and Dance for Evolutionary Change

August's Trance Night will be held on Thursday, August 27th at the TRS Professional Suite in Lower Manhattan.

Expect hypnotic stories, Milton Model language patterns and a whole lot of serious fun. December's Trance Night was virtually content free as we used trance dance to celebrate the return of the light at the Winter Solstice. January we focus on the hypnotic and healing power of stories to give our new year resolutions a solid base, firm resolve and a flexible approach at the same time.

You will learn about the power of Neo-Ericksonian Hypnosis because you'll experience it first hand.

Thursday evening, August 27th

TRS Professional Suite, 40 Exchange Place, New York City, NY

7:00pm – 9:00pm

* NOTE – Please arrive EARLY. Consider this a sacred space. Arriving late will disturb the process.

CLICK HERE - ONLY $22 (via PayPal)

Trance Night – As in previous trance nights, the trance induction while lying on the floor will be recorded so attendees can download it later on.

Doug O'Brien
Certified Master Practitioner and Trainer of Neuro-Linguistic Programming; Ericksonian Hypnotherapist
­http://www.dougobrienhypnosis.com
http://www.ericksonian.com

As a Hypnotherapist, Doug helped found the Department of Complementary Medicine at Columbia Presbyterian Hospital in the mid-nineties, under Dr. Mehmet Oz. Doug worked directly with pre-operative and post-operative patients on stress management and pain reduction as well as long term behavioral change to generate healthy living.

Doug O'Brien, is an NLP Master Trainer - originally given that designation by Anthony Robbins over 20 years ago - and is called a modern Shaman by some. He is also a musician and composer and a Trance Master Guide.

He is the guy who gave Tony Robbins an insight that completely changed Tony's approach to his second book (it was going to be called "The Niagara Syndrome" and became, instead, "Awaken the Giant Within")

Doug is the guy who has been the success coach to two of the top internet marketers in the country as well as corporate executives, top musical artists, fashion designers and professional athletes.

He has helped literally tens of thousands of people quit smoking in one session.
He has helped similar numbers lose weight and keep it off through the power of Hypnosis.

He can help YOU, too.

Endorsements/Testimonials
“I have attended all three of Doug’s Trance Night sessions. Each experience has been extremely powerful with noticeable results and the impact has lasted. I am definitely looking forward to attending the future Trance Nights.”
  – Jackie

"Best Meet-up ever.”
  – Kate

“Your Trance Night was a wonderful respite from the world. It was like a vacation from all of the stresses of every day life, a vacation for my soul. It continues to ripple though me today. So glad I came.”

  – Marshall
results.how_to_find_us: please ask at the front desk

results.description:
Last month's Tanith Lee novel was sci-fi, so this month we'll read a fantasy selection from one of the most popular and prolific authors in the genre: Terry Pratchett. Small Gods is a stand-alone entry in the Discworld series, the best-selling fantasy series in the U.K. save for Harry Potter.

Here's the blurb:  "Lost in the chill deeps of space between the galaxies, it sails on forever, a flat, circular world carried on the back of a giant turtle—Discworld—a land where the unexpected can be expected. Where the strangest things happen to the nicest people. Like Brutha, a simple lad who only wants to tend his melon patch. Until one day he hears the voice of a god calling his name. A small god, to be sure. But bossy as Hell."

Hope you can make it!
results.name: Book Discussion: Small Gods, by Terry Pratchett

results.description:
After our last meet up, several of the attendees expressed the desire to make a career transition but also voiced their frustration with the process of figuring out what's next.  Our small group was able to offer suggestions to one another and provide feedback to help guide each other through the process of making a career shift.

Our next event will attempt to build on the success of our first Meet Up.  We will try to leverage the growing size of our Meet Up group and consider how our professional networks might be able to help another group member successfully transition their career.  Members of this group come from a diverse set of professional backgrounds, while some of our group members are trying to leave an industry, it's likely that other group members are considering ways to break into the same industry.  

I invite you to attend our next event with an open mind, and the desire to work together to find solutions to the challenging process of making a career transition.

I look forward to seeing you!

- Rudy
results.how_to_find_us: I will be at the front or at a table. Feel free to call me when you arrive. 516-322-1897
results.name: Executing a Successful Career Transition

results.description:
People Who Get Ahead In Life

Are Those Who Can Communicate Effectively.

Wouldn't You Like To Develop This Priceless Skill?

Now You Can!”

Come to  West Side Talkers  and Get on The Road to Becoming The Best Speaker in Your Neck of the Woods!

Develop your public speaking skills in a Fun, Warm, Friendly and Enthusiastic environment. 

Ralph Waldo Emerson once said, “All great speakers were bad speakers at first”. Emerson was right because great speakers are not born; they are made!

But in order to transform yourself into a great speaker you have to show up! Woody Allen said it best.  "80 percent of success is  just by showing up. " 

West Side Talkers is vibrant toastmasters club that's creative and thinks out-of-the-box. Over the years we have incorporated additional valuable segments that we offer at our club which have been added on top of the already great Toastmasters model. At our club, our members do speeches and we provide constructive evaluations, and we host table topics, thought of the day, word of the day, etc. (These are all part of the Toastmasters model)

At West Side Talkers you will experience everything that a toastmasters club can offer and more. We take all the great things that are in the Toastmasters program and we take it up a few notches (well maybe more than a few!) so that we can bring more value to our members and guests.

Below are the ADDITIONAL ITEMS that we have incorporated into our meeting agenda which add more value to our members speaking development. (not part of the Toastmasters model)

SPEAKING TIP

Where you will pick up a valuable Speaking Tip by a Certified World Class Speaking coach which you can immediately use in your very next speech.

IMPROV COMEDY

As a member of West Side Talkers we take you through "actual" improv exercises to help you develop your emotional expressiveness, characterizations, and your spontaneity in your speaking more quickly and efficiently. Improv can help you FAST TRACK your speaking development and do it WHILE HAVING FUN!

COMMERCIAL MINUTE

IF you were asked at a networking luncheon to get up and talk for 60 seconds about your business and what you do, would you be able to do it effectively? As a member of West Side Talkers we can help you learn how to deliver effective 60 second commercials.

Please contact us via email if you have any questions about our exciting program.

At our “West Side Talkers” Toastmasters public speaking meetings we encourage people to challenge themselves and get up and speak. However, we do not force anyone to do so. You can learn a lot by just attending our meetings. By just coming to our meeting you have made an initial step towards challenging your fears...!!!

So whether you just want to conquer your fear of public speaking or you want to become a Champion Speaker – “West Side Talkers” will help you get there!

If you have ever been to other Toastmasters public speaking clubs, at West Side Talkers, you will experience a Toastmasters club like no other. Come To Our Next West Side Talkers Meeting and Experience it For Yourself!

When:

Thursday August 27th,  2015  7:00pm - 9:00pm

Where:

The Jewish Center 131 West 86th Street, 10th floor (between Columbus and Amsterdam)  New York, NY 10024

Cost:

$6  (this helps cover our overhead)  Pay at Door or Pay online By CLICKING HERE 

Reservation is Required! 

Please RSVP to ([masked] or [masked])

Feel free to suggest some ideas before hand, or even at the meetup itself! This will give us a chance to meet other like minded, folks who share an interest in knives and blade culture.

Please note, i'm asking a $5 fee from members when they show up. This is to help cover the cost of refreshments/snacks. Or, you can bring something, in lieu of the fee, that is cool, too... just please let me know before you arrive. Thanks for understanding!

results.description:
Please join us on Thursday evening for a 6ish mile, casual-pace loop run.

We will meet just inside the 52nd Street entrance to Windmuller Park at 7:15pm and head out for a 6ish mile loop through Woodside, Sunnyside, LIC, and Greenpoint, before returning to the start. We won't set a minimum pace requirement for this run. But, please be sure that you can comfortably run a full 6 miles without stopping before deciding to participate.

For our evening runs, we will wait up to 10 minutes to allow for late-arrivals. This can mean we will wait for 2 minutes or 10. Please be prompt. 

If there is interest after we complete our run, we may venture to a pub for snacks and/or beverages.

results.description:
Volatile, Vulnerable, and Not So Venerable (by Justin Krebs, 8/27/15)


Stocks plunge and rise turbulently,
but the rising stock of Bernie Sanders
and rising shock of Trump staying power
are the more surprising stories of the week.

The global economy's in the headlines,
but our heads and hearts turn to Virginia,
where a senseless horror would stun us
if gun violence weren't so unsurprising.

And while the markets maybe start to settle,
GOP candidates get unsettled
going all out against diplomacy with Iran,
while Biden may shake it all up by going all in.

It's a world that's volatile and vulnerable,
where very little is venerable --
and compared to this week of news,
the stock market actually looks calm.

Escape, elate, revive and relate
over a cold drink in this hot summer
at your local, progressive social club

Join us for our weekly gathering. As your busy week almost comes to an end, unwind with other similar-minded progressives over liberal libations.  

You can find us in the covered upper deck of the backyard -- look for a large banner on the wall, like the one shown above.  The NYC Chapter of Drinking Liberally has been gathering at Rudy's Bar & Grill since our in inception in 2003.
results.name: Weekly Thursday Meetup ("Volatile, Vulnerable, and Not So Venerable")

results.description:
Small group class

For your convenience, KravMaguy is re-starting this weekly Thursday class. To try the first class for FREE, email [masked]. OR pay the $25 class fee and bring a FRIEND for FREE!

Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. KravMaguy offers an authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would-be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of KravMaguy Level One system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

results.description:
Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! We'll be in the cafe. Look for our red Meetup sign. Please feel free to arrive late or leave early. It's great if you can RSVP in advance, but in case you can't, come anyway.

As a reminder, this group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll often have set topics, like gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.description:
If you're Canadian, you may already know that Crokinole is one of our nation's oldest (but also least known) games.

If you don't know the game, then you've been missing out! And it's not too late for you. Crokinole is one of the easiest dexterity games to learn.

It's like a combination of shuffleboard, curling, and billiards - played on a small table-top board. You flick small discs with the aim of knocking off your opponent's pieces and placing yours in good scoring (or snookering) positions.

It's jolly fun and social. We play every week in a great Greenpoint bistro (Milk and Roses). We have the back of the place reserved specifically for us, every Thursday night from 7pm-11:30pm.


Feel free to come anytime. Jump in a game. Watch if you prefer. Drink and food specials for all players ($8 burgers and pasta; $3 beers).

We'll have several boards out (depending on the number of RSVPs).

Good music too, including live piano for a couple of hours (9-11pm).

If you RSVP 'yes,' please make sure you come or change your RSVP to 'no' if your plans change. I bring boards from home, based on the number of people down to play. And as you may know, they're not light. Hence, the importance to me of following through with your RSVP...


Thanks and hope to see you there!
results.name: Crokinole Nights

We're hoping to score a projector + screen for the evening, too. (Got one?) Lower rooftop is accessible by elevator. Closest subway stop: Morgan L.

results.description:
***Note: This event is for experienced players only (NTRP rating 3.0 and above)***


Join us for Summer Tennis at Lincoln Park under lights till 11 pm.

Upon arrival, check in at the Clubhouse before proceeding to the courts.

Please follow these GUIDELINES for an enjoyable tennis session:

1. Members shall meet outside the Clubhouse at the scheduled time.

2. First two to arrive shall reserve a court with the Clubhouse staff.

3. Post the details (court #, names of players) on meetup comments, and then start playing.

4. As more members arrive, they may join in on the posted court# if space is available (max. 4 players per court), while continuing to update the player count on the comments.

5. If the posted court is full, wait till at least one other player arrives, and then reserve a new court. Then repeat from step 3. :-)

Important Information Regarding Court Reservations:

• Reservation is free for Hudson County residents. Those outside of Hudson County may play as guests of the residents to avoid a possible $10 fee.

• Minimum two players must be present to reserve a court.

RSVP Etiquette:

• Please keep your RSVP updated because others are looking to find partners to hit with. Remove your name from the list if you are not planning to attend.

• No shows may be bumped from future events.

Inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

Thank you all for this great group!
results.name: Thursday 8pm Tennis at Lincoln Park - Experienced 3.0+ Players Only
