• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

results.description: Please join us at 8:30 PM est (7:30 PM Central) every fourth Thursday evening for the Citizens Constitutional Caucus Town Hall Conference Call, fielding discussion about current political issues. Don Watson, Moderator of the Citizens Constitutional Caucus will facilitate the call which gives Constitutionalists an opportunity to review pertinent legislation and challenges to the Constitution. This call is designed for all levels of knowledge and everyone is invited to attend. So please call in and join the Conference Call.  If you get a message that the circuits are busy, just keep trying the number and it eventually works. There is no extra charge to participate other than the usual charges by your phone plan for a long distance call. You can even listen in to the conference call while at other events...just hit *6 to mute your phone and you can do two things at once! For more information please see the Citizens Constitutional Caucus web site www.citizensconstitutionalcaucus.com and Meetup group, http://www.meetup.com/Citizens-Constitutional-Caucus.
results.name: Citizens Constitutional Caucus Town Hall Conference Call

results.description:
My friends and I are putting on a new standup show at the awesome new club THE STANDING ROOM. It's an awesome space right on Vernon Blvd and this is a unique new show where comics not only perform, but BS about their act right afterward. It's called STANDUP. RIFF. REPEAT! and it should be a very interactive night before, after, and during the show.

At this unique standup comedy show, the laughs have only just begun after the comic delivers their closer. For a few minutes after each set our hosts will riff with the comedian on their material before moving on to the next performer.

Join us Thursday, August 27th to see NYC's hottest comics bring their A-game and then flex their improv muscles right when they thought their job was done.

This week we'll be riffing on the comedy of:
Moody McCarthy (Letterman, Twice!)
Myka Fox (SNL Contributor)
Adriane Hamilton (Wendy Williams Show, AskHoles)
Eagle Witt (ComplexTV)
Charlie Nadler (Laughing Devil Comedy Fest. Finalist)


***This is our first show at the BEAUTIFUL new Standing Room. The club has been re-modeled and is absolutely gorgeous. The front bar features a fantastic cocktail menu with drinks made by professional mixologists. Tickets are just $5!!!
http://standingroomlic.com/event.cfm?cart&id=410352

When you get there, look for me (Patrick) and introduce yourself. I'll probably be juggling a few tasks to get the show going, but I can certainly introduce other meetup folks and then we can all have a cocktail after the show as well. Hope to see you!
results.name: Go to a new standup show!!

Tonight’s FREE Conference Call in FOUR HOURS!

New August Conference call number and code
(712)[masked]
Access code<a href="https://www.freeconferencecall.com/profile#"></a>[masked] LAST CALL for 3 Month Affordable Mentoring Course! 

We will do one or more FREE Calls new few days, afternoon & evening, (watch for the POST!)

We have 35 Meetup Groups Coast to Coast!


 We will be posting on the Meetup Page! Watch for it!
Thursday will be how we buy foreclosures without using our money or credit or going to the bank.

The first one, Tuesday night, will be about our 3 Month Affordable Coaching & Mentoring Program.
It will be from 8-9pm CST and we will be interacting with our Paid Members who are starting the 3 month program.
We will discuss with them the 100 house rule, and how they will be using it to find off-market deals.
Wholesale Deals, Pre-Foreclosure Deals, Probate Deals, Burned Out Landlord Deals, Lease-Option Deals,
Seller Finance Deals, Subject-to Deals, and Other deals. This is the First Night of a 3 month program.
If you Hurry, and Sign up THIS Week! you can still SAVE $500 on the Program! We also offer a payment plan.
We will be showing our clients how they can do real estate deals with just $10! and we do the negotiation and deal structuring once they have found a viable prospect. They find the deal, we do the Rest!
We have had clients with ZERO Experience, who made over $100,000 their first year! We will be talking about that.
We have had clients who were already experienced, making over ONE Million dollars a year Gross, Who hired us and we helped them make an EXTRA $250,000 Profit. We have over 20 years experience.
We are looking for just a few select individuals who are Coachable, Serious about learning, taking action, and getting deals done! We have people in Texas, NYC, Philadelphia, and ABQ, New Mexico. 
I will be traveling to all of these places and working with them, hands-on, in the field.
Others would charge you $10,000 plus expenses, just to come to your city. I am a buyer.
When one of my client / students brings me the right deal, We will be buying and closing.
We have done almost 250 deals now, without using our money, credit, or going to the bank.
We can show you how we do it. If you become one of our clients.
Your next step? Text me, (affordable in the subject line)
and we make an appointment to see if you qualify?
[masked]
Thank you,
Mark,Group Co-Organizer
Foreclosures 101! Including Short Sales & Bank REO's!

Hello Everyone!

We are making a slight change, and see if we can get our National Short Sale Expert on the call in the next week or two? for now:

READ this article from DS News this July 2014!(Yes, it is dated by one year, & we will talk about that)

Foreclosure-starts-rise-first-time-months

http://dsnews.com/news/07-03-2014/foreclosure-starts-rise-first-time-months

Foreclosures 101!

Learn to locate and purchase properties in all stages of foreclosure (Pre-foreclosure, Short Sale, Auction and REOs). This is a critical skill to have in today's real estate market!


"The Riches are in the Niches!" - that quote is so true! It is impossible to become an expert in everything at once. And trying to do everything at the same time will only dilute your efforts and ultimately frustrate you. What you need is a Focus! But, how do you determine what to Focus on? How do you determine the areas of investing that best suit your resources and goals? That is exactly what the These Real Estate Investing Classes are designed to help you do! Get started right away and start making your Real Estate investments a reality! These classes are specifically designed to give investors the knowledge and tools they need to invest in a particular discipline. They are taught by active investors that live and breathe real estate! Learning from people "in the trenches" sure beats trying to invest out of a book or worse, months of trial and error! Hear about the good, bad and ugly - what really works and how to get started fast!

Since I am doing this from Houston, Texas/8:00pm / central time. My time

IMPORTANT! Email your questions in advance to [masked] Please be on the call 5 minutes early if possible,
And either in a quiet place, or be prepared to mute you phone please.
Please be in quiet place, press star 6, to mute your phone,or be prepared to mute you phone please.Star 6 to unmute / get in the que for a question...
Please be considerate and courteous of others....
All it takes is ONE person to disrupt the call for everyone else.
Please be considerate and courteous of others....

new one to be provided

Please be on the call 5 minutes early if possible,
And either in a quiet place, or be prepared to mute you phone please.
Thank you,

Group Organizer

results.description:
This is a special treat for eastern european/jewish type comedy lovers. Its gonna be a fun meetup at the metropolitan room in Chelsea, if youre not familiar with it its a hip cabaret. The show is headlined by Orange is the new Black Reds husband "Gregory K." Gregory has a lead rom on Orange is the new black and youve seen him on many other things. The show also features the hilarious Al D. (TruTv's Six degrees of everything) and Lenny Marcus (multiple letterman appearances and tonight show). among some others. The tickets are usually 15 - $115 but i have negotiated free adminission for meetup. so hope to see you there it will be fun, i will try to seat all meetup members togethers so they can mingle and share laughs.


Gregory from Russia is Gregory Korostishevsky, a talent as sprawling and unpredictable as the Mother Country. He is one of the most known Russian stand-up comedians and character actors in the United States, who is instantly recognizable from numerous television commercials and stand-up comedy performances. Gregory immigrated to the US from Russia where he was trained in the dramatic arts, but no amount of training could prepare him for the language barrier he faced. So, after recovering from the culture shock and spending a great deal of time to learn English, Gregory resumed his comedy/acting career in America. His character driven stand-up act presents a hilariously clever take on life as a Russian newcomer to the United States. Gregory’s character always brings about the ridiculousness of his situation and sympathy for that situation that goes beyond language. His witty and insightful humor keeps the audience laughing and looking for more.
Gregory is at home in both dramatic and comedic roles. He has appeared on various TV shows including NBC’s “30 Rock”, “Ed” and many times in sketches on “David Letterman” and “Conan O’Brien” shows. He has done more than 60 national commercials including spots for “Time Warner Cable”, “Direct TV”, “Geico”, “Domino’s Pizza”, “Vitamin Water”, “Verizon”, “Oreo’s”, “Amstel-Lite”, “BMW” and a “Sprint” Super Bowl spot. His distinctive voice can be heard on the video games “Bully” and “Grand Theft Auto IV”. Gregory has also appeared in several movies, including the Academy Award- nominated film “Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close”, starring Tom Hanks and Sandra Bullock, “Cold Souls” starring Paul Giamatti, “Two Days in NY” with Chris Rock, “Today’s Special” starring Aasif Mandvi (from the “John Stewart show). Gregory performs in the hottest clubs in NYC and Tri-State area. Based on his stand-up character, the play “Comedy and Crumbcakes” was created, produced and performed at Lincoln Center in NYC.
This what legends of show business say about Gregory Korostishevsky: This what legends of show business say about Gregory Korostishevsky: “…Very funny and clever!” Jackie Mason “…My favorite Russian comedian!” Danny Aiello “…My Latest discovery!” Joe Franklin
results.name: Russian Invasion Comedy Show at Metropolitan room Free admission 2 drink minimum

results.description:
Free Teleclass with Alison: Inherent Conflicts Between Hunters and Gatherers  in Support and Communication - Introduction to the Queen’s Code Workshop: Secrets to Inspiring Men

If you have trouble getting what you need from men, it's not personal. Many women share your frustration, and we can help. Join us for a FREE teleclass and learn about men without driving anywhere. During this one hour seminar-by-phone, we will illuminate your difficulties and immediately get you on the path to more satisfying relationships with men.

DATE: Thursday, August 27th, 9:30pm EST

RSVP: http://myaccount.maestroconference.com/conference/register/7A93PQJDURBELU1

Lines are limited - RSVP even if you can't be on the live call to get access to the recording.

Teleclass participants will be able to save $124 off of the regular price for this workshop, plus receive a free gift with registration. Join Shadee to learn about the barriers that women face in getting what they need, and to take advantage of this special offer.

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include...


30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

This event is officially hosted by The Rise, NYC. They host morning workouts every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday mornings. See them on meetup here:


http://www.meetup.com/The-Rise-NYC/


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Challenge with The Rise

results.description:
RSVP here: https://foundersfriday.splashthat.com

We're back!!! This week, we'll be chatting with Ben Hindman, CEO and Co-Founder of Splash, the country's fastest growing event planning platform. Splash powers events for top brands such as Hennessy, Anheuser Busch, Nike and Oakley, tech giants such as Facebook, Vevo and Spotify, and publishers such as Daily Mail, and Thrillist. Prior to co-founding Splash, Hindman was the Director of Events at Thrillist, where he produced large-scale events from concerts to hotel takeovers to mystery fly-aways. He was recruited to Thrillist after co-founding the Summit Series, an event for the world's leading entrepreneurs. And prior to that, Hindman started and sold DC By Foot, Washington DC's only free walking tour company.

We'll get a chance to hear this Founder's journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Not to mention good coffee, good bagels, and excellent conversation.
results.name: Founders Friday with Ben Hindman, CEO of SPLASH

The basic agenda is...

09:30 to 09:50 Networking

09:50 to 10:10 Introductions

10:10 to 11:00 Current Business Methods

11:00 and on.... Open and Individual Networking

Be ready to discuss your business and be open to hear some new ideas/criticism that will require you to look at yourself/your business differently.

Most people take a few notes, so some paper would be good.

Best Regards,
Steve Navazio

results.description:
You know who this guy is ...

You know what sport he is playing ...

Who know what a set is ...

And you can name the top 10 ATP players ...

You still have summer Fridays (or faking a sick day in summer is easy for you) ...

Then this outing is for you!

Join other tennis addicts to watch the US Open Qualifying Tournament, before the start of the US Open. 

Check out the draws and daily results for the qualifying round: http://www.usopen.org/mobile/en_US/scores/draws/us/index.html

You will be able to say "I was there when he started" ...  you will watch those up-and-comers, who are ranked outside top 100, competing for a few spots to get into the main draw. Who knows though, those top players still need to practice.  

Meet on the 7 line subway, 42nd stop (middle of platform) at 9:00 a.m. 

From there, we will be on time for the opening of the gates at 10 a.m. - entrance is free and open to the public - No ticket is required.

Morning will be to walk around and watch some matches. 

For lunch, either a simple sandwich / snack so you can rush back for more matches. Ready to take your time? the group can take the Train 7 to Flushing for a late 'korean or chinese' lunch around 1pm. 

Recommended donation to cover organization costs of the meetup is $5 (cash at outing or through Chase QuickPay in advance).
results.name: U.S. Open  Qualifying Tournament

results.description:
Classes are created for those with physical disabilities, aliments, recovering from surgery, Seniors OR who are seeking a gentle practice to restore the body and mind.
Classes will include poses and methods that will allow students to increase muscular strength, endurance, flexibility as well as stamina, lung capacity and overall wellness. While experiencing the positive effects Yoga has on the mind-body connection. We will practice our asana's (postures) with the use of a chair. Students can either remain seated through the session or stand and use the back of the chair while standing. Asana's are expressed both ways,so the student can find the expression that works best for their needs.

Postures are modified into variations designed to fit each individuals needs.
Classes will be held in an atmosphere that is extraordinary, surrounded by beautiful stain glass windows inside the actual church. That will complement the tranquility and peace of our practice.These classes have no bearing on religious beliefs and are open to all.
Please join me at The All Saints Episcopal Church 2329 Victory Blvd. Staten Island, N.Y. 10314.

Mondays and Fridays 11:00 am. 

Class fee is $12, or $10 for seniors.
results.name: Chair Yoga Class

Qualifying Tourney runs from August 25th to August 28th.

Admission is free!!  Gate opens at 10 AM.

results.description:
FREE every Friday ......   Grand Central Terminal is truly a work of art, and FULL of New York History.  This year they are celebrating their Centennial Year and are offering daily tours at 12:30 pm  for $15.00. 

There is also a FREE tour that takes place every Friday  at 12:30pm.  This tour has been available for years and years.

 Walking tours are wonderful.  You get some well needed exercise; You engage in conversation with other people; (people on tour are generally friendly and talkative) .....and you learn something new.  An added bonus to the afternoon will be a bite to eat in their "International Food Court".  This has always been a very relaxed place in the mid afternoon.  There is lots of variety so they earn the "International" label.  If you do not want to walk the whole tour .....You can leave the tour and wait for us in the food court.

The first available FREE  Friday for me is August 28th.  Or .....would you prefer a $15.00  tour some afternoon?  Hit me up and let me know what is good for you.

Well the vote is in......we will be touring on Friday August 28th, 2015.  Please plan to join us in the food court after the tour for a little something to eat, or drink, and some socializing...

   Before the tour let us meet with the others taking the tour:  MEETING POINT

Meet in the street-level atrium(behind the GLASS Doors)  at 120 Park Avenue, located at the southwest corner of East 42nd St and Park Ave directly across from Grand Central Terminal.  I will wear my Neon ORANGE head band with the orange flower and ribbons.....See you there.

.
results.name: TOUR:   "Grand Central Terminal Tour"

results.description:
The Jalopy Chorus is a vocal ensemble taking residency at the Jalopy Theatre, led by Musical Director Eva Salina. The chorus will explore a variety of harmony styles, including American and Irish folk, old time, bluegrass, Balkan, and various other Eastern European harmony traditions, sung both a cappella and accompanied. The choir is a select mixed-voice ensemble that will perform each season at the Jalopy Theatre. FALL 2015 SEASON:
The chorus will meet from 5.30pm-7pm every Monday starting Monday, September 21 - Monday, November 22 at the Jalopy Theatre (9 sessions). There will be no rehearsal on Monday, October 12 - Columbus Day. DUES
$130 for new members (includes song book) AUDITIONS:
The Jalopy Chorus is seeking experienced and enthusiastic singers who are passionate about the styles of music covered and who can blend well, be comfortable singing complex harmonies, enjoy supporting others through ensemble singing but are also able to sing solo when needed. Singers who can accompany the choir on an instrument are encouraged to apply. Long-term commitment beyond the Spring season is recommended. AUDITION DATES:
Saturday, August 29 and Sunday, August 30 from 11.30am-2pm, and Monday, August 31 from 5-7pm. Location, upstairs at Jalopy Theatre.

PREPARATION: Sing one prepared solo piece in folk, old time, bluegrass, or Balkan/East European style and undertake a harmony exercise. RSVP: Olivia Lynch at [masked] to arrange a 10-minute audition.
results.name: OPEN CALL FOR AUDITIONS: JOIN THE FALL SEASON OF THE JALOPY CHORUS

results.description:
Join us for three days of life changing adventure at magical Pumpkin Hollow Retreat Center. What a delight to start a morning with sunrise mediation and gentle yoga practice followed by delicious healthy breakfast. Make sure you bring your swimwear for a natural water pool and get ready for the most amazing dancing experience (we have surprises for you). You will absolutely love our group coaching workshop and a company of awesome people!

Pumpkin Hollow Retreat Center is situated on a 130 acres of land. The property is surrounded by beautiful green forest, waterfall, natural spring. We will be able to harvest our own food from the retreat centers organic garden and learn how to prepare delicious healing meals.

Space is limited. Please, Register Here : https://joywithin.eventbrite.com

Come with an open heart and mind. We are looking forward to create this experience with you!

----------------------------------
To get to know magical Pumkin Hollow Retreat Center

visit: www.pumpkinhollow.org

--------------------------------
What others say about our work:

"This is a program which treats the body and mind as a whole--and it has been more empowering than any therapist or book I have ever encountered". Simon P.

"I totally enjoyed spending time with you. You gave me the tools i was looking for at this point of my life, you were a great help with your knowledge, ability to share and listen". Sophie D.

"I learned more than I thought I would, and I finally understood how important the mind-body connection is in this journey". Ann A.

"amazing" Terry B.

"Had an amazing time! made all the difference.i have learned that It’s not just about eating better, rather about being in tune with your body, knowing your body and keeping it in balance". Ava D.

"Really great time! Met a new friend" - Elisa A.

"What a great experience! Just what I needed. I realized I have been hibernating with worry. Thanks for all the great suggestions" Michelle W.
results.name: JOY WITHIN WEEKEND RETREAT - yoga, dance, meditation, nature & friends.

venue.name: Art of Living New York Center

results.description:
Living in a city where one is constantly ‘on’ and looking to do more and more, a workshop that will recharge you and open you up to tap into a practical way to refresh every day, so you can do more of the things you love doing.

Each one of us possesses the ability to calm the mind and recharge the body within minutes. The secret lies in the breath. 

This 60 min workshop is an introduction to the Art of Living Happiness Program.  We will explore breath and meditation as well as other tools which are taught on the Happiness Program. 

When: Thursdays at 1pm.  Please arrive early for seating and registration

No need to bring anything but yourself – Yoga mats, water, back-jacks, pillows and blankets are all supplied at the center.

No fees for Newbees

Repeater fee-$10(Cash only)

group.name: 20-30's Women, See & Be Seen, making a Difference

results.description:
Join us for three days of life changing adventure at magical Pumpkin Hollow Retreat Center. What a delight to start a morning with sunrise mediation and gentle yoga practice followed by delicious healthy breakfast. Make sure you bring your swimwear for a natural water pool and get ready for the most amazing dancing experience (we have surprises for you). You will absolutely love our group coaching workshop and a company of awesome people!

Pumpkin Hollow Retreat Center is situated on a 130 acres of land. The property is surrounded by beautiful green forest, waterfall, natural spring. We will be able to harvest our own food from the retreat centers organic garden and learn how to prepare delicious healing meals.

Space is limited. Please, Register Here : https://joywithin.eventbrite.com

Come with an open heart and mind. We are looking forward to create this experience with you!

----------------------------------
To get to know magical Pumkin Hollow Retreat Center

visit: www.pumpkinhollow.org

--------------------------------
What others say about our work:

"This is a program which treats the body and mind as a whole--and it has been more empowering than any therapist or book I have ever encountered". Simon P.

"I totally enjoyed spending time with you. You gave me the tools i was looking for at this point of my life, you were a great help with your knowledge, ability to share and listen". Sophie D.

"I learned more than I thought I would, and I finally understood how important the mind-body connection is in this journey". Ann A.

"amazing" Terry B.

"Had an amazing time! made all the difference.i have learned that It’s not just about eating better, rather about being in tune with your body, knowing your body and keeping it in balance". Ava D.

"Really great time! Met a new friend" - Elisa A.

"What a great experience! Just what I needed. I realized I have been hibernating with worry. Thanks for all the great suggestions" Michelle W.

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
